loans.name: Bilqees

texts.en: Bilqees is a 36-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years.  She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family.  However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers.  For this reason she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation.  She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors, packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.  These items will allow her to create a means of increasing revenues and generate a healthier source of income.  She is in her 3rd loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors and packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en: Sughran is a 44-year-old married woman. For about three years, she has been doing hand embroidery work. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her continue her operations, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors, packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment.  This way, she will be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors, packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Anara

texts.en:
Anara, 48 years old, is a rural woman from the remote village of Bagnan in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is married and blessed with two sons who are students in grades 10 and 11, respectively.  Though Anara and her husband both are uneducated, they are trying their best to provide an education to their sons. They live in their own house.

Anara’s husband has been associated with a dried fish selling business for the last five years. He purchases from the wholesale market and sells in their locality to their neighbors and passersby. He is the only source of income for the family.   Of late, his family's expenses have increased due to the rapid price increase for essential commodities.  Thus, he can hardly cover the basic needs of his family and, at the same time, meet the educational expenses of his sons. Now they want to expand this business by investing more capital.

Anara has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to purchase more dried fish for her husband's business. The dried fish is in great demand in their locality because the poor residents of their area consume a lot of dried fish.  So, they hope this will be a profitable business and will generate additional profit. Anara hopes to carry on this business for a secure future.

She is grateful to both Kiva and BJS for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish to expand her existing business.

loans.name: Sharifan

texts.en: Sharifan is a 52-year-old married lady who has run a small general store in her community for many years with the support of her husband (also shown in the photo).  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To make sure her store is fully stocked, she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates.  This way, she will be able to meet increasing demands consistently. Sharifan wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en: Perveen, age 40, is a married woman.  She deals in the business of selling animals with the support of her husband. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 25-year-old, married woman.  She has been involved in a business selling blankets and bedspreads in her locale for a period of about two years.  She always has a great collection to offer to her customers and earns a good income to contribute to the family income. 

Currently, Nasreen requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a new variety of blankets, bed covers and spreads. She plans to take into account the tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through greater sales.  She is in her 3rd loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy a new variety of blankets, bed covers and spreads.

loans.name: Hajran

texts.en: Hajran is a 58-year-old married woman. For about six years, she has been doing hand embroidery work. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her continue her operations, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors, packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. This way, she will be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful of getting an increase in her income by targeting more customers. She is in her fifth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors, packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Yeakin

texts.en:
Meet Yeakin. She is a 50-year-old from Waterloo, Western rural in Freetown in Sierra Leone. She is married with four children. For the past 30 years, Yeakin has established her palm vine business. She began her business because she wanted to empower herself. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 5:30 pm, six days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and proper business location.

Yeakin requires a loan in order to purchase more palm vines to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Yeakin plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm vines to expand her business

loans.name: Arati

texts.en:
Arati is a 28-year-old woman from the remote village of Bagnan in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. Her family consists of her husband and two school-going children (one son and one daughter).  They are in grades 6 and 4.  Both Arati and her husband Dulal, 48 years old, have an elementary education. They live in their own kachha house (made of mud, bamboo and straw).

Arati is a housewife and her husband is involved in a small business. His children and wife are his main priority in life, so he tries hard to give them a better lifestyle.  But his income is hardly enough to cover all the household expenses.  Arati is a young energetic and optimistic woman. She has decided to help her husband financially by doing something of her own. She has decided to grow banana plants on their plot of land. She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She intends to buy saplings of banana plants, fertilizers and pesticides to cultivate bananas. With this new sowing of crops, she hopes to have additional income in order to improve the living conditions of her family and to give a good education to her children to make them professional in the future.

She is thankful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase banana saplings

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en: Kalsoom, age 53, is a married woman. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Kalsoom has applied for a loan of PKR 50,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Kalsoom is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some auto spare parts.

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Gita is a rural housewife from the small village of Baroghoria in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She lives with her husband and only son in their own kachha house (made of mud, wood, bamboo and straw).  Both she and her husband Suresh, 52 years old, are illiterate, but they are providing an education to their only son despite their financial stringency.

Gita's husband is a hard-working farmer who lives and works in his farmland and grows different vegetables. He sells his produce to his neighbors. In doing this, he can barely manage the household expenses of his family.  He is the main breadwinner in his family.  Gita is a hardworking and ambitious woman. In order to give the family financial assistance, she runs an animal husbandry business. She loves dairy farming the most. But now she wants to expand her business by purchasing one more dairy cow to strengthen her family's financial condition.

She has taken a loan from BJS because she heard they work with rural women to provide them with asset finance. She will use the loan to purchase a cow from which she will get more milk to supply and earn more profit. She hopes it will help her to sustain her family.

She aspires to build a cattle herd in the future with the profit generated from this business.

She is thankful to BJS as well as to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Amena

texts.en:
Amena is a 43-year-old married woman and her husband is 46 years old. She and her husband are illiterate and only able to sign their names. Amena is a housewife and her husband is a farmer. She has two children. One of her children is pursuing her bachelor's degree while the other is working as a mason. She lives in the small town of Maynaguri. 

Being a farmer, Amena’s husband cultivates different varieties of vegetables and crops but his income is inconsistent. That is why his son is engaged in masonry work to contribute to the family. Now, Amena has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) of INR 15,000 so that she can grow maize in their own field.  For better quality maize, better fertilizer, pesticide etc. are required. With this money, she will purchase maize seeds and fertilizers to grow better quality maize to sell in the local market. She hopes this business will improve her financial condition. Amena is thankful to BJS and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers to cultivate maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchasing more fish and cooking seasoning to expand her business.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine lives in the beautiful village Aghavnavank in Tavush region. She says her native village is a perfect place for farming, since pastures here are plentiful and full of green and luscious grass. Since she was a very young girl she has been engaged in farming and agriculture with her parents. Now she continues with her husband and children. 

Narine has a daughter and a son. Her husband is a constructer and he does different hired works in his village. In her farm, Narine has five cows, two piglets, 15 chickens and a large plot of land which serves her family as a source of fresh, pure and healthy vegetables (potatoes, beans, cucumber, tomatoes) and fruits (apples, plums, pears, etc.). All her farm goods (dairy products, meat, eggs, vegetables and fruits) she sells to re-sellers as well as using for her family to provide them with wholesome and mellow vegetables and fruits. 

Narine needs a loan in order to make her farm bigger and to buy two bulls and animal fodder. She hopes that with the help of this loan, her family income will increase and it will become easier for her to pay for her daughter’s tuition fees.

loans.use: to make her farm bigger and to buy two bulls and animal fodder.

loans.name: Ramela

texts.en:
Ramela lives with her family in Angeghakot village in the Syunik region of Armenia. Ramela and her husband are unemployed and the main income for their family comes from the family's farming business. They keep cattle and cultivate land. Their agro machinery is very old and often breaks down. So, Ramela has applied for this loan of 3,000 USD. With the help of this loan, Ramela and her husband will be able to fix the machinery and buy diesel fuel, tires and four oxen for their farm.

The whole family waits for your support.

loans.use: to pay for four oxen, fuel and tires for her agro machinery.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is 48 years old and she lives in Dilijan city. Now she lives alone. Her two children are already married and they live separately with their families. Irina’s son now lives in the Russian Federation with his family. Her daughter lives in Ijevan city. Irina has a higher education and for several years she worked as an HR department inspector, then she worked as a chief accountant on the wholesale market. Now she works at the Ministry of Defence as a Chemist Instructor. For a woman, this kind of work is very hard and full of responsibilities, but she overcomes all the hardships perfectly.

Irina wants to give a great surprise to her daughter with the help of a 500,000 AMD loan. She hopes to receive this as she wants to buy living room furniture and give a great present to her lovely daughter.

loans.use: to buy living room furniture and give a great present to her lovely daughter

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is a 36-year-old vigorous lady; she has been involved in the business of tailoring for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. 

For this reason, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenue so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 4th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana lives in Kapan city, Syunik region. After school, she graduated from the College of Music, but she never worked as a musician. For several years she worked at the factory as a worker, and then she had her clothes trading small business. Now, for six years already, she has had another business. In a small space of her own, she sells a great range of flowers, which she buys from the local flower wholesale market nearly every day. She considers this business rather profitable since thanks to this business, she manages to solve her financial problems and also to provide for her three children, who are already married, and their families.

Now, Svetlana asks for a loan of 600,000 AMD in order to buy a lot of different flowers and some other materials for making nice bouquets. She is sure that with the coming of spring, she will have good sales of flowers from her shop.

loans.use: to buy a lot of different flowers and some other materials for making nice bouquets.

loans.name: Radica

texts.en:
Radica is 52 years old and lives in a small village with her husband and their three sons. She and her husband plant corn, wheat, and sunflowers that they sell in order to make a living and also consume for nutrition and to save on expenses. They are able to do this work with the help of a tractor, but the tools and tractor are getting damaged and worn from all the work they do over the years. 

She is now requesting a loan in order to purchase new tools so that they can continue to work and generate income. They hope that they will give their children a better education that they can pay for in the city, which will provide better opportunities for their futures. She is very grateful for the help and thanks all of the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new agricultural tools so that they can continue to work and generate income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and foliar fertilizer for her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Hajredin

texts.en:
Hajredin is a single 21-year-old male who lives with his entire family in a village. He is very hard-working and enjoys keeping busy and contributing to his family. Right now, he works in construction and also is involved in agriculture. He is also planning on starting a business selling calves after he raises them for some profit. 

His father has been engaged in agriculture for many years and has much experience with raising calves and cows, so he will be getting assistance and advice from him to make things run smoothly. He would like to be able to build a stable for the calves and to install a water system for them inside the stable, so he is requesting a loan. 

He hopes that the business is profitable and he will be able to save money for his future. His goal is to be able to finish his university and start another business. He is very grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to build a stable for the calves and to install a water system for them

loans.name: Tacy

texts.en:
Tacy is a Brazilian artisan who specializes in leather handicrafts, including handbags and belts. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of leather.

Tacy has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is his story:

The father of two sons, Tacy is a sensitive man with a passion for life. He has been married to Rosimar for more than 40 years, and they work together in the workshop they have built at home. "What I love most about working from home is that I get to spend time with my family, guiding my sons and teaching them life's true values. I am so proud of them! What I do brings me great joy and pleasure. I create things that are different. I'm not interested in designing the standard handbag, so I look for inspiration in nature. By observing the tranquility and calm of a resting alligator, or the patience and long life of turtles, I start transforming leather into bags that replicate these animals. I enjoy the handcrafting process, and I aim to preserve this serene way of working. I'm not tempted to mass produce, as if I were a factory."

"I would like to thank you with all my heart for this microcredit. It's a good support and incentive to keep me working. Muito obrigado."

Use the link below to view Tacy's leather accessories on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7894

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of leather

loans.name: Buana

texts.en:
Buana is a Balinese artisan who specializes in handcrafted jewelry. He would like to invest in a purchase of natural gemstones and silver.

Buana has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is his story:

"I've been surrounded by handicrafts all my life. I am thankful to God for giving me such a great gift so I can make a living for my family, enough for our simple way of life."

"I am so grateful to be included in this program and for your microcredit, because you make it possible for me to build up my stock of finished products. Your microcredit means I will be able to grow my business and offer work opportunities to silversmiths in my area, and at better salaries. God bless you."

Use the link below to view Buana's handmade jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/5503

loans.use: to invest in a purchase of natural gemstones and silver for his jewelry

loans.name: Clara Ynes

texts.es:
Clara es una mujer pujante y trabajadora de 40 años de edad, 10 de ellos dedicados a la venta de mercancía por catálogo, actividad que le genera ingresos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y para brindar educación a sus dos hijos adolescentes.
Sus clientes son vecinos, familiares, amigos y personas en otras zonas de difícil acceso, sin embargo trabaja con ánimo y entusiasmo, pues esto le permite estar pendiente de su hogar y dedicarle más tiempo a su familia.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercancía como ropa, perfumería y accesorios, con el fin de aprovechar las temporadas especiales que se acercan; lo que le permitirá tener mayor disponibilidad de artículos y una variedad para satisfacer los gustos de su clientela, incrementando así los ingresos que obtiene con su labor.
Clara sueña con adquirir una casa propia en la que pueda brindar un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida a su familia, además desea brindar una educación de calidad a sus hijos para que sean profesionales íntegros y exitosos.
texts.en:
Clara is a strong and hardworking 40-year-old woman. She has spent 10 of those years selling merchandise through a catalog- work that generates enough income to help her husband with the household expenses and to put her two teenage children through school.

Her customers are neighbors, relatives, friends and people who live in hard-to-reach areas; however, she does her work with enthusiasm and a positive attitude. This enables her to stay close to home and spend more time with her family.

She will invest the loan that she is requesting in the purchase of merchandise like clothing, perfume and accessories, with the aim of taking advantage of the special seasons that are coming up. This will enable her to have a greater availability and variety of items to satisfy her customers' tastes, thereby increasing the earnings that she obtains with her work.

Clara dreams of acquiring her own house where she can offer greater well-being and quality of life to her family. In addition, she wants to give her children a quality education so that they can be honorable and successful professionals.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like clothing, perfume and accessories in order to take advantage of seasonal demand

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo is a Guatemalan artisan who specializes in handcrafted jade and sterling silver jewelry. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of natural jade and fine silver.

Pablo has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is his story:

Pablo dreamed of being an artisan since he was a little boy. "My first piece of traditional silverwork was a Maya design bracelet with quetzal birds, crafted when I was 11. Today, I dream of being able to pass on to my daughter an art that has been in our family for several generations."

"Thank you very much for your microcredit. It is very difficult for us artisans to have enough capital to invest in our own businesses. Your microcredit represents an easier and much safer way to do it. Thank you for your trust."

Use the link below to view Pablo's handcrafted jade and sterling silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7987

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of natural jade and fine silver for his jewelry

loans.name: Roberto Eduardo

texts.es: El señor Roberto, a puesto todo su empeño en mejorar su vivienda, con ayuda de su esposa quien es comerciante de frutas y verduras, el por su parte es dueño de un Taxi que el mismo lo trabaja, este credito lo esta solicitando para la compra de Cemento, Ceramica, Pintura para pintar la casa, el esta muy emosionado ya que sus hijos gozaran de mayores condiciones, agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y fondos Kiva le estan brindando.
texts.en: Roberto has put all of his effort into improving his home, with the help of his wife who is a fruit and vegetable seller.  He is the owner and operator of a taxi.  The loan that he is requesting is to buy cement, ceramics, and paint to paint the house.  He is very emotional because his children are enjoying better conditions.  He is grateful for the support that Afodenic and Kiva lenders are providing to him.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Greetings from Jui, a rural district in the eastern part of Freetown in Sierra Leone. This is Marie, a 50-year-old married woman. Marie’s children are now grown (her youngest child is 19 years old), but she still provides some support to them and to members of her extended family.

Marie is a successful and hardworking borrower with BRAC Sierra Leone, having previously repaid 4 loans. She began her business more than ten years ago to better provide for her family. She works more than 10 hours a day, 7 days a week, selling assorted foodstuffs at a local market. While her business is going well, she sometimes enters difficult periods when sales are low.

The foodstuffs that Marie sells provide the building blocks for the meals made by local families in the area. The foodstuffs include pepper, onions, maggi chilli, salt, fish, and groundnuts. Marie is taking out this loan to buy more stock for her business.

Marie is grateful to BRAC Sierra Leone and Kiva for their support. Her big dream is to build her business so that her grandchildren can enjoy a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs (such as onions, sardines, and peppers) to sell to passersby in a busy market

loans.name: Levy William

texts.es:
Levy tiene 37 años de edad, sus padres eran de muy escasos recursos por lo que solo pudo estudiar hasta sexto grado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y agricultura, tiene 4 hijos y algunos están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad. 

Levy se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de ganado bovino, lo aprendió desde muy pequeño, actualmente se dedica a cultivar 2 hectáreas de maíz en la época de invierno, todos los días desde muy temprano se dirige a su lugar de trabajo a un kilómetro de distancia de su casa, esto lo hace hasta el mediodía, luego se dirige donde tiene su ganado para poder cuidarlo, en ocasiones su esposa le ayuda a trabajar en la agricultura y se ahorran el pago de mozo. 

El crédito será utilizado para el pago de arrendamiento de las tierras agrícolas y ademas para comprar una vaca lechera para tener otro ingreso para su familia.

Él espera para un futuro que sus hijos puedan estudiar y alcancen un buen nivel académico para que tengan mejores oportunidades de trabajo, y seguir trabajando para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Levy is 37 years old. His parents had few resources, and because of this he was only able to stay in school through sixth grade. His wife works in agriculture and does housework. He has 4 children, and some of them study in the community's school.

Levy works in agriculture and raising cattle. He learned this when he was very young; currently, he cultivates 2 hectares of corn in the winter season. Very early every day, he goes to his workplace about one kilometer from his house. He works until noon; later, he goes to the place where he has his cattle to care for them. At times, his wife helps him with the farmwork, which saves them paying for a worker.

The loan will be used to pay for the lease of his farmland, and also to purchase a milk cow in order to have another income for his family.

He hopes that in the future, his children will be able to study and reach a good level of education so that they can have better work opportunities, and that he will continue working to obtain better earnings.

loans.use: to pay the lease for his farmland and to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Alba Lucia

texts.es: Alba es una señora trabajadora de 37 años de edad, es casada y tiene  5 hijos de los cuales 2 se encuentran asistiendo a la escuela, 2 al colegio y el joven de 18 años no vive con ella ya que se fue a vivir con su abuelita para minorar los gastos de su madre Alba, esta señora se dedica a criar chanchos y a vender papas asadas en el parque de la localidad donde vive, su esposo trabaja  en una empresa privada, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para criarlos y de ahí obtener una utilidad y con esto cubrir los gastos de alimento, salud y educación de sus hijos  de los que aspira hacer unos profesionales para que no tengan que vivir la experiencia de Alba.
texts.en:
Alba is a hardworking woman of 37. She is married and has 5 children, 2 of whom are in primary school and 2 in high school. Her 18-year-old son doesn't live with her, as he went to live with his grandma to decrease his mother, Alba's, expenses.

Alba works raising pigs and selling roasted potatoes in the park of the town where she lives. Her husband works for a private company.

She is going to invest the loan in the purchase of pigs in order to raise them, and from there, make a profit. With this, she will cover the cost of food, healthcare, and schooling for her children, who she hopes will be professionals, so that they don't have to live the same experience as Alba.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Please meet Ramatu, a local businesswoman from Jui, which is a rural district in Eastern Freetown. Ramatu is married to a civil servant. Together they have 2 children. Their oldest child is 12, and their youngest child is 3. Ramatu also cares for a relative in her extended family.

Ramatu began her business more than 6 years ago to ensure that she could take care of her family. She sells various grocery products (drinks, Saba washing powder, Ovaltine, cigarettes, biscuits) in a little stall. She is taking out this loan so that she can buy more stock for her business.

Ramatu hopes that her business will grow in the future and is motivated by the wish to look after her little family. She thanks BRAC Sierra Leone for the support they have provided to women in her village. She also thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her little grocery stall

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Welcome to Jui, a quiet rural district east of busy Freetown. This is Isatu, a mother of 3 children and a hardworking businesswoman. Isatu is married to a local contractor. Their children are aged between 9 and 25 years old, and they also care for a relative in their extended family.

Isatu first started her business more than 4 years ago to help her family progress and to ensure her children a certain standard of living. She has built up a business selling general groceries and bags of cement. Many businesses in Sierra Leone operate on this basis; a customer might come to the shop to buy cement but will then leave having purchased some other things as well. Isatu works hard, 9 hours a day, 7 days a week. While she is proud of her business, she is sometimes challenged by slow sales.

Isatu is taking out this loan to buy more stock for her business. She would like to increase her business capital and eventually open a larger store. She says a big thank you to BRAC Sierra Leone and to the Kiva lenders for their support. She is confident that she will not disappoint them.

loans.use: to sell bags of cement and general groceries to her customers

loans.name: Aduri

texts.en:
Aduri is a 29-year-old married, uneducated woman who knows how to sign her name.  Her family consists of her husband and three children (one son and two daughters).  All are students and read in grades 1, 2 and 5 respectively.  Her husband Gopal, 33 years old, works in a sweetmeat shop.  They live in Raypara in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri in their own house.

Aduri's husband's income does not provide a decent lifestyle for the family or cover all the needs of his family. So, Aduri is involved in an animal husbandry business. She is a hardworking, optimistic woman and wants to get ahead in her life.  She manages her animal husbandry business after taking care of her children and husband and doing all the household jobs.  Thanks to her hard work, she now has one milk cow and two goats.  She sells milk from the cow to the neighbors in her locality.  She raises goats and sells them in the market.  Now she wants to expand her business for the family's betterment.

She has taken a loan from BJS to purchase one more goat to expand her livestock activities and increase her income.  To meet the needs of her kids' schooling and have better family economy, she wants to scale up the number of her goats.

She wants to expand the goat raising activity to widen their existing portfolio to generate additional income to meet their education and reinvestment needs.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase goats to raise and sell

loans.name: Anjuman

texts.en:
Anjuman is from the small village of Magurmari in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is 42 years old.  There she lives with her husband Bablu and three children (two sons and one daughter).  Anjuman and her husband both are uneducated and can only sign their names, but they are very much concerned about their children's education. The children read in grade 7, grade 6 and grade 5, respectively.

Anjuman's husband is an enthusiastic farmer who takes care of his small farm with great love and care.  He cultivates potatoes, cabbages and tomatoes and sells the gathered harvest locally.  Anjuman is a housewife, so they have no other alternative source of income. The only source is their agribusiness.

Therefore, Anjuman has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to help her husband to expand his business in order to make more profit.  She will use the total loan to purchase potato seeds for cultivation. The product is in good demand in the market, so they think it will be a profitable business and thus will generate much profit.

Anjuman hopes that the additional income will help her to give a decent lifestyle to the family, give good education to her children and upgrade their house to a concrete-made house.

Anjuman and her husband are thankful to the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Jhon Jairo

texts.es: Jhon es un joven soltero de 19 años de edad, él vino de Colombia a vivir a la ciudad de Huaca ya que dice que en su país no encontraba trabajo y que su madre trabajaba de empleada domestica y le pagaban muy poco y no les alcanzaba para sobrevivir, fue de ahí que decidieron venir a Ecuador y aquí Jhon se dedica a comercializar chanchos, el crédito lo va a invertir para comprar estos animales,  dice que los adquiere en el transcurso de lunes a viernes y que los vende en la feria de chanchos los fines de semana, Jhon tiene muchos deseos de superación y le gustaría mejorar su negocio para apoyar en lo que más pueda a su madre ya que vive con ella y con un hermano de 8 años que asiste a la escuela.
texts.en:
19-year old Jhon is single. He moved from Columbia to the town of Huaca as he says there was no work for him back home. Also his mother was working as a servant and was paid very little so it was hard to survive. They decided to come to Ecuador where Jhon sells pigs. With the loan money he plans to buy more pigs. He obtains them during the week and then sells them at pig markets at the weekend.

Jhon is eager to get on in life and would like to improve his business and help his mother in any way he can as he lives with her and an 8-year old brother who attends school.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replace diesel power generators with solar plants for uninterrupted access to clean water.

loans.name: Deepak

texts.en:
Deepak, 23, understands what to do in life. What he understands even better is the market needs of the nearby town. He lives in Deosangh village in Jharkhand, the eastern state in India. His village is not far from Deogargh, which is home to some famous temples. In India, a visit to a temple is mostly followed by buying sweets for the family, relatives and friends. As many people from various parts of India visit Deogargh as religious tourists, the local confectionery is always in demand, which automatically creates a need for milk, as most sweets in India are milk based. Deepak is cashing in on this opportunity. The family has started their own dairy farm.
   
Deepak is married and the father of two girls. His wife also helps him in the expanding business. The family farm consists of five buffaloes, two cows and five calves. He sells 30 liters of milk on average and earns a profit of INR 500-600 per day. 

Deepak bought a used motorcycle to carry milk to Deoghar town because his village is far away from the town. He wants to expand his business and he is now looking for various other marketing opportunities in the industry. 

The loan will be used to buy more cattle and to expand his farm. He hopes to save enough money to educate his daughters in a college.

loans.use: to buy more cattle

loans.name: Pakija

texts.en:
Bhojpur is a big village on the borders of the eastern state of Jharkhand. In this village, people are engaged in different kinds of work but more famous for being blacksmiths. 

Pakija, 35, is married and a mother of three sons (two of them appear in the picture), all going to public school. Pakija means pure. Pakija was just a housewife taking care of her family and the cows and buffalo they own. After joining a Self-Help Group (SHG) supported by the local NGO “MESP”, she came up with the idea of starting her own tailoring business and contributing to their family income.  

Her business is doing so well that she had to employ three more people. Pakija is a hard working woman with a vision for business and concern for clients. Always, always delivering on time is part of her success. She earns around INR 10,000-12,000 per month. 

With this loan, she wants to grow her tailoring business by employing more women. Pakija believes that every woman in her village should have the opportunity she had.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Please meet Mariama. Mariama is from a farming district in Jui, a rural area east of busy Freetown. 

Mariama is married to a local civil servant. They have five children, aged between twelve and twenty-eight. Four of their children are at school. Mariama also provides support to another member of her extended family. Mariama is lucky to have the support of her husband in caring for her children. He is however an amputee which has presented some earning challenges. Mariama began her business over 10 years ago to ensure that her family could be taken care of in these circumstances.  

Mariama sells coal, which is placed in bags and covered with palm leaves to keep the bags stable before they are sold to customers. Mariama works hard, sometimes for eleven hours a day, seven days a week. Whilst her business is going well, sometimes Mariama cannot afford to buy more stock to meet the needs of her customers. 

Mariama would like this loan to buy more stock for her business. Mariama’s hard work is demonstrated by that fact that she has previously taken out and repaid five loans with BRAC Sierra Leone. She is motivated by the idea of providing a comfortable life and said to say thanks to Kiva people for their goodness and support of her family.

loans.use: buy more coal to resell

loans.name: Greens Huligemma Group

texts.en:
Savita could not attend school due to her financial constraints. She is illiterate, but dreams of providing a good education to her three daughters who are in seventh, fifth and third grade and her son who is in second grade.
 
Her business is her only hope to make this dream come true. Savita works as a day laborer in the agriculture fields. Savita wants to bring more stability to her family. Hence, she is planning to start a sheep and goat raising farm. With the loan, she will be able to buy goats and lambs, raise them and sell them in the market. She inspires other members in her group to work harder for a better future.
 
Savita, Bagavva, Geeta, Muthravva and Bharavva are members of “Greens Huligemma” Joint Liability Group (JLG), hailing from Jalihala village, Bagalkot in Karnatka. All of these women want to start a small husbandry farm to support their families. Savita is the leader of this group. She is standing with her hand raised in the photo.
.
The loan will help the women in the group to improve their standard of living and to provide better health and education to their children. The additional capital combined with the monthly educational training conducted on effective business administration and budgeting offered by Future Greens, a local NGO, give these women real tools to empower themselves.

loans.use: to buy goats, lambs and rams

loans.name: Maruteshwara - Bandhkeri Group

texts.en:
Vijayalakshmi has those selfless leadership qualities.  At the age of 26, she has decided to take charge of her life along with those who stand with her. She is the leader of a women's joint liability group called Maruteshwara. All the women in the group live in the Bandhkeri village in the Bagalkot district, Karnataka. Her name is inspired by the Hindu goddess of victory - Vijayalakshmi.  The group, under her leadership, has jelled well and, apart from sharing their rituals and festivals, they share the dreams of a better tomorrow.
 
Vijayalakshmi is an agricultural laborer, but that is not where she aims to be for the rest of her life. She has started her own sheep and goat farm. A local NGO 'MESP’ has trained her in modern and scientific practices of livestock business. Vijayalakshmi purchases lamb and goats from the market, raises them for 8 – 9 months with regular vaccinations and checkups from veterinarians.  Once the livestock is ready, she sells in to the local buyers. 
Every day in the morning, Vijayalakshmi takes the goats to graze in the fields. Her husband helps her sell and maintain the livestock. 

Vijayalakshmi lives with her husband and three children who are studying in a government run school. Her husband works in the agriculture fields and earns INR 150 per day. They are living in a hut due to their economic condition. 

Vijayalakshmi has a plan to purchase more livestock so that she can expand her business. For this reason, she is requesting this loan. With the new profit, she hopes to save more, construct a better house and provide a higher education to her children. She is very happy and grateful to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy goats and lambs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ten sacks of compost for his crops.

loans.name: Rosa Miriam

texts.es: Rosa tiene 45 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y su pequeño nieto de 11 años de edad. Rosa tiene una pequeña granja de pollos la cual es muy importante ya que es una de sus principales fuentes de ingresos. Tiene 5 años de experiencia en el negocio y ya cuenta con muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Rosa desea invertir en su negocio dado que desea mantenerlo por mucho más tiempo y seguir apoyando a su familia. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de 100 pollo, vacunas y concentrado.
texts.en:
Rosa, 45, lives in her own house with her husband and 11-year-old grandson.  She has a small chicken farm which is very important because it is one of the main sources of income.  She has been in business for five years and says there are many customers who prefer her business to others.

Rosa wants to keep her business going so she can support her family.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy 100 chickens, vaccine and animal feed.

loans.use: To buy 100 chickens, vaccine and animal feed.

loans.name: Lizbeth Paola

texts.es:
LIZBETH SE ENCUENTRA MUY ALEGRE Y ENTUSIASMADA POR QUE YA LOGRÓ OBTENER EL BACHILLER UNIVERSITARIO.
ESTA VEZ EL PRÉSTAMO SOLICITADO SERÁ PARA EL PAGO DE LOS TRÁMITES PARA SU TÍTULO UNIVERSITARIO COMO ABOGADA.
ELLA SIGUE TRABAJANDO COMO ASISTENTE EN LA OFICINA DEL PODER JUDICIAL DE SU LOCALIDAD.

EL SUEÑO QUE ELLA TIENE ES EL DE LLEGAR A SER UNA PROFESIONAL MUY RECONOCIDA A NIVEL DE SU LOCALIDAD.
 Y SIGUE MUY AGRADECIDA CON LAS PERSONAS QUE LE APOYAN PARA SEGUIR SUPERÁNDOSE PROFESIONALMENTE.
texts.en:
Lizbeth is very happy and excited because she has received her university bachelor degree.  The loan she is requesting on this occasion is to pay the remaining fees for her law degree.  She continues to work as an assistant for the court of the district in her town.

Her dream is to become a very well-known professional, locally.  She is very grateful to everyone who has helped her develop herself professionally.

loans.use: to pay the remaining fees for her bachelor’s degree.

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana Carolina tiene 26 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad con grandes depósitos de arena y ripio que la población utiliza para la construcción de viviendas, también se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposo tiene una bodega ubicada en su domicilio donde ofrecen productos de primera necesidad, comparten sus labores y son una familia unida, Diana ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de productos arroz, leche, huevos y de esta manera ofrecer a sus clientes generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Diana Carolina is 26 years old. She lives with her husband and children in the district of Cayaltí, a community with big reserves of sand and gravel that the residents use to build their houses. They also work in agriculture, trade and livestock. It is located an hour from the city of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque in the northern coast of Peru.

Together with her husband, she has a store located in her home. They sell staple products. They share the work and they a re a close family. Diana has asked for a loan of 500 nuevos soles to buy a variety of products such as rice, milk, and eggs. In this way, she can offer them to her customers, generating more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products such as rice, milk, and eggs to offer her customers.

loans.name: Honorato Pompeyo

texts.es: Honorato tiene 48 años de edad, él  es un señor casado, vive con su esposa y 3 hijas de 3, 6 y 10 años,  las 3 chicas se encuentran asistiendo a la escuela, Honorato se dedica a criar ganado y también trabaja de chofer en un taxi, y su esposa realiza los labores del hogar, cuida a sus hijas y también apoya a su esposo es el cuidado de los terneros, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de terneros, su aspiración es seguir trabajando para  beneficio de su familia y que sus hijas sigan estudiando y logren tener un titulo universitario.
texts.en: Honorato is 48 years old. He is a married man who lives with his wife and 3 daughters, aged 3, 6 and 10. The three girls are in school. Honorato works raising cattle and he also works as a taxi driver. His wife is a housewife, caring for their daughters and also helping her husband care for the calves. He is going to invest in buying calves. His goal is to keep working for his family's benefit and for his daughters to keep going to school and get college degrees.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Las Orquideas Group

texts.es: El grupo “LAS ORQUIDEAS” está conformado por socias dedicadas a diversas actividades del comercio minorista. Hilda tiene 30 años de edad es casada con 03 hijos educando. Ella presta servicios de confección en una textilera. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de una computadora con el apoyo de su esposo para mejorar la calidad de educación de sus hijos. Hilda tiene como finalidad compra una máquina de coser para poder independizarse y poder dedicarse más tiempo a sus hijos. El grupo agradece  a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Hilda es la tercera del lado derecho viste polo blanco.
texts.en: The “LAS ORQUIDEAS” group is made up of members who work in different activities as retailers. Hilda is 30 years old, married, and is raising 3 children. She works  sewing services in a textile business. She is going to invest in buying a computer with her husband's help, in order to improve the quality of her children's education. Hilda's goal is to buy a sewing machine to become independent and be able to spend more time with her children. The group is grateful to the Kiva investors for the loan. Hilda is the third from the right, wearing a white t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: José Ricardo

texts.es:
José tiene 60 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado en la escuela, está casado y su esposa se dedica al mantenimiento de un vivero de plantas ornamentales, tres de sus hijos viven aparte y solo uno depende de él.

José es vendedor ambulante, él vende sinchos, baterías para lámpara, y otros, negocio que lo realiza desde hace 17 años, lo realiza en tres comunidades cercanas  y lo hace todos los días, antes se dedicaba al trabajo en las fincas como jornalero, luego fue capacitado para vender y montar su propio negocio, lo emprendió y le está dando resultados.

El préstamo solicitado a CrediCampo lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería, él planea hacer compras mensuales y no quincenales, porque de esta forma se ahorra tiempo y dinero porque al comprar por mayor le saldrá más barata la mercadería.

Su sueño más grade es poner un negocio fijo de los mismos artículos que ahora vende, de esa forma ya no tendrá que andar vendiendo en la calle, sino en un solo lugar.
texts.en:
José is 60 years old and completed up to third grade at school. José is married; his wife makes a living looking after decorative plants. Three of the couple's children have their own homes, while one still depends on their parents.

José is a street vendor. He sells iron girdles, batteries for lamps, and other items. José has had this business for 17 years old, and works in three nearby communities every day. Previously José worked as a labourer on estates before doing training in sales and starting his own business. He then set up his own business and is having positive results.

This loan from "Credi Campo" will be used to buy merchandise. José plans to make his purchases on a monthly - and not fortnightly - basis as he will be able to save both time and money by buying in bulk.

José's biggest dream is to have a fixed business selling the items he currently sells. With such a business, José would not have to go out into the streets to make sales but could do it from one place.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise, such as iron girdles, batteries for lamps, and other items.

loans.name: Luis Ernesto

texts.es: Luis tiene 23 años de edad, vive en unión libre con una señora que tienen  un hijo de 8 años, él viene desde Colombia a Ecuador ya que son países fronterizos y no se le hace muy difícil transportarse, Luis comenta la mayor parte de su tiempo vive en Ecuador ya que aquí hay más trabajo y él juntamente con su conviviente se dedican al comercio de cuyes, trae estos animales desde Colombia donde los encuentra más baratos y los vende el Ecuador a un precio que le deja utilidad, con el crédito va a comprar mercadería en cuyes, Luis da gracias a Fodemi por confiar en las personas extranjeras y por ayudarles a salir adelante con sus negocios.
texts.en: Luis is 23 years old and lives with his partner and their eight-year-old son. Luis is from Colombia but came to Ecuador as they border each other and it is not difficult to travel between them. Luis tells us that he lives most of the time in Ecuador as here there is more work and, together with his partner, he works selling guinea pigs. He brings the animals from Colombia - where they are cheaper -and sells them in Ecuador at a high enough price to earn a profit. Luis will use this loan to buy more guinea pigs. Luis thanks "Fodemi" for trusting in foreign people and for helping them to prosper with their businesses.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Deme Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les quatre  membres du groupe Deme ont en moyenne 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djicoroni l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Djicoroni. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de fruits (mangues, papayes et oranges), œufs et du bois de chauffage. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Barro (1 ère assise à  gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de fruits et légumes (mangues, papayes et orange). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 corbeilles de mangues, 3 corbeilles de papayes et 3 corbeilles d’oranges  à Bamako.La revente se fait en détail à Djicoroni à une clientèle mixtes. Madame Barro compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married and mostly living in monogamous households, the 4 members of the Deme group have an average age of 37 and, on average, 4 children. They all live in Djicoroni, one of the districts of Bamako, and got to know each other thanks to neighbourly relationships and their business activities at the Djicoroni market. The group members sells fruit (mangoes, papayas and oranges), eggs and firewood. The members of the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their businesses and are on their 1st group loan.

Barro (sitting on the left in the picture) is a large reseller of fruit (mangoes, papayas and oranges) and vegetables. She plans to use her loan to buy 5 baskets of mangoes, 3 baskets of papayas and 3 baskets of oranges in Bamako. She makes her sales in Djicoroni to a varied retail clientèle. Thanks to this loan, Barro expects to make an average monthly profit of 20 000 francs which will be reinvested in her business and used to cover the small needs of the household.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Jorge León

texts.es:
Jorge es un hombre humilde, carismático y trabajador de 57 años de edad, casado y padre de 4 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con empeño y arduo trabajo.
Durante 15 años de su vida, ha trabajado como comerciante independiente, inició vendiendo mercancía como ropa, zapatos y otros productos, luego incursionó con la venta de loterías y juegos de azar, pero debido a una crisis de salud que incapacitó a su esposa por varios meses, tuvo que dejar a un lado la labor para dedicarse al cuidado de sus hijos y del hogar; sin embargo continuó vendiendo loterías, para generar ingresos que le permitieran sobrevivir.
El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para reiniciar con la venta de mercancía, comprará ropa, perfumería y tenis, esto le permitirá recobrar su antigua clientela y mejorar los ingresos para su familia.
Jorge con su espíritu de superación y motivado por el amor a su familia, desea seguir luchando arduamente para tener la capacidad económica de brindar un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida a los que ama y velar para que sus hijos tengan una educación de buena calidad que les permita en un futuro, salir adelante.
texts.en:
Jorge is a humble, charismatic and hard-working man. He is 57 years old and a father to four children, whom he has helped to get ahead with hard-work and dedication.

Jorge has worked as an independent businessman for 15 years. He started by selling merchandise such as clothes, shoes and other products, and later started to sell lottery ticks and other games. However, Jorge's wife took ill and was unable to do anything for several months and so Jorge had to leave his work in order to look after his children and household. Nevertheless he continued to sell lottery tickets in order to earn an income to survive.

This loan will be used to re-start his business selling merchandise. Jorge will use the loan to buy clothes, perfumes and trainers allowing him to regain his former customers and improve his family income.

With Jorge's desire to get ahead, motivated by the love for his family, he wants to continue fighting in order to have enough money to offer his family better well-being and a higher quality of life. He wants to look out for his children so that they might have a good education that will allow them to prosper in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfumes and trainers.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is Aminata, a business woman and mother from Jui. Jui is a quiet rural district east of busy Freetown. 

Aminata is a 22-year-old single business woman. She started working once she had finished her schooling so that she could support her parents. She sells drinks and water to her customers and works hard, often for 10 hours each day, 7 days a week. 

Aminata’s hard work is demonstrated by the fact that she has previously received, and paid back, five small loans from BRAC Sierra Leone. 

Aminata would like to use this loan to purchase more drinks and water for her business so that she can continue to grow it. 

She is thankful to BRAC Sierra Leone and to Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to buy cold pure water and soft drinks sell to her customers.

loans.name: Edmundo

texts.es:
Edmundo de 68 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado de educación básica, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, sus hijos ya no viven con ellos por lo que su esposa es la única que depende de él.

Edmundo trabaja en la agricultura, actividad que ha realizado por toda una vida, no puede realizar otras actividades porque en la zona donde vive es escasa el agua durante el verano, y es difícil para sembrar hortalizas, y también se le dificulta encontrar quien le alquile terreno para sembrar.

El crédito solicitado a CrediCampo lo necesita para comprar seis sacos de abono y pagará el alquiler de la dos hectáreas que cultivará, y si no es financiado se le dificultará mucho poder trabajar.

Su sueño es tener donde trabajar y medios para fertilizar, para que sus cultivos sean buenos, y sabe que puede seguir adelante con la ayuda del crédito.
texts.en:
Edmundo is 68 years old and completed up to third grade at school. He is married; his wife is a housewife. The couple's children no longer live at home and so Edmundo's wife is the only one who depends on him.

Edmundo works in farming, something that he has done all his life. Edmundo cannot do any other work as where he lives there is very little water in the summer and it is difficult to grow vegetables. It is also difficult to find land to rent for sowing crops.

Edmundo needs this loan from "Credi Campo" in order to buy six bags of manure and to pay the rent on two hectares of land where he will grow crops. Without a loan it will be very difficult for Edmundo to work.

Edmundo's dream is to have a place to work and to have the means to fertilise his land so that he has good crops. Edmundo knows that he will able to prosper with this loan.

loans.use: to buy six bags of manure and to pay the rent on two hectares of land.

loans.name: Gulsimo

texts.ru: Гулсимо 57-летняя швея из города Душанбе. Она вдова, имеет сына и двух дочерей. Гулсимо имеет высшее образование и работала учительницей в школе. Последние два года она активно занимается шитьем. Гулсимо у себя дома берет заказы на пошив женских платьев национального стиля. Сейчас она хочет провести ремонт комнаты, где она работает. Она хочет создать хорошие условия для работы и приема клиенток. Для осуществления этой цели она запрашивает кредит и надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Gulsimo is a 57-year-old seamstress from Dushanbe. She is a widow and has a son and two daughters. Gulsimo has a college education and used to be a teacher. For the last two years she has been working as a seamstress making traditional dresses to order. Now she would like to repair her sewing room at home to create better working conditions and a good atmosphere for receiving clients. She has asked for a loan to achieve this goal and hopes for support.

loans.use: to make repairs to her sewing room

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! Welcome to Jui, a quiet district east of the busy capital city. 

Nancy has been working all her life, and now sells coal in a market place in a nearby town. She is married to an electrician. They have seven children between the ages of 8 and 29 years. 

Nancy’s main motivation in working is to take care of her family. She is fortunate in that, from her hard work, six of her children are attending school.

Nancy begins working early each day at 8am and often works until 7pm, returning home to tend to her children. She is sometimes challenged by not having enough capital to buy coal in bulk, however, she would like, someday, to grow her business and sell the coal from a shop. 

Nancy would like this loan so that she can buy more bags of coal to sell to her customers. 

She thanks Kiva and BRAC Sierra Leone for their support.

loans.use: to buy more coal to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Please meet Hawa, a local woman from Jui, which is a rural area east of busy Freetown. 

Hawa has been working for over 15 years now, and began working to be independent. She is now married and has three children between the ages of 6 and 13 years. She is proud that all three children attend school.
 
Hawa’s business is a small-scale general retail store, although she specialises in selling over-the-counter medical products (like disinfectants). She starts working every day at 7 am and finishes at  4 so that she can return to her family.
 
Hawa would like this loan to purchase more medicine to sell to her customers. 

Hawa’s hard work ethic is demonstated by the fact that she has previously received, and paid back, five loans from BRAC Sierra Leone. She is grateful to both BRAC Sierra Leone and Kiva for their support. 

Her big dream in the future would be to run a large specialised drug store. In the meantime, she is focused on ensuring that her children have a better standard of living. She says a big ‘Thank you’.

loans.use: to buy more over-the-counter medicines.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
This is Cecilia, 23, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Archibal, a helper, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Cecilia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php10,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Cecilia dreams to expand her business and hopes to have a better living.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and she also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy parts and cover maintenance costs of her computer shop. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rowena dreams of being more successful in business, and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her work and to find strength and encouragement from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 29 years old, married, and lives with her family. For the past year, she has run a coffee-vending business, selling automated coffee in her village. Joy’s husband also works as a chef. She and her husband work every day to provide income for their family and save for the future education of her child.

Joy is requesting a loan to buy more coffee vending flavors and to cover her machine maintenance costs. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits so that she might open another business and continue assisting her family with additional income. The story of Joy and her business is just one of the many examples of how GDMPC helps the economic development of its clients.

loans.use: to buy coffee vending flavors and cover machine maintenance costs

loans.name: Sonreipanrian Group

texts.en:
Being widowed at young age and left with four daughters to feed, clothe and provide all the basic things is difficult, says Buanthaolu. 

She brews local wine and sells it to feed her children. She is the featured borrower for the group with her hand raised. They are five members in total. They call themselves Sonreipanrian Group. They live in a village that is close to one of the national highways and it is about 35 kms distant from the capital town of Manipur. It is one of the northeastern states in India.

Buanthaolu belongs to a tribal community, and their tradition and culture oblige them to brew wine. This wine is used in their rituals and other festivals in their community. She uses this means to generate income for the family and make a livelihood for them. Lack of higher education compels her to make a living by manual work, and Buanthaolu says there is no excuse for sickness because her four daughters are still young and cannot assist their mother in her brewing wine business.

She usually purchases the materials like yeast, rice and other necessary requirements in stocks and brews wine. Her brewed wine is known in the entire neighbouring village and she has numerous customers. During festive seasons the demand is high and business is at its peak. She also supplies to the neighbouring villages and also sells the wine at home. She runs the business on her own as her children are still in school and she does not want to disturb them.
 
With the Kiva loan, she wants to purchase quality rice and bigger pots for brewing wine. She can then sell it at higher value because quality rice wine is valued and more expensive than the regular local wine. Until the children can find a way to replace their mother's brewing business, she has to continue because they don’t have any other choice. She wishes to continue her brewing business and also plans to expand it.

She says thank you so much, Kiva, for your generosity and assistance. She wishes to continue building the relationship with Kiva and also assures that she will repay the loan on time and will also work with her heart and soul. 

Likewise, the rest of the group members are also engaged in brewing local wine.

loans.use: To purchase materials like quality rice, a bigger pot and firewood for brewing wine.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She runs a butcher shop and has been able to buy more pork and chicken needed in her business. Lanie’s previous loan helped not just in her business but also for the college education of her child. Her income from her business is also helping with her everyday household expenditures and she and her husband work very hard to provide for their family’s everyday needs.
 
Lanie is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan to pay for additional supplies of chicken and pork needed in her business.  More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and provide for the educational expenses of her child. Lanie looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. She dreams that her business will last longer and she hopes to have a better living. Lanie meets up weekly with her fellowship group* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners that gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for chicken and pork to sell

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru: Фарида 24-летняя студентка. Она живет с бабушкой и родителями в районе Б.Гафурова города Худжанд. Фарида учится в Худжандском Государственном Университете. В свободное время она занимается шитьем и зарабатывает этим на жизнь. Чтобы продолжить обучение в университете, Фарида должна оплатить за учебный год. Она обратилась за кредитом, так как в данный момент не имеет на руках сбережений. Фарида прилежно учится и очень хочет закончить университет. Она имеет большие планы на будущее и в будущем хочет сделать карьеру по своей специальности.
texts.en: Farida is a 24-year-old student who lives with her grandmother and parents in the B. Gafurova region of the city Khujand. She studies at Khujand State University. In her free time she earns a living by sewing. In order to continue her university education, Farida needs to pay her tuition. She is looking for a loan because at the moment she doesn't have enough cash available. Farida is a diligent student and really wants to finish her degree. She has great plans for the future and wants to start a career in her area of specialty.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic runs a general store. She previously accessed a 13,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Marivic’s earnings were a big help for providing for her children’s education, and assisting with her personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
Marivic is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at her store the better as this will result in better profit. Marivic’s profits will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and provide for her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. In the future, Marivic dreams that her business will grow bigger and she hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: Jiankarumei Group

texts.en:
Guangdinglu is pictured with hand raised and she is the featured member for Jiankarumei Group. They are five hardworking tribal women who reside in a village in the state of Manipur and formed the self-help group to support one another. All these women are engaged in income-generating activities to support their families. 

Guangdinglu lives with her husband and her two children. Her husband is a cultivator and his income is meagre and unreliable. It fluctuates and depends mostly on the produce and weather conditions. Relevant climate and arrival of monsoon at the right time again enhances the harvest.

Guangdinglu brews local wine to supplement her husband's income and support the family financially. The tumult rice, which is left after brewing wine, is also used as pig feed and that is another means of making money, says Guangdinglu. By selling the regular local wine, one cannot generate sufficient income because it is cheaper. Quality controlled rice wine is in high demand and one can make huge money because it is more tasty and good for health. Business peak season is during the festive season of the tribal community, when the wine is used at different occasions for various purposes. During wedding receptions, house-warming parties, and new baby rituals in the family, local wine is used as sanctified liquor by the elders in traditional practices of the community. 

With the assistance of the Kiva loan, Guangdinglu wants to purchase quality rice, more stocks of yeast and two bigger pots for brewing wine that she can sell and support the family. She also dreams of starting a new business in the town market by opening a grocery shop. She is working hard to fulfill her dreams. She will start saving from now onwards and will also repay the loan on time.  She says, "Thank you so much, Kiva, for the generosity and unconditional help for the group.” 

The rest of the group members are also engaged in brewing local wine and selling it.

loans.use: To purchase quality rice, more stocks of yeast and two bigger pots for brewing wine.

loans.name: Timinandia Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Timinandja est composé équitablement  de femmes monogames et polygames vivant avec leurs maris et leurs enfants. Elles ont en moyenne 58ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djicoroni l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de pagnes wax de meilleures qualités et d’habits de la friperie communément appelé Yougou-Yougou chez nous. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Awa (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une réputation dans la vente des habits (pagnes wax) de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 15 pièces de pagnes wax en gros à  Bamako. La revente se fait en détails au marché et en ambulant à une clientèle constituée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Awa espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinjecté dans l’activité et subvenir aux petits besoins des enfants.
texts.en:
The Timinandja group is made up of an equal amount of women in monogamous and polygamous relationships who live with their husbands and children. They have an average age of 58 and, on average, 5 children. They all live in Djicoroni, one of the districts of Bamako, and got to know each other via family and neighbourly relationships and friendships. The group members are small retailers of high quality wax pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African clothing) and second-hand clothing locally known as "Yougou-Yougou". The group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their businesses and are on their 1st group loan.

Awa (sitting on the left in the picture) has a reputation as a saleswoman of high-quality clothing (wax pagnes). She plans to use her loan to buy 15 wax pagnes wholesale in Bamako. She makes her sales at the market and on the streets to a clientèle mostly made up of women. Thanks to this loan, Awa hopes to make an average monthly profit of 35 000 francs which will be reinvested in her business and used to take care of her children's small needs.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Librada

texts.en:
Librada is 41 years old. She is a widow who lives with her family. Librada has run a variety of businesses to bring income to her family. She has been selling dried fish in her village and at the same time is raising and fattening pigs. Librada has been doing these activities for 18 years and has continued to sustain her family.

Librada is requesting a loan to buy feed for her swine. In the future, she plans to develop her business and increase her profits to continue to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 33 years old, separated, and has children. She has a farm as her main source of income. She is also engaged in swine fattening business. She has been in these business for three years.

Liza requested a loan, which she will use to buy feeds and a piglet. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits to continue providing for her family .

loans.use: to purchase feeds and a piglet

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, 51, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and she has children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Teresita has a food cart, and she sells rice and different viands (dishes). In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings, when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. 

Teresita hopes to expand her business and dreams to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
