* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Bibi Fathima Group

texts.en:
The Joint Liability Group (JLG) “Bibi Fathima” is starting its first loan cycle with Future Greens. This group consists of five members: Masabi, Hasina, Shamshad, Shainajbi, and Bibijan. The members of this group are engaged in rearing of sheep, goats and rams. They all work in agriculture fields as daily wage workers and earn INR 100 per day.
           
Hasina (the lady with her hand raised in the picture) is the leader. Hasina started a dairy farm with small capital and bought lambs and goats. Hasina is married and the mother of a son and daughter who are both very small. The women in the group consider her as a role model and want to grow with her help.

The loan the group is receiving will be used to buy sheep, goats and rams. They raise them in their community for six to eight months and sell them each for Rs 2,500 to Rs 3,000. 

This loan will help turn these women turn into small entrepreneurs in Jalageri village, Bagalkot, Karnataka. They are very hardworking and confident that with this loan they will be able contribute to their families' incomes and become self-sufficient. 

They all hope to save enough to send their children to school to educate them and turn them into good human beings.

loans.use: to buy sheep, goats and rams.

loans.name: Ashobala

texts.en:
Ashobala is 55 years old and blessed with two daughters.  Her daughters are married.  Now she stays with her husband, Nripendra, age 61 years.  They live in the small village Altagram in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri.  They live in their own house.  Ashobala and her husband both are uneducated and can sign their names only.

Ashobala's husband has been growing seasonal fruits and vegetables (beans, potatoes, onions, cucumber etc.).  The local people have high demand for fresh fruits and vegetables.   Now they plan to grow cucumber, as cucumber is very much in demand in summer.
 
Ashobala applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to purchase cucumber seeds and fertilizers to grow cucumbers.  She hopes cucumber cultivation will be profitable for them and they can generate more income through this.  She is thankful to both the lenders ( Kiva and BJS).

loans.use: To purchase cucumber seeds and fertilizers for cultivation.

loans.name: Baby

texts.en:
Baby is a 36-year-old woman and a mother two children (one son and one daughter). She lives in the small village Raipara in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri with her husband Kamal in their own house. Their children are in grades 9 and 10. Both Baby and her husband are illiterate and can sign their names only.

Baby's husband is engaged in a business of pan (betel leaf), which is used as a local mouth freshener.  Baby has been engaged in a business of tailoring for the past three years to help her husband. She knows that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of the household and the educational needs of their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household after managing her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Now she is requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase more reels of threads and cloth, buttons, etc., in order to expand her tailoring business. She wants to meet the increasing demand of her customers. Her regular customers are her neighbors. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

She thanks to her lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To purchase materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les dix membres du groupe Djekafo ont en moyenne 33 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Lafiabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Lafiabougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de condiments (oignons, tomates, pommes de terre, poissons), pâtes d’arachides, gaz, boissons et d’habits. Dans l’intention d’accroitre leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1ercycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Alimata (femme assise en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiments (oignons, tomates, pomme de terre, poissons). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 corbeilles de tomates, 5 sacs d’oignons, 20kg de poisson fumé et 3 sacs de pommes de terre à Bamako. La revente se fait en détail au marché et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Alimata compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married and mostly living in monogamous households, the 10 members of the Djekafo group have an average age of 33 and, on average, 5 children. They all live in Lafiabougou, one of the districts of Bamako, and got to know each other via neighbourly relationships and their business activities at the Lafiabougou market. The group members are small retailers of condiments (onions, tomatoes, potatoes, fish), groundnut paste, gas, drinks and clothing. The group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their businesses and are on their 1st group loan.

Alimata (sitting second from the left in the picture) is a large resellers of condiments (onions, tomatoes, potatoes, fish). She plans to use her loan to buy 3 baskets of tomatoes, 5 bags of onions, 20 kilos of smoked fish and 3 bags of potatoes in Bamako. She makes her sales at the market and on the streets to a retail clientèle mostly made up of women. Thanks to this loan, Alimata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 40 000 francs which will be reinvested in her business and used to take care of the household's small needs.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is one of the store owners within her community. She is 36 years old and has three schooling children. Due to the high cost of school fees, she aims to improve her business in order to increase her income. She wants to acquire more stock of grocery items to sell, but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she would like a loan amount of 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy more stock of snack foods, assorted candies, laundry soaps, noodles, eggs, beverages, canned goods and seasonings to resell. 

Having patience and strong determination, she believes that she will improve the business and continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of snack foods, assorted candies, laundry soaps, noodles, eggs, beverages, canned goods and seasonings to resell

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 36 years old, married and lives with her family. She has a swine fattening business to generate additional income while her husband works as   a carpenter. Mylene has seven years experience in this business. She wants to provide income for the family in order to save money for the education of her four children in the near future.

Mylene has requested this loan in order to buy additional piglets. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits to continue assisting her family with the additional income. The couple wants to give their two children a better education.

The story of Mylene and her business is just one of the many examples of GDMPC for economic development clients.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets.

loans.name: Reynelyn

texts.en:
Reynelyn is 26 years old and married. She lives with her family. Reynelyn has just started a retail business with the help of her husband. She sells assorted kinds of snacks in her village and her husband works as mason.

Reynelyn is requesting a loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She aims to expand and develop her business to earn more profits. Reynelyn wants to continue to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more products for her ready-to-wear products business. Her loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her income is assisting with their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their family's everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for a new 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan for her to buy additional stock of men's, women's and kids' clothing. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs and her children's educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Melchora hopes to have more customers and dreams that her business will grow bigger. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of men's, women's and kids' clothing.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more of the materials needed for her business. Her income is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. She also has a jeepney business for additional income.

Editha would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and other materials for her ornamental plant-growing business. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Editha dreams to be more successful in business and hopes to have a better standard of living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds and other materials for her ornamental plant-growing business.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a fish vendor from the town of Loon, Bohol. She is a married woman and has two children. Milagros has been selling fish for almost 20 years now. This is the source of her income.

Milagros is asking for a loan  to buy additional fish and other seafood products to sell in the market. With this loan, she will be able to improve her stocks, allowing her to attract more buyers. In the future, Milagros dreams of expanding her business so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy additional fish and other seafood products to sell in the market.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a married woman from Antequera, Bohol. She earns a living through her basket making business. She has been in the business for several years now. 

Edna works hard in order to help her husband in providing for the needs of the family. As of now, she is asking for a loan worth PHP12000 to buy materials such as buri (a native palm), wicker, straw, and other materials for basket weaving. Through this loan, Edna will be able to weave more baskets which she can sell to the market. In the future, Edna hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy materials for basket weaving such as buri (a native palm), wicker, straw, and others.

loans.name: Sokly

texts.en:
Sokly (in the photo) is hired to fix fishing nets and gets paid with a fee. Her husband is a security guard. She lives in a village, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City, and has two sons, who are employed.

Sokly wishes to buy a motorbike for her sons to drive to work. So, she decided to apply for a loan in order to make the purchase.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her sons to drive to work.

loans.name: Guintan Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Guintan  est majoritairement composé de monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 31 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Lafiabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de pâtes d’arachides, condiments, vêtements et  produits cosmétiques. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Marie (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande renommée dans la vente des pâtes d’arachides de qualité dans tout quartier. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de grains  d’arachides à Bamako. Pour faire la pâte d’arachide, on trie les meilleurs grains, les grille, les épluches et les Broie au moulin. La pâte ainsi faite est prête à la vente en détail à une  clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Marie espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Guintan group is mostly made up of women in monogamous relationships. They have an average age of 31 and, on average, 4 children. They all live in Lafiabougou, one of the districts of Bamako, and got to know each other via neighbourly relationships. The group members are small retailers of groundnut paste, condiments, clothing and beauty products. The group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their businesses and are on their 1st group loan.

Marie (sitting on the left in the picture) is well-known throughout the district as a reseller of high-quality groundnut paste. She plans to use her loan to buy 2 bags of groundnuts in Bamako. In order to make the paste, she selects the best groundnuts, grills them, shells them and grinds them in a mill. The prepared paste is then ready to be sold to a retail clientèle mostly made up of women. Thanks to this loan, Marie hopes to make an average monthly profit of 40 000 francs which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita previously accessed an 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more eggs and grocery items needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education, as well as in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. Juanita also runs a canteen for additional income.
 
She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better; more items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Juanita hopes to have another branch and dreams to have a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more eggs and grocery items needed in her business.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon runs a business selling frozen and processed food products such as hot dogs, steamed buns, ham, stuffed meat, and other items. She also runs a variety store to gain additional income. Corazon previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more food products. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and for her personal, household, and business expenditures.

Corazon is requesting a 19,000 PHP loan to pay for frozen and processed food products, such as hot dogs, steamed buns, ham, stuffed meat, and other products. More items to sell will result in better profit. Corazon’s profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and provide for the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. Corazon dreams of being more successful in her business and she hopes that all of her children will finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy hot dogs, steamed buns, ham, stuffed meat, and other products

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene, a mother of three, operates a general store to make a living. Aside from this, she also helps her husband on their farm, planting and harvesting crops of their own. For three years in managing the store, she has been able to sustain and support her children’s education. In order to offer more to her customers, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to improve the business, to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita is a married woman, and a mother of five grown children from Antequera, Bohol. She operates a sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place.   Anecita is asking for a loan to buy additional groceries for her store, such canned goods, dry goods, snack food, soda, detergent and toiletries. With a loan, Anecita will be able to expand the variety of her stocks, thus allowing her to attract more buyers to her store. Furthermore, she wants to improve her store, so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family, especially for the food consumption and other expenses.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries for her store, such canned goods, dry goods, snack food, soda, detergent and toiletries.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
This is Rosalina, 44, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married and has children. She and her children manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
 
Rosalina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She makes money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Rosalina dreams of expanding her business and hopes to earn a better living.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is married and works on a farm for a living . For the past two years he has been growing coconuts, he has also engaged in swine fattening, while his wife works as a sales lady in a department store in town.  Jonathan was happy to say that this helps his family a lot. He borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro-finance to buy new tires to replace his old ones. 

In the future, Jonathan wants to improve their business to reach their dreams of having a better living with their family.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en: Divina operates a farm growing and harvesting assorted crops to make a living.  For ten years, by helping her husband, she has earned a better income for the family. To improve the farm, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase seedlings and organic fertilizer. She hopes to improve the farm to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
This retail store is a business managed by Joyce within her community. It is her way of helping her husband to generate income to pay for their necessities and to finance the education of their two children.

To increase her income, she wants to increase her range of products in order to satisfy her customers' demand. Due to insufficiency of capital, she is seeking a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, noodles, canned goods, rice, flour, cooking oils, laundry soaps, beverages and seasonings to sell. 

Through this financial assistance, she is hoping that she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, noodles, canned goods, rice, flour, cooking oils, laundry soaps, beverages and seasonings to sell

location.town: Brgy. Belance, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Ma. Heidi

texts.en:
Ma. Heidi is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to use it in the repair and maintenance of her rental apartment. The loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her income helps them to cover their household expenditures, and she and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Now she would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan for further repair and maintenance of her rental apartment. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to meet her family's daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Heidi hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of her rental apartment.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is 31 years old and an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband is a milk seller by profession; he has been running his business for the past ten years. He is responsible for meeting the needs of the family and managing the entire household.
Rehana's husband wants to purchase different types of accessories for his newly-opened milk shop, such as tubs, a fridge and other relevant items to preserve the quality of the milk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial resources he is unable to buy all these things. Therefore Rehana has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will help her husband to buy these business accessories and fulfill the business needs.
Rehana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial support.

loans.use: To buy some accessories for her husband's milk shop

loans.name: Mario

texts.en: Mario is a farmer who is raising his family in a rural community. He is 52 years of age and has two adult-age children. Being a responsible father, he aims to improve their status of living to give his family a better life. With regards to this, he wants to improve his corn farming business to increase his production. Having inadequate capital, he would like to borrow PHP 10,000 to buy the fertilizers and insecticides needed to sustain his corn production. Being a hard working father, he is hoping that he will improve his farming business and increase his income to satisfy the necessities of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides needed for corn production

loans.name: Brigildo

texts.en: Brigildo is a food vendor from Baclayon, Bohol. He has been engaged in a food-vending business for several years now. Brigildo bakes cakes and pastries and sells them to his customers and other bakeries around his place. This is the source of his income. Brigildo is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, margarine, cooking oil, baking powder and flavorings. With this, he will be able to bake more and sell more to his customers. In the future, Brigildo hopes to make his business a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, margarine, cooking oil, baking powder and flavorings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two more computers and corresponding chairs and desks and to remodel the internet cafe.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch (in photo) is 48 years old and lives in a village across the Mekong, 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has been married since 2004 and has one son who attends school. 

Touch has full-time employment for a hotel, while her husband is a construction worker. He wants to buy more construction materials, but he does not have money. Touch decided to apply for a loan to make purchases for her husband.

loans.use: To buy more construction materials for her husband to work.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is 32 and a mother of four children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession, and he has been selling fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this vegetable shop. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs, so he decided to expand his current enterprise. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales. Therefore, Saima has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy excess seasonal vegetables. She thanks Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy fresh and seasonal vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Sam Oeun

texts.en:
Sam Oeun (in the photo) makes typical Cambodian cakes for sale. She lives in a Phnom Penh suburb and she has five children. Two of her children are married, one is a garment factory worker, and the other two are construction workers. Her husband is a commune leader. 

Sam Oeun wants to build a proper kitchen for cooking. So, she decided to request a loan in order to add to her own money.

loans.use: to add to her own money, to build a kitchen where she cooks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to set-up a permanent structure to provide shelter for her pigs

loans.name: Azmat

texts.en:
Azmat is a 58-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three sons. 

Her husband is an owner of a garment shop. He has been running his garment business for the past ten years. He is solely responsible for feeding his entire family and managing the household.

Azmat's husband wants to purchase packing material, in bulk, to pack the garments, but due to insufficient financial resources, he is unable to buy these accessories to fulfill his business needs. 

Therefore, Azmat has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she will financially assist her husband in fulfilling his business needs.

For this support, Azmat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy packing material, in bulk, to support her husband's garment business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her sugar cane farm and to purchase a solar kit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his poultry farm by 600 chicks and expand his maize farm by 5 more acres

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to acquire a complete solar system to meet the lighting and power needs of her household

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to acquire a complete solar system to meet the lighting and power needs of his household

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to acquire a solar system to meet the lighting needs during the late hours she works on her farm slicing pineapples

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to set up a permanent pig shelter and acquire improved and cross-bred variety of piglets that is more disease resistant and fast growing, and also to purchase a solar kit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to enable her clear more land for cultivation and access more fertiliser and mulching materials for her farm, and to acquire a solar kit

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees, aged 51, is a responsible mother and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This is her third loan with BRAC and the first with Kiva. 
Her husband owns a scrap shop and deals with scrap goods such as iron, aluminum and plastic bottles. He has been purchasing scrap goods from people and selling them to the recycling factories. Nowadays due to household expenses he does not have enough money to buy scrap goods and does not have scrap to sell.
Therefore, Balqees has requested a loan for her husband so he can buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or expenses. She is very impressed with this honorable support and would like to take more loans after the repayment of this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: and her husband to buy scrap goods for reselling.

loans.name: Héctor De Jesús

texts.es:
Héctor es un hombre humilde y trabajador de 56 años de edad, padre de un hijo al que ha sacado adelante con esmero y dedicación.
Durante 15 años trabajó como empleado en una empresa, de la cual salió luego de que se le terminara el contrato; desde entonces comenzó a vender fritos de manera ambulante para generar los ingresos suficientes para aportar a la economía del hogar y brindar sustento a su hijo durante los 20 años que lleva realizando esta labor.
Actualmente y con el ánimo de mejorar los ingresos, solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar una carretilla, frutas y verduras para comenzar a vender estos productos en las mañanas y, en las tardes seguir con la venta de fritos, todo esto con el ánimo de mejorar los recursos económicos.
Héctor manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando arduamente para así adquirir su pensión obligaría y poder disfrutar de una calidad de vida y brindar un mejor bienestar a su hijo.
texts.en:
Héctor is a humble and hard-working 56-year-old man. He is the father of one son who he has been able to move forward with hard work and dedication. 
He worked 15 at a business, from which he left after finishing his contract. Since then he began to sell fried food from his mobile business to generate enough income to support his household and care for his son during the 20 years that he carried this work out.

With the desire to improve his earnings, he is requesting loan support to buy a cart, fruit, and vegetables to start selling in the mornings. In the afternoons he will continue selling his fried dishes, all with the desire to improve his earnings. 

Hector states that his greatest dream is to continue working hard to acquire his pension, to be able to enjoy a higher standard of living and provide a greater well-being to his son.

loans.use: to buy a cart, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Charitan

texts.en:
Charitan is a housewife from the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.  She lives with her husband and three children (one son and two daughters). The daughters are married, and their son reads in grade 6. Charitan and her husband both are uneducated. They live in their own kachha house (made of wood, mud and straw).

Her husband has been involved in farming for many years and cultivates many kinds of vegetables and sells them in the village market. Due to their low income, Charitan is unable to manage her family expenses, as well as her son's educational expenses.  Her husband is struggling as best as he can, but fails to make more income than expected.  

So, Charitan has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for cultivation of eggplants in the same field to enhance the family income. She is very much ambitious and hopeful that she will succeed in her target for more income. She dreams to build a concrete-made house for them with her business profit in the future.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for making her self-sufficient.

loans.use: to purchase eggplant seeds and fertilizers for cultivation.

loans.name: Yimi Elizabeth

texts.es:
Yimi tiene 28 años de edad, estudió Bachillerato, está acompañada y su pareja es operador de maquinas pesadas y llega a casa cada 15 días, pues el trabajo le queda lejos, solo tienen 2 hijos.

Ella se dedica a los oficios del hogar, y los ingresos económicos provienen de su esposo, ya que él es operador de máquinas pesadas y trabaja lejos, por lo que Yimi se dedica a cuidar a sus hijos.

El préstamo solicitado a CrediCampo lo necesita para reparar su casa, va a reparar el techo pues es de lámina y está muy deteriorada y también pondrá dos puertas, 

Su sueño es poder seguir con sus estudios porque ella quería estudiar enfermería, además desea sacar adelante a sus hijos junto con su esposo, de modo que no les falte nada.
texts.en: 28-year-old Yimi had a secondary school education and is married with 2 children.  Her husband is a heavy equipment operator who, because his place of work is some distance away, comes home every fortnight.  Yimi takes care of the housework and it is her husband who provides the family's income.  Because his work as a heavy equipment operator takes him some distance away, Yimi looks after the children. She has applied to CrediCampo for the loan because she needs to repair her home.  She intends to mend the roof, because it is made of sheet metal and is in a very bad state, and to have two doors put on. Her dream is to be able to continue her studies, as she wanted to study nursing.  In addition, she wants to provide for her children and her husband, so that they want for nothing.

loans.use: To repair her home: mending the roof (which is made of sheet metal and which is a very bad state) and having two doors put on.

loans.name: Hericelis De Jesus

texts.es: Hericelis tiene 49 años de edad  y se dedica a la venta  de variedad de prendas de vestir y calzado, además también elabora y vende pupusas. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a estos negocios y gracias a su carisma y buenos productos ya cuenta con muchos clientes y cada vez son más las personas que desean comprar sus productos. Ella es una mujer visionaria quien desea dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y así es como ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de zapatos, sandalias, faldas, vestidos, pantalones, blusas y de más artículos demandados por los clientes.
texts.en:
Hericelis is 49 years old and earns her living selling clothing and footwear. She also makes and sells pupusas (stuffed tortillas). She's had these businesses for many years, and thanks to her charisma and fine products she has many customers, with even more wishing to buy from her.

Hericelis is a forward-looking person who wishes to provide her family with a better standard of living. For this reason she decided to seek a loan from FUSAI to buy shoes, sandals, skirts, blouses and other items that her customers are looking for.

loans.use: Buy shoes, sandals, skirts, dresses, pants, blouses etc.

loans.name: Victor Ricardo

texts.es: Víctor tiene 42 años de edad, él vive en unión libre con una señora que tienen 2 hijos de 15 y 20 años, Víctor se dedica desde hace unas 10 años a la ganadería y su esposa le apoya en este negocio, y adicional trabaja de chofer para tener otro ingreso para la alimentación de su familia, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca para e incrementar su negocio, la aspiración de Víctor es incrementar su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos para comprar un terreno donde poder tener su ganado y ya no pagar arriendo por la hierba de sus vacas.
texts.en:
Víctor is 42 years old and in a common-law relationship with his wife. They have two children, ages 15 and 20. Víctor has worked with livestock for about 10 years and his wife helps with the business. In addition, he works as a driver in order to earn extra money for feeding his family.

His loan will be invested in the purchase of a cow so that he can increase his business. Víctor aspires to expand his business and improve his earnings so that he can buy a plot of land where he can keep his cattle and not have to pay a grazing fee.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Eduardo Reyes

texts.es:
Eduardo es hombre casado de 35 años de edad, actualmente vive junto a sus tres hijos de los cuales son: un hombre y dos mujeres, quienes viven en el Departamento de Sololá.
Eduardo comenta que se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas como habas y arveja y lo realiza en su comunidad. Ahora él cuenta con 20 años de experiencia en esta labor, que hasta el momento le ha generado ingresos y ganancias aceptables, ya que lo comercializa en el mercado local de su comunidad. Con la actividad que realiza el puede aportar a la economía de su familia.
Por lo que ahora ha decidido solicitar un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para el cultivo de maíz y para la compra de insumos agrícolas.
Eduardo comenta que uno de sus sueños, es comprar otro terreno para poder incrementar su cultivo con el objetivo de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Eduardo is a married 35-year-old man. He lives with his three children, a boy and two girls. They lives in the Department of Solola.
Eduardo says that he earns his living growing vegetables like beans and peas in his community. Now he has 20 years of experience in this work. So far, it has generated acceptable income and profits because he sells in the local community market. He brings sustenance to his family with this work.
He has now decided to apply for a loan of 5,000 Guatemalan quetzals for growing corn and purchasing agricultural inputs.
Eduardo says that one of this dreams is to buy another plot in order to increase his cultivation with the aim of improving the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to cultivate corn and purchase agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie is married and lives in Misamis Occidental with her family. She runs a general store selling goods in their local community to earn a living, and has had this business for five years. Her husband works as a laborer.  She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional grocery goods. In the future, she wants to improve her store and to be able to give her child the education she did not have. She plans to expand her store in order to gain more income for the future needs of the family .

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is a 34-year-old, married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She is the mother of four children and lives along with her family. Her husband owns a clothing business. He buys clothing of various types from a wholesaler and sells it to the retailers. Shazia has requested a loan to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy more clothing to fulfill the demand. Shazia hopes that this will increase their savings. She dreams for the bright future of her children, establishment of business, and for a better living standard for her family. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy clothing to resell.

loans.name: Yeun

texts.en:
Yeun (in the photo) lives in a village across the Mekong River, 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has four sons and three daughters. Four of her children are married and the other three are construction workers. 

Yeun and her husband are farmers. In addition, they also raise fish at home. Yeun wants to assist her fish farming business by buying baby fish and fish feed, so she decided to apply for a loan to help her raise the capital needed.

loans.use: to buy baby fish and fish feed.

loans.name: Ana Raquel

texts.es:
Ana, vive en un ambiente familiar cálido junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 9, 5 años y un bebe de 10 meses, hace seis meses abrió una tienda en la que vende productos de primera necesidad, su ventaja es que la instalo en su vivienda y puede estar al pendiente de lo que su familia requiere, atiende de 6:00 a.m. a 7:00 p.m. con la ayuda de una empleada.
Solicita un préstamo para aumentar los productos de su inventario, ya que actualmente no cuenta con todo lo necesario que le ayude a cumplir con las demandas de sus clientes, comprara granos básicos, huevos, embutidos, lácteos, bebidas, golosinas, etc., para aumentar sus ventas y tener mejor rentabilidad para cumplir con los compromisos económicos.
Su visión es tener un negocio que le dé estabilidad económica para que su familia tenga una vida más confortable y seguir generando empleo.
texts.en:
Ana lives in a warm family atmosphere along with her husband and three children (ages 9, 5, and a 10-month-old baby). Six months ago, she opened a store where she sells basic necessity products. Her advantage is that the business is located in her home, so she can look after her family as needed. She manages the store from 6:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M. with the help of one employee.

Ana is requesting a loan to increase her inventory of products. She currently does not have everything she needs to meet the demands of her customers. Ana will buy basic grains, eggs, cured meats, dairy products, beverages, snack foods, and other items so that she can increase her sales and achieve better profitability. This will enable her to fulfill her financial commitments.

Her vision is to have a financially stable business so that her family can have a more comfortable life. She also wants to continue creating jobs.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, eggs, cured meats, dairy products, beverages, snack foods, and other items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Chreb

texts.en: Chreb, 35 years old, lives with her husband and three children in a rural village of the Dambae district, Cambodia. To feed the family, Chreb and her husband earn a living as farmers. They have been farming rice and cassava for 10 years.  Sometimes she works for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 48,500 KHR per day to spend for her family’s needs. This is Chreb’s fifth microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she has completely paid back the past loans.  She has used the loans to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields, so as to generate more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Koem Lorn

texts.en: Koem Lorn (pictured here) lives about 10 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has three sons and four daughters.  Four of her children are married and live in separate homes, two are garment factory workers, and another one attends school. Koem Lorn stays at home and does housework. The main source of income is from her husband’s and children’s salaries. Her husband works as a government officer.  Koem Lorn wants to buy a motorbike for her son to drive to school, because her son commutes to school bicycling, which is tiring and is spending time.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her son to drive to school.

loans.name: Jorge Efrain

texts.es: Jorge es un señor muy dedicado a su trabajo, él tiene 59 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa,  una de sus hijas que es casada y un nieto de 13 años que se encuentra asistiendo al colegio, comenta que la madre del niño tiene que irse a trabajar y por este motivo es Jorge quien se hace cargo de su nieto, este señor trabaja en su negocio que es una mecánica y le da trabajo a su hijo, ahí realiza tubos de escape, hojas para carro, silenciadores, y ventanas; con el crédito va a comprar una muladora que es una máquina que le hace falta para soldar, lo que más quiere Jorge es adquirir esta máquina y dar mejor servicio a sus clientes y así que sus ingresos sean lo suficientemente  buenos para cubrir los gastos de su familia y de educación de su nieto.
texts.en:
Jorge is very dedicated to his work. He is 59 years old, married, and lives with his wife, a married daughter, and a 13-year old grandson who attends high school. As the mother of his grandson has to go out to work, Jorge is in charge of the boy.

He is a mechanic and employs his son in his machine shop. He deals in exhaust pipes, car springs, silencers, and wind screens. With the loan money Jorge plans to buy much-needed soldering equipment so he can provide his clients with better service. His income will be good enough for him to cover his family's expenses and the education of his grandson.

loans.use: To buy soldering equipment

loans.name: Liliana Marcela

texts.es: Marcela es una señora separada de su marido, tiene 37 años de edad y cuida de sus 3 hijos de 7, 13 y 14 años, los dos mayores asisten al colegio y la menor   se encuentra en la escuela, Marcela lleva ya 5 años dedicada a la venta de ropa, también se dedica a trabajar en una oficina de transporte,  esta señora realiza las dos actividades para darles lo necesario a sus hijo, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería en ropa y ofrecerla a sus clientes, Marcela dice que  realiza con gusto su trabajo ya que así es como logra que sus hijos estén estudiando y que algún día quiere verles todo unos profesionales.
texts.en: Marcela is a woman who is separated from her husband. She is 37 years old and takes care of their 3 children aged 7, 13, and 14. The oldest two children attend high school and the younger is in elementary school. Marcela has earned her living selling clothes for 5 years. She also works in a transportation office. She does these two jobs to provide for her children. She is going to invest the loan in the purchase of clothing merchandise to offer to her customers. Marcela says she has pleasure in doing her work and is proud that her children are in school and one day wants to see them all in professional careers.

loans.use: to invest in clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 42 years old, married, and has five children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver, which he has been doing for seven years.  His rickshaw is not working properly because of regular use. Most of its parts are out of order. Accordingly, he is unable to generate any amount of income and wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. Due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of new rickshaw. 

Rukhsana requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which she will use to help her husband cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This loan will help him to continue his business.

loans.use: to purchase a new auto rickshaw

loans.name: Yuly Steffani

texts.es:
Desde muy pequeña Yuly Steffani   y en medio de la inocencia  supo que la vocación estaba inclinada hacia el área de la salud, mientras jugaba, al mismo tiempo soñaba en hospitales ayudando a las personas, al crecer  recordaba el sueño, algunos días más que otros y  en ciertas ocasiones  este desvanecía  por las diversas  circunstancia,  a veces  parecía estar muy lejos, luego de alejarse un poco  de este sueño que había cultivado por algunos años, la vida le regalo una razón más para no desistir, ella tardo en entender lo que la vida le tenía preparado y hasta llego a pensar qué la vida  se había arruinado, pero un día se fijó que contaba con toda las capacidades para lograrlo y con una hermosa familia que la apoyaba  y  confiaba totalmente en ella, se levantó y  dejo las excusas , dejo de preocuparse por el dinero y se preocupó más por buscar de nuevo el sueño que tenia, termino el bachillerato con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, después de esto y por sola curiosidad se acercó a un punto a preguntar sobre lo que tanto le apasionaba desde pequeña, la familia no dudo un segundo en darle todo el apoyo, y hoy en día estudia para ser auxiliar administrativa en salud, es dedicada a esto, agradece todos los días no haber abandonado el sueño, y promete ser la mejor en lo que hace, con la fiel certeza de que esto es solo el comienzo de la realización de este gran sueño, lo hace por ella, porque sabe que la vida la eligió para grandes cosas  y por la familia, ya que son  el mayor impulso para levantarse todos los días a perseguir ese sueño que no es solo de ella sino también de ellos.
La situación económica de ella no es la mas estable, a si que pro eso solicita la ayuda de kiva para que ella pueda realizar el pago de las cuotas mensuales con un precio mas económico y no tenga dificultades para poder terminar la carrera de la cual a ella le gusta tanto.
texts.en:
Since she was small Yuli Steffani, in her innocence she knew that the work she was wanting was in the health field. As she played she dreamed about hospitals, helping people. Growing up she remembered that dream, some days more than others. At times it was distant due to a variety of circumstances. At times it appeared very remote after having moved away from this dream she had had for so long. Then life gave her a reason to not wait. It took a while for her to realize what life had prepared for her and she even got to thinking that her life was ruined.

One day she realized that she had all the abilities to achieve this, with a beautiful family who supported and believed in her. She got up and left the excuses behind, stopped worrying about the money and looked for the dream she had had. With a lot of effort and determination she finished her secondary studies and then out of curiosity started to enquire about what had impassioned her since she was a child.

Her family did not hesitate to support her and today she is studying to be an Assistant Health Administrator. She is doing this and every day is thankful that she didn’t abandon her dream. She is working to be the best with a certain pride that this is just the start of the realization of her dream. She is doing this for herself, knowing that life has chosen great things for her and her family. This is her motivation for getting up each day to pursue this dream as it is not only her's but their's.

Her economic situation is not very stable so she is requesting a loan from Kiva so she can make monthly payments at a more affordable rate and not have difficulties finishing the career that she likes so much.

loans.use: to pay a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Maria Fabiola

texts.es:
María nació en Pujilì una parroquia del Cantón Latacunga ubicado en la Provincia de Cotopaxi en la República del Ecuador. Pujili está ubicado en el este de la ciudad de Latacunga, este sector es muy conocido por sus tradiciones y folklor y es conocida como Emporio Musical. Su gente vive al día a día de estas actividades, aunque es un lugar alejado de la ciudad, existen familias que han emprendido en todo tipo de actividades para cubrir sus necesidades y las de su comunidad. María tiene 21 años de edad, actualmente vive arrendando junto con sus hermanos alrededor de dos años, en el barrio San Felipe del cantón de Latacunga.
María logro terminar la primaria y la secundaria pero por falta de recursos económicos y por falta de oportunidades tuvo que dejar de estudiar y deslindarse de sus padres para poder salir adelante junto a sus hermanos. Ha sido para ella muy satisfactorio el poder ayudar a sus hermanos en todos los gastos de la casa y ser un gran apoyo en las actividades del hogar. 
Se le hace un poco difícil el cuidar de sus hermanos y a la vez dedicarse a su pequeño negocio, María se dedica al comercio de productos naturales Herbalays, esto lo conoció por un anuncio en la prensa y en estos últimos meses se ha dado cuenta de que su demanda ha crecido. Por lo que ahora vio en nosotros una mano para poder seguir creciendo y solicita el crédito con la ilusión y el afán de poder mejorar un poco el lugar donde vive, y poder invertir en más mercadería que le ayudara a mejor su vida y la de sus hermanos.
María quiere extender un sincero agradecimiento y felicitación a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
María was born in Pujili, a parish of the Latacunga canton.  It is located in the Cotopaxi province in Ecuador.  Pujili is located in the eastern part of the city of Latacunga, a sector that is well known for its traditions and folklore, and is also known as the Musical Emporium.  Pujili's people live day to day working in these activities.  Although it is a place that is far from the city, there are people who work in all types of activities to meet their needs and those of the community.

María is 21 years old, and currently lives with her siblings in a rented home in the San Felipe neighborhood of Latacunga, where they have been for about two years.  María was able to complete elementary school and high school, but due to a lack of financial resources and opportunities, she had to stop attending school and leave her parents in order to get ahead with her siblings.  For her, helping her siblings with all of the household expenses, and supporting the household activities, has been very satisfying.  It has become slightly difficult to care for her siblings and run her small business at the same time.  María works selling Herbalays natural products, which she heard about through an advertisement.  In the past few months, she has noticed that her demand has increased.

She has found in us a helping hand to continue growing, and is seeking a loan with the hope of improving her home and purchasing more merchandise that will help her to improve her life and the life of her siblings.  María wants to extend her sincere gratitude to the Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for making her personal and career growth possible.

loans.use: invest in merchandise and improve her home.

loans.name: Esther Rosmer

texts.es: La señora Esther tiene 43  años, es casado tiene tres hijos de 9, 4 y 1 años,  ella se dedica  a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad en su  tienda de barrio que se encuentran ubicado en su mismo domicilio que es en la zona de Pampahasi de la ciudad de La Paz,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora Esther va a usar este préstamo para a la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio como abarrotes, dulces, galletas y variedad de refrescos, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es necesidad de surtir su tienda ya que esta época tiene mucha demanda, la señora Esther enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que en la zona hay muchas tiendas de barrio, ella va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando mercadería y así incrementar su capital y poder tener un almacén ya que este es uno deseos, se siente feliz y agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Esther is 43 years old, is married and has three children ages 9, 4 and 1.  She works selling's essential goods in her neighborhood store that is located in her home in the Pampahasi zone of the city of La Paz.  This loan is her first with the institution.  Esther will use the loan to purchase merchandise to stock her store with groceries, candy, cookies, and a variety of drinks.  Her reason for seeking this loan is her need to stock her store since the demand is very high during this season.  Esther faces challenges in her business such as competition, as in the area there are many neighborhood stores.  She will use her earnings to continue purchasing merchandise and increasing her capital so that she can have a retail space as this is one of her dreams.  She is very happy and grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: purchase merchandise to stock her store such as groceries, candy and cookies.

loans.name: José Cristobal

texts.es:
José de 60 años de edad, solamente estudió hasta tercer grado, ya que por falta de recursos económicos no pudo seguir estudiando, él está acompañado y su esposa le ayuda en los quehaceres del hogar, tiene tres hijos los cuales dependen de él.

José se dedica a la ganadería, esta actividad se la enseñó su padre hace muchísimos años, además de eso se dedica a la agricultura, lo cual recorre unos tres kilómetros para poder llegar donde tiene sus cultivos,


 El crédito lo necesita para comprar  insumos para agricultura como lo son semilla, abono y también para el pago de mozos, él necesita este financiamiento para seguir adelante, tener mayores ingresos, para que con esto su forma de vida mejore su hogar y su familia, 

Él tiene sueños y uno de los principales es que sus hijos estudien para que en el futuro no tengan tropiezos y sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
José is 60 years old. He only has a third-grade education; he could not stay in school because of a lack of financial resources. He is married and his wife helps him with the household chores. He has three children who depend on him.

José works in livestock production. His father taught him this activity many years ago. He also works in farming; he travels three kilometers to get to where his crops are.

He needs the loan to purchase agricultural supplies like seed and fertilizer, and also to pay for field workers. He needs this financing to keep moving forward and to have a greater income so that his household and his family's standard of living will improve.

He has dreams; one of the main ones is that his children get an education so that in they won't have obstacles in the future and they can be good people.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies like seed and fertilizer, and to pay for field labor.

loans.name: Pem's Group

texts.en:
Pem, 35, is married with two dependent children who are both too young for school. Her family lives in a house with a thatched roof, located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district and the main sources of her family’s income are from farming rice and working for others for a fee. 

She has been running her business for 15 years, earning about KHR45,000 per day; she is able to save about 25,000KHR each day. 

Pem is a first cycle client with VisionFund. 

Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. 

She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Sandra Francisca

texts.es: La señora Sandra Habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, casada madre de tres hijos en edades escolares, su esposa labora como CPF para una empresa privada, ella tiene como actividad comercial la venta de Ropa de Segunda, el credito lo solicita para la compra de Paca de Ropa para Damas, Caballeron y Niños ya que actualmente necesita invertir por que ha recibido bastantes encargos. Agradece el apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic ha minifestado en ella para asi poder mejorar su economia
texts.en: Sandra lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe. She is the married mother of three children. Her husband works as security for a private company. She has a business selling second-hand clothing. She is requesting the loan to purchase a bale of used clothing for women, men and children to fill orders that she has. She is grateful to the support that Kiva and Afodenic have given her so that she can improve her finances.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothing.

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en:
Sreymao is 25 years old and lives in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh city. She has been married since 2012, and just has one young daughter. 

Sreymao is a garment factory worker, while her husband is a motor taxi driver. Anyway, her husband’s motorbike did not work well and broke, so he decided to sell it. 

Hence Sreymao asks for a loan to add to the money from selling the old motorbike so they can purchase a new one for her husband. 

With the new motorcycle which will be bought with the money from the loan, Sreymao’s husband can continue his driving motor taxi business. 

Photo: Sreymao and her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike for her husband.

loans.name: Jesucristo Es Mi Modelo Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Jesucristo Es Mi Modelo” está conformada por 12 socios responsables y trabajadores. Juana de 55 años es separada con 01 hijo dependiente. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir. El deseo de Juana es contar con un local propio para ofrecer sus productos. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de polos, camisas, medias y pantalones.  El grupo “Jesucristo Es Mi Modelo” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Juana se encuentra de pie es la tercera del lado izquierdo y viste bivirí azul.
texts.en:
The “Jesucristo Es Mi Modelo” communal bank is made up of 12 responsible and hard-working members. 

Juana, 55 years old, is separated and has one dependent child. She currently sells clothing and she hopes to have a shop of her own to sell her products. She has asked for the loan so she can buy polo shirts, dress shirts, stockings, and slacks. The “Jesucristo Es Mi Modelo” group is grateful to the people who have made this loan possible, and they promise to continue to work hard. In the picture Juana is third from the left, standing, wearing a blue tank top.

loans.use: to buy polo shirts, dress shirts, stockings, and slacks.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: El señor Fernando tiene 63 años, viudo con un hijo de la edad de 34 años,  el se dedica a la actividad de Artesanía en oro y Plata, mejor denominado como orfebre, realiza todo tipo de Joyas de acuerdo al pedido y gusto de sus clientes tiene su joyería en Zona Madrid, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el señor Fernando va a usar este préstamo para la compra de insumos y material de trabajo como oro, Plata,  ácido Sulfúrico, brilla Metal, para su negocio, el señor Fernando enfrenta retos en su negocio que la preocupación por la seguridad , ya que  posteriormente tiene que invertir en mejorar la seguridad de su negocio, el deseo del señor Fernando es el de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia,  por lo que trabaja arduamente y sin descanso.
texts.en:
Señor Fernando is 63 years old. He is a widow with one child, who is 34 years old. He is a gold and silver artisan, or more accurately, a metalsmith. He makes all kids of jewelry according to his customers' orders and tastes. His jewelry store is in the Madrid Zone. 

This loan is his first within the institution. Señor Fernando is going to use the loan to purchase supplies and working materials like gold, silver, sulphuric acid, and metal polish for his business. Fernando faces challenges in his business, such as security concerns; he will subsequently have to invest in improving the security of his shop.

Señor Fernando's wish is to improve his family's quality of life; to that end, he works hard and without stopping to rest.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for the fabrication of jewelry

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Pov is aged 59 and married. She has four children. Living in a village of the Thmor Koul district, Pov and her husband are paid workers who have been working for others for 10 years. Together, they manage to earn about 60,000KHR per day to feed their family and children. 

This is the second loan for Pov with VisionFund. She completely repaid the last loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Pov, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy household supplies for her family's use. She hopes to have enough home appliances for her family.

loans.use: to buy household supplies for her family's use.

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Riffat is a 45-year-old, married woman. She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food and health. 

She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. She has six years of experience in this field. Her husband assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her second loan cycle but it will be the first loan with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy inventories for the General Store.

loans.name: Taj

texts.en:
Taj is a 23-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the responsible mother of a daughter. Her husband is electrician; he has been running his electrical store for the past three years. He is responsible for feeding his entire family, and fulfilling their needs.

Taj's husband has to purchase electric merchandise, e.g. wires, tube lights, plug shoes and other electric devices, but due to insufficient financial means, he cannot afford to purchase these items for business purposes.

Therefore Taj has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase this merchandise to fulfill his business needs. 

This loan will also help her husband to increase the size of his business and earn the maximum profit.

Taj is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase wires, tube lights, plug shoes, and other electric devices.

loans.name: Monor's Group

texts.en:
Monor, 46, is widowed and lives with her family in a village of the Thmor Koul district. She has children. To make a living, she has been farming rice and working for others for a fee for three years and the current business earns her family about 46,000KHR per day to meet the family. 

Monor has been with VisionFund for six cycles and has completely paid back the past loans. Monor, who is the leader, is leading her group to apply for a loan. She will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labour. She hopes to increase her family’s income from her current business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Nara

texts.en:
Nara is married with five kids. She manages a gardening business to earn a living, and she has been doing this for many years.

She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for the farm. With her generated income, she had bought a motorcycle used for a transportation business to earn additional income.  

She has requested a loan to cover motor repair and maintenance.

Nara been a member of GDMPC since 2011. 

In the future, Nara hopes to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to cover motor repair and maintenance

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: María de 26 años de edad tiene dos hijos; de 5 y de 2 años de edad. Su compañero de vida trabaja como seguridad privada en un almacén y María trabaja toda la semana de lavar ropa ajena. Su vivienda nunca ha tenido el servicio de agua potable pero recientemente en su comunidad han ampliado la red principal para abastecer el agua potable a todas las familia que así lo soliciten. Pero este servicio requiere de un monto de dinero, pero que María y su esposo no tienen. No queriendo pasar la oportunidad de obtener el servicio de este vital liquido, María ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI que está dispuesta a cancelar según el contrato así lo especifica. Con el dinero comprará la tubería y accesorios necesarios, pagará la mano de obra de la instalación y el derecho de conexión del servicio domiciliar de agua potable. Al final dice María, está pensando en el bienestar y salud de sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is 26 years old and has two children who are 5 and 2 years old. Her life partner works as a private security guard in a warehouse, and Maria works all week washing clothes for others.

Their house has never had running water, but recently they have expanded the main water supply network in her community for all families who have requested it. But this service requires some money which Maria and her partner do not have. They don't want to miss out on the opportunity to have this vital service, so Maria has asked FUSAI for a loan which she is prepared to pay back according to the terms of the contract. With the money, she will buy the necessary piping and fittings, pay for the labor for installing it as well as the cost of the permit to connect to the household drinking water supply service. Finally, Maria states that she is thinking of the well-being and health of her children.

loans.use: to buy the piping and fittings, and to pay for labor to connect to the drinking water supply.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her spouse and four children. Her husband owns a small jewelry shop, where he sells bracelets, bangles, lockets, necklaces, rings, and earrings. He presents his jewelry under a display glass case to attraction customers.
  
He has only one source of income, and he has to pay the expenses of utility bills, school fees for his children, and household expenses, alone. He wants to make artificial jewelry at home, so he can generate maximum income. But he does not have enough cash in hand to buy raw materials and solder for making jewelry.
 
Therefore, Yasmeen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy raw material and solder for making jewelry.

Yasmeen is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, because they showed her a beam of hope to fulfill her desires.

loans.use: To buy raw material and solder for making jewelry.

loans.name: Yanira Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yanira de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, estuvo acompañada pero se separaron con su pareja, tiene dos hijos los que viven con ella, solo uno va a la escuela ya que el otro es un niño especial, nadie más vive con ellos, por lo que solo sus hijos dependen de sus ingresos.


Ella trabaja en una casa haciendo todo el trabajo doméstico, ya tiene cuatro años de trabajar con la misma empleadora, por lo que ya le tomo la confianza necesaria para conservarla en su trabajo, no tiene más actividades económicas que realizar, la distancia que recorre es de unos 3 km diarios, el horario de trabajo es de 7 am a 2 pm.
 

El préstamo será invertido para comprar lámina y cambiar la que tiene el techo de su casa ya que se encuentra deteriorada y cuando llueve penetra el agua a la casa, lo va a mejorar porque está en mal estado, la necesidad satisfecha será el poder tener mejores condiciones en su hogar. 


Los sueños que tiene es poder seguir trabajando como empleado en la casa donde trabaja y con eso tener mejores ingresos, con lo que se da a conocer cada vez más.
texts.en:
Yanira is 33 years old. She is separated from her husband and has two children who live with her. One goes to school and the other has special needs. No one else lives with them and only the two children depend on her income. She studied up to Grade 6.

She works in a house as a domestic. She has been working for the same employer for the past 4 years so she feels confident of keeping her employment. She has no other economic activity. She travels 3 km to get to work and her hours are from 7am to 2 pm.

The loan Yanira is requesting is to purchase laminate to replace the laminate that is on the roof of her house. It is in poor shape and when it rains the water seeps through into the house. It needs to be improved so that the living conditions in the house are acceptable. Her dream is to be able to continue her work in the house she works in and doing this make more income.

loans.use: to buy laminate to replace the laminate on her roof.

loans.name: Kishwar

texts.en:
Kishwar is 36 years old and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children and is a very hard working and honest lady. She has to do a lot of hard work to manage her household finances. Her children go to school in the morning and attend classes in the evening. It is challenge for her to afford the school and tuition fees.  She works hard to setup her house. 

She owns a small, home-based  beauty parlor and her husband has a small job in a firm. Both contribute their full income to household expenses. 
With the passage of time, her beauty products will be sold and she wants to buy more cosmetics products for her beauty salon. 

Kishwar requests a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy cosmetics products such as facial cream, hair colors, seizers, and combs for her beauty salon. 

She hopes that through this amount she will be able to enhance her enterprise.   She is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 50-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her six children. Her husband is responsible for meeting the needs of the family. Her son also provides sewing services and earns some income to help to manage the household.
 
Her son needs different kinds of goods e.g. needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for his business, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore Abida has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her son to purchase these accessories and also help him to increase his monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Abida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy some accessories for her son's tailoring shop

loans.name: Estefani Carolina

texts.es: Estefani una joven de 20 años de edad vive con otros miembros de su familia en casa de sus padres. La familia de Estefani es muy humilde, ella ha tenido que emplearse y dejar por el momento sus estudios. Estefani trabaja como asistente dental de lunes a sábado. En la vivienda de Estefani y su familia no tienen a mano el servicio de agua potable por lo que todos los miembros de su familia ayudan a diario para acarrear este vital líquido y tenerlo a la mano para el uso e higiene de su hogar. Estefani ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para efectuar toda la red interna de tuberías para abastecerse del agua potable directamente de la red principal de la comunidad. Con el dinero Estefani comprará la tubería y accesorios de PVC, pagara la mano de obra para la instalación y conexión del agua potable.
texts.en:
Estefani is a 20 year old who lives with other members of her family in her parents' house. Estefani's family is poor and she has had to leave her studies for the time being to work. She works as a Dental assistant from Monday to Saturday.

Her parent's house is not connected to the water system so every day all the members of the family help haul this precious liquid to use in the house. Estefani has requested a loan from FUSAI to install the plumbing system to supply potable water directly from the local water main. With the money Estefani will purchase the tubing and PVC accessories and pay for labor to make the installations and connect to the water system.

loans.use: to buy pipes and PVC accessories and pay for labor to connect to the potable water system at her parents' house.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 30-year-old woman and resides in Lahore, Pakistan. She looks after her family which consists on four people. 

Her husband has run a restaurant for many years to provide good and fresh meals. His restaurant is situated in the main market. Many shop keepers come to his restaurant to eat delicious food.  With the BRAC loan amount, her husband would be able to purchase crockery and food items for his restaurant. 

Rubina is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase crockery and food items for the restaurant.

loans.name: Samart's Group

texts.en:
Samart is a 40-year-old  married woman with four children. Her family lives in a village of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province. She and her husband earn a living farming rice and raising ducks. Together, they have been in this business for 25 years and earn about 35,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 

Samart is the existing client of VisionFund who has received the loans for four cycles. The past loans have helped her family to relieve their financial burden to a great extent. She  leads a group of four members to apply for another loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to build a proper latrine. She hopes to have a clean latrine to use.

loans.use: to build a proper latrine.

loans.name: Anjina

texts.en:
Anjina, aged 24 years, is a young entrepreneurial lady who is married and a mother of three children (one son and two daughters). She could not complete her primary education due to her parents' poor financial resources. She lives with husband and children in their own small kachha house (made of straw, mud and bamboo). Her husband, Sirajul, aged 29, is illiterate and can sign his name only. Their one son reads in grade one, and their two daughters are below the school-going age.

Her husband has been engaged in agricultural activities for the last ten years to run the household expenses. But his income is so scanty that it is hardly sufficient for their family. So, Anjina has been busy with animal husbandry for more than five years.
