Now she is taking a loan from BJS to purchase a cow to start a milk supply business in her locality. She hopes this will give additional profit for their family's wellbeing and her children's education. She wants to go ahead with her business for their secured future.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to start a milk supply business.

loans.name: Ngorongo Group

texts.en:
Ngorongo Group was formed in 2009 with assistance of Visionary Empowerment Programme. The group was named after a big hill surrounding Ndakaini dam that supplies water to Nairobi.

The group requested their first loan to purchase cook stoves and power lanterns for sale. This was as a result of a training conducted by VEP to the members, creating awareness that the use of paraffin for lighting is not only expensive but also affects health. Ngorongo Group became interested from then. They successfully paid back their first loan without default and this has uplifted their living standards.

The group has earned a good income from this and agreed to apply for a second loan to boost their stock, as this will help them conserve their surrounding environment and earn more income.Beth first from left is one of the group leaders who was among the first to purchase a cook stove(firewood). She discovered that she saves a lot of time as she doesn't have to look for firewood now and then,as a result she acts as a sales person on behalf of the group to create awareness on energy saving stoves.James at the center also has also benefited from solar lanterns as his children enjoy long study hours thus using that as a campaign tool for parent to buy for their children as they will perform better in school.

loans.use: To purchase cook stoves and solar lanterns for sale

loans.name: Mbogo Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is in her early thirties and is married. She has three children who are in school. For two years now, Fatuma has been making her living by running a shop selling dry food items like sugar, rice, baking flour, maize flour and beans. She opens her shop from 7am to 8pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

This will be her first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, and she will use this loan to restock food items like the above. Fatuma dreams that one day she will be able to send her kids to international school. She will share this loan with her loan group "MBOGO"  which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock food items like sugar, maize flour, baking flour, beans and rice.

loans.name: Marjukih

texts.en:
Marjukih lives in the north of Bogor, about 2 hours from Jakarta. Marjukih manages a small shop selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credit.  Marjukih is single and lives with 5 people in the family home.

Marjukih joined Ruma 1 month ago because he finds it interesting selling mobile phone airtime credits.  With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Marjukih has seen improvements in his shop.  For the last month, he earns an average of $4-5 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends.  His goal for his business is to expand more new business in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Shaista Group

texts.en:
Shaista is a 42-year-old woman.  She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her four children. Her husband has been working in the public sector organization for many years.  He is responsible to fulfill the needs of his family.  Shaista also provides sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband's to manage the household.  This is a group loan and Shaista is the leader for this group, Hameeda is also a member of this group.
 
She needs different kinds of goods like needles, threads, pieces of clothes, machine oil, etc. for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and will also be helpful for her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Shaista and Hameeda are very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy some products for her business like clothes, threads, needles, etc.

loans.name: Laily

texts.en:
Laily is a 43-year-old woman from the small village of Magurmari in the district of Jalpaiguri. She lives with her husband, Abdul, aged 50 years, who is in agribusiness, and four children who are students. The husband and wife both are uneducated, yet they are determined to give education to their children. They are students in grades 6, 8 and 12, and one is in college.

Due to her husband's poor income from the business to maintain such a big family of six members, Laily has started her own activities to do her bit for the family's welfare. She has been maintaining an animal husbandry besides looking after her husband and children and doing household work. She has two cows. She sells the cows’ milk to her neighbours, and thereby adds financial help to her family. Yet they cannot get over their financial hurdles. 

So, she has decided to purchase one more dairy cow and to start a dairy products business, such as butter, paneer (cottage cheese), curds, etc. Laily has taken a loan from BJS to purchase one more cow, to start producing milk products and sell them locally.  

She hopes to build a concrete-made house for their own use.

Laily is grateful to the lenders for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for business purposes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Chaya

texts.en:
Chaya, 50 years old, is married to Rajen who has a small business. They live in a small hut in Maynaguri. Chaya is a hardworking housewife and has a basic education. 

She and her husband have their own agricultural business. They have their own land where they cultivate different vegetables in different seasons and sell those vegetables in the market. They have their own land and their experience in the agricultural field is the reason for choosing this business. Chaya helps her husband in the field. She wishes to take the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase fertilizer and seeds for farming mustard. She wants to extend her cultivation in the future, though environmental disasters like drought, floods and famine are the main hitches in her agricultural business. Chaya wants to prosper in life. She is a very ambitious and courageous lady who never gives up the fight before she wins. She is cautious always in the way of farming only to lead a smooth life.

She is very much thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds to cultivate mustard

loans.name: Farhangez

texts.ru: Фахангез жительница маленького района Шахритуз. Ей 48 лет. Фахангез как и многие жители Таджикистана хочет начать новый бизнес. Она будет заниматься выращиванием крупнорогатых скотов. У нее имеется условия для содержания скотин, но ей не хватает $1200, чтобы купить достаточное количество скотин. Причина, по которой она выбрала именно этот бизнес, является хороший климат Таджикистана, способствующий здоровому развитию скотин. Фахангез надеется на поддержку и верит, что сможет начать бизнес, ведь ей всегда поможет ее мама и брат. Фахангезро всегда поддерживает ее семья во всех начинаниях и верят, что Фахангеза ждет удача.
texts.en: Farhangez is 48 and lives in the small Shahrituz district. Like many people in Tajikistan, she would like to start a new business. She intends to raise cattle. She has everything she needs to take care of the cattle but does not have the $1200 necessary to buy them. The reason she chose this kind of business is that the climate in Tajikistan is favorable for cattle. Farhangez hopes for support and believes that she can start a business because her mother and brother always help her. She always supports her family in all of their endeavors and believes that success is waiting for her.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to start a new business and become a successful businesswoman.

loans.name: Riquelmi Antonio

texts.es: Riquelmi tiene 34 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y se dedica a la venta de verduras de forma ambulante en las principales zonas de su localidad. Riquelmi desea invertir en su negocio dado que muchas veces no logra cubrir la demanda de mercado y desea abarcar un mayor numero de clientes con el fin de aumentar sus ingresos y así sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de verduras como: papas, tomates, zanahorias, repollos, cebollas, etc. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así lograr mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Riquelmi is 34 years old and lives in his own home with his life partner. He sells vegetables as a street vendor in the main areas of his city. Riquelmi wants to invest in his business because he is often not able to meet the demands of the market and wants to cover a larger number of customers in order to increase his income and thus improve his living conditions and those of his family. 

Therefore he asks FUSAI for this loan in order to invest in the purchase of assorted vegetables such as potatoes, tomatoes, carrots, cabbage, onions, etc. He hopes to be able to count on this funding and thus manage to improve his living conditions and those of his family.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, tomatoes, carrots, cabbages, onions etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Cathrine

texts.en:
Cathrine is 28 years old and a mother of two. She and her husband are aspiring to become successful and financially stable, to give their children a bright future. 

To achieve their goals, Cathrine helps her husband gain income through buying and reselling used clothes and grocery items in the public market. She aims to improve the business and make it more profitable, but she has limited capital. 

For this reason, she is seeking a loan amounting to PHP 8,000 to buy more stocks of used clothes and grocery items to resell in the market. She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of used clothes and grocery items to sell.

location.town: Brgy. Binuangan, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Veuve avec  3 enfants à sa charge, Yawa vit dans le quartier Attiégou et vend des fruits. Elle s’approvisionne  2 fois par mois dans la localité Evou situé dans la région des plateaux au Togo. C’est une dame qui pratique la vente ambulante et sillonne les quartiers de Tokoin et d'Attiegou.
Pour répondre au besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d'accroître, elle a fait une demande de micro crédit qui lui servira d’acheter 1 sac d’avocat et 1 panier d’ananas. Accueillante et très appréciée par  sa clientèle, Yawa espère combler  la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
A widow with three dependent children, Yawa lives in the Attiegou neighborhood and sells fruit. She buys her supplies two times a month in her town, Evou, which is situated in the plateau region of Togo. She sells on foot around Attiegou and the high school. 

In order to respond to the needs of her constantly growing clientele, she is asking for a microloan that will help her buy one bag of avocados and one basket of pineapples. 

Yawa is welcomed and appreciated by her clientele, and would like to fulfill the needs of her customers.

loans.use: buy one bag of avocados and one basket of pineapples.

loans.name: Anju

texts.en:
Anju is a 27-year-old married woman with two children. Her husband is 34 years old. Anju is a housewife and her husband is a farmer. Both of them are illiterate and only know to sign their names. Both of her children are in school.

From the beginning, they have struggled a lot to run their family and business. Now that they have decided to upgrade their business and financial condition, Anju has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) so that she can cultivate bitter gourds on their land. They will sell the harvest in the market to earn more money. Anju thanks BJS and Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivating bitter gourds.

loans.name: Zubada

texts.en:
Zubada is a 37-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two sons, who are studying.

Her husband has been running his own garment business for one year, and he is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. He needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore Zubada is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband in purchasing these clothes in bulk for his business. He can also increase the size of his business and earn more profit with the help of this loan amount.
 
Zubada is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of garments for her husband's garment shop.

loans.name: Tsuishitoo Group

texts.en:
These members are part of Tsuishitoo Group, consisting of five people who live in the same community and who are part of the same network, grouping women who get together each week to meet and receive training and also repay loans for those who are due. They are into the sale of smoked fish, frozen food, cooking oil, beans, rice, beef, pork, linen, jewelry, and children's wear.

The featured borrower is Charllote, who is standing second from the left in the photo. She is involved in the sale of beans, rice, cooking oil, beef, and pork. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of GHS 1,700 to buy and sell fruit and beans, rice, cooking oil, beef, and pork. She supports her husband in the management of daily expenses and the school fees of her children. She starts her day at 7am and finishes at 8pm. 

In the future, Charllote hopes to expand her business and improve the nutritional conditions of her family.

The group needs a total amount of GHS 4,400 to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy and sell fruit and beans, rice, cooking oil, beef, and pork.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is from Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri, where she lives with her husband and three children (one son and two daughters). She is illiterate and can sign her name only. Her husband is a farmer by profession and aged 55 years. He completed his education up to grade 9. All their children are students, who are in grade 4, 6 and 8 respectively.

Laxmi’s husband cultivates different seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells the harvest in the local markets. This helps them to generate income to meet the family's basic costs. Yet, they need to increase their income to sustain financial stability for their family. Now they have decided to cultivate eggplant on their farmland. They have chosen this product, as it is a very important vegetable used in the dishes of local people.

Thus, Laxmi has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, about whom she heard from her friends and relatives that they provide small loans to needy rural women. She would like to purchase eggplant seeds, fertilizers and manure for cultivation. The loan will be a huge help for her because she is sure that she will be able to give financial help to her husband to run the family well and educate her children properly.

She aspires to upgrade their house to a concrete-made house.

She thanks her lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: to purchase eggplant seeds, fertilizers and manure for farming eggplant.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Rosa de 75 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a su esposo. Rosa se ha dedicado desde hace 20 años a lavar ropa ajeno y desde hace 11 años también vende tortillas. Por muchos años Rosa y su esposo han tenido que recorrer largas distancias día a día para adquirir agua potable, depositándola en recipientes plásticos. A su edad, Rosa ya no puede hacer fácilmente esta tarea a diario. Aprovechando que en su comunidad está el proyecto de conexión del servicio del agua potable, Rosa ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para comprar la tubería PVC, pagar la instalación de la tubería y solicitar la conexión del servicio domiciliar. Rosa tiene el apoyo de su esposo y podrá saldar las cuotas que este crédito implica.
texts.en:
Rosa, who is 75 years old, lives in her own house with her husband. For 20 years Rosa has made a living washing clothes for other people and for 11 years she has also sold tortillas. For many years Rosa and her husband have had to travel long distances every day to get drinking water, keeping it in plastic containers. At her age, Rosa can no longer do this daily task very easily.

Taking advantage of the water connection project in their community, Rosa has decided to ask FUSAI for a loan to buy PVC pipes, pay for the installation of the pipework and request connection to the domestic water supply. Rosa has her husband's support and will be able to cover the payments which the loan involves.

loans.use: to buy pipes and PVC fittings, to pay for labour to install the drinking water supply and to pay the connection charge for domestic drinking water.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es: María de 34 años de edad tiene tres hijos, de 17, 12 y 10 años de edad. María y su esposo se están esforzando para dar mejores oportunidades de vida a sus tres hijos. En estos momentos tienen claras posibilidades de que su casa pueda obtener el suministro domiciliar de agua potable. Por 18 años han tenido que pagar más del precio justo por un barril de agua potable colocado hasta su vivienda o acarrear el vital líquido desde una fuente natural y poco confiable. María ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para completar la inversión para la compra de tuberías y accesorios de PVC, pagar al fontanero para que le instale toda la red interna de tubería y el pago por la conexión para el servicio de agua potable. María está entusiasmada ya que pronto toda su familia obtendrá el servicio domiciliar del agua potable directamente de la red principal de la comunidad y sabe que tendrá un buen ahorro al no seguir pagando más por el agua potable que le llevaban.
texts.en:
María, who is 34 years old, has three children aged 17, 12 and 10. María and her husband are working hard to give their three children better opportunities in life. At the moment there is a clear opportunity for their house to be connected to the domestic water supply. For 18 years they have had to pay over the odds for a barrel of drinking water delivered to their home or carry the life-giving liquid from an unreliable natural spring.

María has asked FUSAI for a loan to make up the investment needed to buy pipework and PVC fittings, to pay the plumber to install all of the internal plumbing and to pay the connection charge for the drinking water supply.

María is excited because her family will soon have a domestic water supply directly from the main community supply and she knows she will save a lot through not having to keep paying for drinking water to be delivered.

loans.use: to buy the necessary pipework and PVC fittings for the internal water supply and pay for the installation and the connection to the domestic water supply

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy PVC piping and for the installation and connection rights for household drinking water

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Zahida, age 32; is the mother of three children and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband runs a general store selling rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits etc. He manages his household necessities with the income from the store. He has an impressive speaking voice and easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town which is why his business is running well. His sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to meet the demand. Therefore, Zahida requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. Zahida thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan. Zahida hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in a positive way.

loans.use: to buy more  wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is 40 years old and resides in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of two children. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband provides services making metal shutters for buildings. Her husband needs raw materials such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for manufacturing his shutters. He wants to generate more income to financially support his family. Nasreen is applying for a loan from Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's work. In this way her husband would be able to purchase soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for his shutter work. Nasreen is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her husband's metal shutter work

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is a 42-year-old married woman living with her family members in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. 
Her husband has been running a shop selling raw materials related to tailoring, which is the only source of income for the family. Many tailors and the ladies of his town like to buy laces, spools, threads, needles and packs of zippers from his shop. His customers appreciate his collection of laces. Currently he is interested in purchasing some of the latest variety of expensive laces to enhance his income but finds it difficult due to financial constraints. Therefore, Farida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can buy stitching raw materials and expensive laces for reselling. This will not only help him to grow his lace selling business but will increase his net income and savings as well. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stitching raw materials and expensive laces for reselling.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a farmer living in the Ndaragwa area of Central Kenya with his wife and nine children. He loves farming and especially horticultural farming. He has been farming for seven years with his primary income sources being eggs and crops. His biggest challenge is farming during the drought seasons.
James chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because of the good loan terms they give to their customers. During the training, he learned how he can boost his livelihood by venturing more into farming. This loan will enable him to purchase a water tank to ensure a continued supply of water to his farm and this will increase productivity, especially during drought seasons.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Musarrat

texts.en:
Musarrat is 46 years old and lives along with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
The financial condition of her family is not good. Her husband has grown old but even in his old age he is working in his scrap business. He is a hawker and purchases scrap iron, plastic, waste papers, etc. going door to door. He uses his four-wheel cart to carry the scrap goods from one place to another. His cart got damaged due to loading and unloading so he wants to repair it and change its tires. But he does not have sufficient money saved.
Therefore, Musarrat has requested a loan so that her husband would be able to repair his four-wheel cart and buy scrap goods to continue his business. 
Musarrat hopes that he will earn profits to increase their savings and provide for the better treatment of their elder son.

loans.use: pay for the maintenance of a four-wheel cart and buy scrap goods.

loans.name: Katlyn

texts.en:
Katlyn previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan to purchase a greater quantity and variety of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education as well as in the family's personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from the business will sustain her family’s daily needs and child’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Katlyn dreams that her business will flourish and hopes that her child will finish his studies. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business. She also draws strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Хасан заботливый муж, отец и дедушка. Он из района Вахш. Ему 53 года и он уже находится на пенсии. Хасан имеет высшее аграрное образование, но работал по другой специальности. Он в течение 25 лет работал военным. Сейчас он занимается предоставлением услуги такси. У Хасана двое дочерей и двое сыновей. Одна его дочь занимается шитьем, а вторая студентка. Она учится в первом курсе медицинского колледжа. Хасан хочет оплатить за учебу дочери и поэтому обратился за кредитом. Он нуждается в 2000 долларах США. По словам Хасана ее дочь учится усердно, чтобы в будущем стать профессиональным медиком. Он хочет реализовать цель дочери, чтобы она могла продолжить учебу и получить диплом.
texts.en: Hasan is an attentive husband, father and grandfather. He is from the Vakhsh District. He is 53 years old and is already retired. Hasan has a higher agricultural education but he worked in a different field. For 25 years, he works as soldier in the military. Now he offers his services as a taxi driver. Hasan has two daughters and two sons. One of his daughters is a seamstress and the other is a student. She is in her first year at medical school. Hasan wants to pay for his daughter's tuition which is why he applied for a loan. He needs 2000 USD. In Hasan's words, his daughter is studying very hard to became a professional medic in the future. He wants to fulfill his daughter's goal so that she will be able to continue her studies and receive a diploma.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's medical college tuition.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a farmer living in Ndaragwa area of Central Kenya with his wife and four children. He has established himself in farming over the past twenty years. He loves dairy farming the most. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, horticulture and cash crops. His biggest challenge is feeding his animals.

Stephen chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer good terms on their loans with affordable interest rates. During the training, he learnt how he can boost his life as a farmer in order to bring in more income. This loan will bring ease to the work of feeding his animals and thus ensure there is a continuous supply of food. This will improve his livestock's productivity and thus bring in more income.

loans.use: purchase a chaff cutter

loans.name: Haifa

texts.en:
Haifa is a fifty-one-year-old single lady, the sole breadwinner for the three members of her family. Haifa has been working in an art business from her house for the last fifteen years.

She is well known in her region for her special talent and affordable prices. Haifa likes her business a lot and dreams of expanding and developing it, but her family's increasing needs sometimes limit her development. That's why today Haifa is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special threads, textiles and other necessary business needs.

She hopes that through this loan she will be able to expand her business in a well-managed way, to fulfill both her family and customers' needs. She hopes that one day she can open her own factory to increase her production and sector.

loans.use: buy special threads and textiles

loans.name: Ibodat

texts.ru: Ибодат верная жена и заботливая мать в возрасте 38 лет. Она живет в городе Турсунзаде. У нее 3 несовершеннолетних детей, которые ходят в школу. Муж Ибодат работает в алюминиевом заводе. Сама Ибодат занимается растениеводством на своем приусадебном участке земли. В течение 5 лет она выращивает овощи для продажи. Ей нравится работать на грядке, она получает от своей деятельности не только доход, но и удовольствие. Сейчас она со своей семьей активно готовится к посеву и чтобы завершить весенний посев она берет кредит для купли семян овощей.
texts.en: Ibodat is a faithful wife and attentive mother. She is 38 years old. She live in the city of Tursun-zoda. She has three young children who attend school. Ibodat's husband works in an aluminum plant. Ibodat practices crop farming on her household plot of land. For five years she has grown vegetables for sale. She likes to work in the plant beds. She receives not only an income from her business but also enjoyment. Now she and her family are actively preparing for the sowing season. She is taking out a loan to buy vegetable seeds to complete the spring sowing.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds to carryout the spring sowing season.

loans.name: Mit

texts.en:
Mit is married and has four children, two of whom attends school, one of whom is married, and one of whom is employed as a garment worker. She lives in the area surrounding Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers, growing vegetables and selling them at the market. They transport their goods with their motorcycle, which is old and does not work well.  
 
Mit requested a loan, which she will use to purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Hacia El Futuro 1 Group

texts.es: Maria, tiene 30 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de Intibucá. Lleva diez años de dedicarse al cultivo de maíz, frijol y papas, esta producción es vendida en el mercado local. Maria ha solicitado un tercer ciclo por 15,000 lempiras y es en forma grupal. Con este préstamo va comprar semillas de papas y fertilizantes, también va cubrir alquiler de tierra y pago de mano de obra. Su propósito es mejorar la producción y sembrar otros cultivos como repollo y coliflor. El grupo se llama Hacia el Futuro 1, que esta formado por 6 miembros que viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican al cultivo de papas, el préstamo grupal es por 63,000 lempiras y lo invertirán en la siembra de papas. En la foto  esta Margarita a la izquierda, Juana, María Emiliana y Maria Félix a la derecha, atrás esta Constantino camisa manga larga y Benigno con camiseta.
texts.en: Maria is 30 years of age, lives with her common-law partner with whom they have two children and resides in the department of Intibucá. She has made her living for the past ten years by growing corn, beans and potatoes, produce which is sold at the local market. Maria has requested a third loan cycle of 15,000 lempiras y and is part of a group. With this loan she will purchase potato seeds and fertilisers, as well as covering the rental of her land and paying the workforce. Her intention is to improve production and to plant other crops such as cabbage and cauliflower. The group is called Hacia el Futuro 1 [Towards the Future 1], and is formed of 6 members who live in the same community and make a living growing potatoes. The group loan is for 63,000 lempiras and they will invest it in the planting of potatoes. In the photo Margarita is on the left, Juana, María Emiliana y Maria Félix on the right, Constantino is at the back in the long-sleeved shirt and Benigno in the t-shirt.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilisers, as well as to cover the rental of her land and payment for the workforce who plant potatoes.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.es: La señora Evelyn, es soltera tiene 22 años de edad, vive en la ciudad hacia la localidad de Sacaba, su madre le ayudó a montar un kiosco donde vende pollos a la broaster entre los días martes a sábado a partir de las 16:00 horas hasta las 21:00, al mismo tiempo vende bebidas gaseosas y productos de limpieza, necesita trabajar para pagar sus estudios de enfermería, los mismos que está cursando a partir de este año para tener una profesión y salir adelante, vive con su mamá y su abuelito, el que se encuentra muy enfermo y tiene muchos gastos en salud.  Como quiere crecer en su actividad solicita un crédito para comprar mercaderia para su tienda y abastecerla con otros productos de venta como ser artículos de primera necesidad: azúcar, arroz, pan, leche; y asi incrementara sus ventas y lograra mejorar sus condiciones de vida y ahorrar para pagar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Señora Evelyn is single and 22 years old. She lives in the city towards the locality of Sacaba. Her mother helped her to put together a kiosk where she sells chickens from the broaster Tuesday through Saturday, from 16:00 hours until 21:00. At the same time she sells soft drinks and cleaning products. She needs to work to pay for her nursing studies, which she will be studying beginning this year, in order to have a career and come out ahead. 

She lives with her mother and her grandfather, who is very ill and has many healthcare costs. As she wants to grow in her sector, she is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise for her store to supply it with other products for sale such as staple items like sugar, rice, bread and milk. This way she will increase her sales and accomplish both improving her living conditions and saving in order to pay for her studies.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 44-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children. Her husband runs his own bicycle repair shop; he has been in this business for two years. He is the only one responsible for managing the household.

Tahira's husband wants to purchase different types of bicycle spare parts, tubes, tires and other accessories for his bicycle repair business, but due to financial constraints he is unable to buy these items. Therefore Tahira has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan amount will help her husband to buy the relevant items above and will enable him to fulfill the needs of the business.

Tahira is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial support.

loans.use: To buy some spare parts, tubes, tires and other accessories

loans.name: Anna Lou

texts.en: Anna Lou is married and operates a transportation business, while her husband earns a living as a teacher. Running a transportation business for four years, Anna Lou is happy to say that this helps her family a lot. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC microfinance to pay for additional maintenance costs and motor repairs. In the future, Anna Lou wants to improve the business to reach her dream of having a better life with her family.

loans.use: to pay for additional maintenance costs and motor repairs

loans.name: Nurbanu

texts.en:
Nurbanu is a housewife from the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.  She is only 21 years old and an illiterate housewife who only knows how to sign her name.  She lives with her husband and two daughters in their own house. Her husband Rafikul, 25 years old, attended school up to grade three. Their daughters are too young to go to school.

Her husband is involved in farming and cultivates many kinds of vegetables to sell in the village market. Due to their low income, Nurbanu is unable to manage her family expenses. Her husband is struggling the best way he can all day, but fails to make more income than expected, so Nurbanu requested a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for cultivation of mustard in the same field to enhance the family income. She is very ambitious and hopeful that she will succeed in her target for more income.  She dreams that she will be able to give good financial support to her family. She also dreams that in the future, she will build a pacca house (concrete made) for them with her business profit. She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for the loan

loans.use: To purchase mustard seeds and fertilizers  for cultivation.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is a 45-year-old married woman from Maynaguri. She has completed a secondary level education. Her husband is 52 years old and has completed a higher secondary level education. They have two children. 

Her husband is running his farming business but it is not running smoothly due to the lack of capital. She heard about BJS (Kiva’s partner) from her friend and decided to take a loan to upgrade her business. She will buy seeds and fertilizers for chili cultivation. Chili is a crop that is very much in demand in their area, so she and her husband decided to cultivate chili. 

Now, she is very hopeful about her business. She hopes the loan will improve their business as well as the financial condition of her family. She is thankful to BJS and Kiva because she needs this loan for the growth of her business.

loans.use:
To buy seeds and fertilizers for chili
 cultivation.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a single, working young man who runs a retail store for a living. For two years, Richard was happy to say that this helps his parents a lot. He dreams of renovating his parent's house.  

He borrowed a loan from GDMPC microfinance to buy additional grocery goods to sell. In the future, he wants to earn more through work promotions in order to reach his dream of having a better future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Serina

texts.en:
Serina is only 26 years old, married and illiterate; she can sign her name only. Her husband, Safikul, aged 28 years, is also uneducated. Together, they are raising their two children (one daughter and one son). Their son is a student of grade 2, and the daughter is too young to go to school. They live in their own kachha house (mud floor and thatch roof) in the small village, Magurmari, in the district of Jalpaiguri .

Her husband is engaged in agricultural activities on their own farmland. He grows different vegetables in different seasons and sells the produce in the local markets. Serina carries out livestock breeding to give financial support to her family. She started this business five years back with an initial purchase of one cow when her husband's business was not going well. She is a hardworking and enterprising woman. Due to her dedication and determination, she now has another two goats in her animal husbandry. Now, she wants to expand her business.

She has applied for a loan from BJS to purchase another dairy cow to start a dairy products business. She plans to sell milk and milk products like paneer (cottage cheese), curds, butter and milk to her neighbors in order to make more profit. This business, she hopes, will upgrade their financial condition.  

She also intends to save money for her children's education and to build a concrete-made house for them.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase another dairy cow to start a dairy products business.

loans.name: Shipra

texts.en:
Shipra is a housewife in Maynaguri who lives with her husband and two children. She and her husband are both illiterate and can only sign their names. One of her children is in grade three and the other one is below school-going age.

By occupation, her husband is a mason. Shipra is a house wife. To do masonry work, different tools are required and the cost of these tools is too high so it is not possible for him to run the business.  He has no capital on hand to purchase various tools for his work. Shipra decided to help her husband and applied for a loan to purchase a variety of masonry tools. Now, with the help of Shipra, her husband is purchasing masonry tools like brushes, spades, and ropes and doing masonry work to earn money.

They both are thankful to BJS for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase masonry tools for her husband’s business

loans.name: Shilpi

texts.en:
Shilpi is a 28-year-old married woman from Maynaguri and her husband is 32 years old. Shilpi and her husband completed their education up to grade seven. Shilpi is a housewife and her husband is a farmer. Shilpi has one son and he is receiving an education.

Shilpi has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) of INR 15,000 so that they can grow maize in their field along with other vegetables. For better quality maize, better fertilizer, pesticides etc. are required. With this loan, they will purchase good quality seeds and fertilizers and grow better quality maize to sell at the market. Through this business, they will earn more profit than usual. She hopes it will help her to give a better education to her son and increase the family income level.

She thanks BJS and Kiva heartily for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for maize cultivation.

loans.name: 19 De Marzo Group

texts.es: María, tiene 37 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive en una aldea que pertenece a Yamaranguila, Intibucá. La señora María, siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura con el cultivo de hortalizas como coliflor, brócoli, remolacha, rábanos y papas, el cultivo de papas lo inicio hace 5 años. La producción es vendida en el mercado local. María ha solicitado el tercer ciclo de préstamo en forma grupal que es por 11,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar insecticidas, abonos, fungicidas y semillas de papas, con el fin de darle mejor asistencia a su cultivo y obtener ganancias que sustenten los gastos del hogar. Su sueño es aumentar la producción y de las ganancias cubrir los gastos de educación de sus hijos. El grupo se llama 19 de Marzo y esta integrado por cuatro personas que se dedican al cultivo de papas y hortalizas, viven en la misma comunidad y solicitan un préstamo grupal por 38,000 lempiras para comprar semillas de papas e insumos para fertilizar el cultivo. En la foto esta Atanacia a la izquierda, María Santos, Ma Presentación y Rina a la derecha.
texts.en: María is 37 years of age, married, has 3 children and lives in a small town that belongs to Yaramanguila, Intibucá. María has always made her living from farming through the growth of vegetables such as cauliflower, broccoli, beetroot, radishes and potatoes, the latter of which she began 5 years ago. The produce is sold at the local market. María has requested her third loan cycle as part of a group which is for 11,000 lempiras, with which she will purchase insecticides, fertilisers, fungicides and potato seeds, in order to better care for her crops and to make a profit to cover the household expenses. Her dream is to increase production and cover the costs of her children's education from the profit. The group is called 19 de Marzo (19th of March) and is made up of four people who make a living by growing potatoes and vegetables, live in the same community and are requesting a group loan of 38,000 lempiras to purchase potato seeds and supplies to fertilise the crop. In the photo Atanacia is on the left, with María Santos, Ma Presentación and Rina on the right.

loans.use: to purchase insecticides, fertilisers, fungicides and potato seeds.

loans.name: Kulsyina

texts.ru: Кулсыйне 48 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Кулсыйны - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Кулсыйна занимается животноводством, стартовав 31 год назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кулсыйны, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 25 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кулсыйна обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Кулсыйна планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Kulsyina is 48 years old, married and she and her husband are raising two children. Kulsyina has high school level education and provides her family's main income by rearing animals, having started 31 years ago when she bought cattle for 5,000 Kyrgyz som. Thanks to Kulsyina's hard work she now has 2 dairy cows and 25 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 11,000 som. 

With the aim of further developing her farm, Kulsyina turned to the bank Bai Tushum for a loan to buy steers in order to increase her livestock. Kulsyina plans to invest the income she will gain from the loan into further augmenting the quantity of domestic cattle, and plans to save up funds to pay for her children's further education.

loans.use: to buy steers

loans.name: Bory

texts.en:
Bory is a silk weaver, while her husband is a moto kangbei taxi driver. In the past, they were commonly known as "tuk tuks" (a three-wheeled motorcycle taxi), but they are now officially called "moto kangbei" by government authorities.

But the motorcycle is breaking down and does not work well. Bory’s husband wants to buy a new motorbike for her husband to replace his old one, so he can continue his business.

Hence Bory decided to apply for a loan to help purchase a new motorbike for her husband.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for her husband to replace his old one.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is 45 years old and an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of five children and her husband is a plumber by profession. He is only responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Shehnaz has also been doing her business of cloth-selling for the past many years and contributes her income with her husband to manage the household.

Shehnaz needs to buy different types of clothes for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means she is not in the position to buy these clothes for her business purposes. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she can purchase the clothes easily to fulfill her business needs, so that she can earn more profitable income to support her family and business.

For this financial assistance Shehnaz is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon is married and owns and operates a general store selling daily-use products in the local community for a living. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and with his generated income was able to repay his previous loan used for the business successfully.

In 2009, Ramon joined GDMPC and he gains access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. And now as improvement to his business, he is successfully engaged in the transportation business, where he earns more income for the family. He is requesting a loan for additional motorcycle maintenance costs. In the future, he wants to have a better living with his family.

loans.use: to pay for additional motorcycle maintenance costs.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta lives in Misamis Occidental with her two children. She runs a retail store selling farm products in their local community to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Her husband works as a driver and it is their main source of income. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more farm products to sell. In the future, she wants to build a house and to be able to give her children the education she did not have. She plans to improve her store in order to gain more income for the future needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy more farm products to sell.

loans.name: Faheem

texts.en:
Faheem is a 50-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of seven children. Her husband is an owner of a spare parts shop by profession; he has been running his business for past 15 years. 

He wants to expand the size of his business and buy different types of automobile spare parts and tool kit for his business purposes so that he can fulfill the demands of his daily customers, and provide a better service for auto spare parts.  Due to financial problems, he is not in such position to bear these expanses.

Therefore his wife, Faheem, has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to afford all relevant expanses in the expansion of his business, and buy the above relevant items to fulfill his customers needs. 

For this financial assistance, Faheem is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of automobile spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani, 22, lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a small shop where he sells beauty products. He contributes his full income for household expenses. 

He always tries to establish his business by offering the latest cosmetics products. Nowadays, the latest cosmetics products introduced in the market are much in demand, and expensive as well. 

Rani requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan; she will give the full amount to her husband so that he can buy the latest cosmetic products such as facial cream, hair color, makeover kit, lipstick, nail polish, etc. 

She hopes that through this amount his business will be enhanced. 

Rani is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy the latest cosmetic products, such as facial cream, hair color, makeover kit, lipstick, nail polish, etc.

loans.name: Erickson

texts.en:
Erickson is a farmer living in the Kisii area of South Nyanza, Kenya with his wife and two children, both of whom are school age.  He has been farming for the past five years, with his primary income source being eggs, crops, and a retail business. 

His biggest challenges are climatic changes and diseases.

Erickson chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer their loans at a low interest rate.

During the training, he learned how to improve his farming activities to better his living standards as a farmer.

Through this loan, he will be able to cater to his family's needs through increased milk production.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
El Señor José tiene 64 años de edad es padre de 4 hijos convive con su esposa, su actividad principal es la caficultura y la agricultura, también se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en su vehiculo hacia Trojes y viceversa cuenta con más de 25 años de dedicarse  a esta actividad obteniendo asi sus ingresos.
Don Jose con el apoyo que reciba de Prisma y Kiva podrá comprar una panel solar y se le hará realidad el sueño de tener energía en su hogar, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros adquiridos.
Don Jose con este proyecto mejorara las condiciones de vida, con el apoyo que reciba del préstamo le contribuirá a lograr sus sueños, y así sentir el apoyo que prisma de Honduras le estaría dando


                                                                                         Trojes, Honduras Febrero 2014
texts.en:
Jose is 64 years old and the father of 4 children. He lives with his wife. Jose's principal activities are coffee growing and agriculture. Also, he transports passengers to Trojes and back in his vehicle. For more than 25 years, Jose has dedicated himself to this activity, thereby earning his income.

With the help he receives from Prisma and Kiva, Jose will be able to purchase a solar panel, realizing his dream of having energy in his home. This will permit him to improve his income and cover family expenses and financial commitments he has acquired.

With this project, Jose will improve his family's conditions of life, and with the loan, he will contribute to achieving his dreams and experience the help that Prisma of Honduras is offering him.

Trojes, Honduras February 2014

loans.use: to buy a solar panel to light his home.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Meet Joshua, a farmer living in the Kisii area of South Nyanza Kenya with his wife and 1 child. He has been a farmer for the past 4 years and his primary sources of income are milk and transportation services. His biggest challenge in farming is climatic changes.

Joshua chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because of the low interest rate on their loans. During the training he learnt ways in which he can better his farming activities. This loan will enable him purchase a dairy cow which will bring in more income by producing more milk. This will improve their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more grocery items for her variety store. Her income from the business is assisting her family's everyday expenses. She also sells mineral water for additional income, and she works hard to provide for her everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 51,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rose dreams that her business will be more successful. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 29-year-old woman, living with her three children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Nadia’s husband has been driving an auto rickshaw and paying a daily fare.  According to the needs of his family, he wants to abstain from the daily fare so he can fulfill the basic needs of his family.

He has been making savings for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw, but at the time of purchase, he is short some money. 

Therefore, Nadia has requested a loan for her husband so he can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of savings.  

She hopes that now that her husband does not have to pay the daily fare, he will get an increase in income. 

Nadia hopes that now her husband will be able to generate more income.  She  is very happy after receiving this loan; she thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy new auto rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Survey Group

texts.en:
Christina is aged in her early 30's and is married with one chlld who is still small. She is doing great with her shop selling kids' clothes. This business enables Christina to manage her family welfare. She has been in this enterprise for one year and is able to make a good profit per month. 

This is her fifth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Christina used the previous loans, all of which she repaid successfully, to replenish her shop with new fashionable clothes and with soft drinks and bites which sold out. She earned extra income which she used to cover part of her home food expenses. Christina will use this loan to buy new kids' clothes for her shop. She dreams that one day she will be able to expand her business with other big branches. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Survey," which totals seven members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new children's clothes for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain her pineapple crop

loans.name: Badriya

texts.en:
Badriya is a 44-year-old divorced mother of five children. She has been working hard to support them and improve their living through employment in the cleaning department of a school. Badriya is old now for such work, and she is very tired. That's why she is starting her own small business at home, selling chocolates, sweets and chips to her neighbors.

Today, Badriya is taking a good step forward by applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to open a convenience store to increase her income and remain capable of supporting her beloved children. Badriya is very excited for this loan because she believes it will have a positive impact on her family and she will be able to rest her sick old body, as she says.

This is Badriya's first cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, and she is planning through her future loans to diversify her products to increase her business capital in a well-managed way.

loans.use: to open a convenience store to increase her income and remain capable of supporting her beloved children

loans.name: Kousar's Group

texts.en: Kousar is 45 years old and the mother of four children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband works in dairy products selling milk, curd and butter. He owns a small dairy farm consisting of buffaloes and cows. He sells milk daily to different tea stalls. He is an honest man. He manages his household necessities with his earnings from milk sales.  He speaks with monotonous tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of his clients. He was in need of one buffalo to increase his income so Kousar applied for loan. In this way she can support her husband's business. She thanks to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for milk.

loans.name: Sangita

texts.en:
Sangita is a very energetic and optimistic woman, who does not want to give up. She lives in a small town, Dhupguri, in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is 30 years old and studied up to grade 9. She is married to Ashutosh, who is 33 years old and has a secondary education. They are raising their only son, who is too young to go to school.

Sangita and her husband together are associated in a clothing business. She had been selling different clothes for the last five years. Her husband purchases ladies’ garments (sarees, frocks, etc.) from wholesale markets, and Sangita sells door to door in her neighborhood and villages near her own.

But nowadays it is hardly possible for them to maintain the household expenses with their small income, as the prices of everything are growing day by day. She wants to expand the business by purchasing more clothing.

Sangita heard about Kiva’s partner, BJS, who give loans to needy rural women. She has taken a loan to purchase varieties of ladies garments to meet customers’ orders and to drastically increase her sales.

With the additional income from her business, she hopes to improve her family's quality of life. Sangita wishes her business would keep growing so that she can support her family by overcoming the financial hurdles.

She is very much grateful to her lenders (BJS and Kiva) for giving her the loan.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for their existing clothing business.

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.es:
Alexandra  es una persona que nació en Bogotá el día 6 del mes de agosto, estudio en el colegio gimnasio los sauces  hasta noveno, cursando noveno grado se enteró que estaba embarazado  y tan joven apenas con tan solo 15 años de edad no pudo seguir estudiando más porque el colegio no le permitió el cual la sacaron del colegio por el estado de embarazo el cual duro un año si estudiar, a pesar de no poder estudiar no se detuvo termino el bachiller en el año 2012, ella tiene un hermoso hijo de 4 años que es la vida, prepara un futuro para el  siendo una madre tan joven con 19 años, se esfuerza mucho para brindarle a el hijo lo mejor de ella y tanto de manera económica como afectiva. 
En el momento no está trabajando, pero está en busca de una estabilidad laboral, planea en el futuro ejercer lo que más le apasiona desde que estaba pequeña que es la enfermería, el cual es la pasión y aspiración para sacar a el hijo adelante tanto económico como  persona en la vida. 
Ella necesita del convenio kiva ya que no cuenta con el suficiente recurso económico para poder pagar las cuotas en el valor mensual que tiene campo alto, a ella se le facilitaría un poco el pago de las cuotas mensuales ya que con kiva le quedaría el valor mas económico a cancelar y el dinero lo podría invertir en los gastos del hijo o del hogar.
texts.en:
Alexandra was born in Bogota on August 6. she studied at the Colegio Gimnasio Los Sauces until she completed the ninth grade, when she learned that she was pregnant at just 15 years of age.  She could no longer study because the school would not permit pregnant girls to attend. For the next year she did not study. But Alexandra didn't let this halt her. She completed high school in 2012.

Alexandra has a beautiful son, now 4 years old, who is her life. She is preparing for her future, though a mother at the age of 19. She puts forth much effort so that her son can have the best she can offer, in economic or money terms.

At present, Alexandra is not working, but is seeking stable work, planning to do in the future what she has most wanted since she was little, to be a nurse. It is also her passion and aspiration to advance her son in life, in both economic and personal terms.

Alexandra needs to utilize the Kiva agreement since she can't count on sufficient economic resources to be able to pay her monthly fees at Campo Alto. It is convenient for her to make monthly payments, since in the case of Kiva, this is the most economic method of repaying what she owes, and her money will be invested in her son's or the household's expenses.

loans.use: to pay the matriculation fee for a semester at Campo Alto.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es: Marisol tiene 41 años de edad es conviviente con 03 hijos educando. Ella hace muchos años que implemento su bodega en su vivienda que le permite tener un ingreso con el cual   puede apoyar a su esposo con la educación y alimentación de sus hijos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de en la compra demás arroz azúcar aceite y bebidas. Marisol en el grupo “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN” cumple la función de tesorera. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el brindado. Marisol es la primera del lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
Marisol is 41 years old; she has a partner and 3 children who are in school. Many years ago she started a small grocery store in her home which permits her to have an income with which she can help her husband with the education and nourishment of their children. The loan will be used to buy more rice, sugar, oil and drinks. 

Marisol is part of the group "VIRGEN DEL CARMEN" and she serves as the treasurer. The group thanks KIVA's investors for the loan. Marisol is first from the left.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, oil and drinks

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es: Don Marco Tulio se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la venta y elaboración de dulces típicos. Sus dulces los elabora con ingredientes propios de la región, y los lleva a vender a las ferias departamentales y municipales. Los dulces gustan a toda la gente debido a la buena elaboración y sabor. Este es su segundo crédito y sus pagos los realizo siempre en la fecha de pago. Solicita el crédito para comprar azúcar, coco, camote, pepita, manías y panela para la elaboracion de dulces.
texts.en:
Marco Tulio has been making and selling traditional candies for over 5 years. He makes his candy using ingredients from his region, and he sells them at state and municipal fairs. People like his candy because of the way he makes it and the flavour. 

This is his second loan and he always made all of his payments on the day that they were due. He is requesting this loan to buy sugar, coconut, yams, pumpkin seed, peanuts, and unrefined brown sugar to make the candies.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coconut, yams, pumpkin seed, peanuts, and unrefined brown sugar to make candies.

loans.name: Manuel Enrrique

texts.es:
El Señor Manuel, tiene 45 años de edad es padre de 2 hijos convive con su esposa, su actividad principal es la caficultura y la agricultura.
Don Manuel cuenta con más de 20 años de dedicarse  a esta actividad este tipo de producto lo venden a los intermediarios en la Ciudad de Trojes quedándole muy buenas ganancias, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros adquiridos.
Don Manuel el préstamo lo solicita para la compra de un panel solar con este proyecto mejorara las condiciones de vida, con el apoyo que reciba del préstamo le contribuirá a lograr sus sueños, y así ayudar a sus hijos a que puedan tener acceso a la tecnología.


                                                                                           Trojes, Honduras Febrero 2014
texts.en:
El Señor Manuel, tiene 45 años de edad es padre de 2 hijos convive con su esposa, su actividad principal es la caficultura y la agricultura. Don Manuel cuenta con más de 20 años de dedicarse a esta actividad este tipo de producto lo venden a los intermediarios en la Ciudad de Trojes quedándole muy buenas ganancias, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros adquiridos. Don Manuel el préstamo lo solicita para la compra de un panel solar con este proyecto mejorara las condiciones de vida, con el apoyo que reciba del préstamo le contribuirá a lograr sus sueños, y así ayudar a sus hijos a que puedan tener acceso a la tecnología. Trojes, Honduras Febrero 2014

Manuel is 45 and is the father of 2 children, and he lives with his wife. His main work is agriculture and coffee growing, Manuel has been working at this for more than 20 years. This type of produce is sold to intermediaries in Ciudad de Trojes, which provides him with a good profit. This helps him improve his income to cover the family bills and his financial commitments.

Manuel is asking for the loan to buy a solar panel, through which he will be able to improve his living conditions. The support from the loan will help him achieve his dreams: to help his children have access to technology.

Trojes, Honduras February 2014

loans.use: to buy a solar panel.

loans.name: Nuevos Horizontes  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Nuevos Horizontes está formado por 7 mujeres quienes viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por la belleza de su centro Histórico que es una mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno, lo que le dio el nombre de Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad en Diciembre de 1999, su variada gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente es amable, gentil y de un corazón cálido. Las socias son mujeres luchadoras que día a día trabajan para mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares y así sacar  adelante a sus hijos.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Alexandra, tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 11 y 5 años que están estudiando en una escuelita del sector, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
Doña Alexandra desde hace 8 años se dedica al a venta de ropa de todo tipo y comida rápida, labora de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
 El dinero de su crédito va a  invertir en la compra de ropa para su clientela. Su meta es  tener un almacén para vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
The Nuevos Horizontes (New Horizons) loan group consists of seven women who live in the city of Cuenca. This city is known for the beauty of its historic center, which is a mix of the colonial and the modern, and which was named a Cultural Heritage of Humanity site in December of 1999. Its varied gastronomy captivates the palates of it residents and visitors, and its people are friendly and gentle and have warm hearts. The members of the group are hard-working women who work every day to improve the economic stability of their households and thus raise their children.

One of the members of this group is Señora Alexandra. She is 31 years old. She is the single mother of two children, ages 11 and 5, who attend a little school in the neighborhood. She does not have her own house, so she rents. 

For eight years Doña Alexandra has sold clothing of all types as well as fast food. She works every day without a fixed schedule. She is going to invest the money from her loan in the purchase of clothing for her customers. Her goal is to have a shop where she can sell her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en:
Sary, 29, is from a rural village located in the Moung Russey district of the Battambang province. She and her husband have been earning a living through farming rice to feed the family for almost two years. The current business earns her family about 22,000 KHR per day.
Sary is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Sary will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland, and use a portion of it to spend on land ploughing. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Darwin

texts.en: Darwin is single and helps his parents with his transportation services for a living. For three years, Darwin was happy to say that this helps his parents a lot. He dreams of building his own future home to provide them a comfortable style of living for his future family. It is quite a big dream, but he works hard to achieve this. He borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro finance for maintenance costs of his motorcycle. In the future, he wants to earn more through this by thinking it is not only a service, but a business in order  to reach his dreams of having a better future.

loans.use: for maintenance costs of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is a 44-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her husband is a chef by profession; he provides services for cooking food for marriage ceremonies, parties and funfair programs. He cooks delicious Pakistani food such as biryani, qorma, roast chicken and fish, and for sweet dishes he prepares firni and kheer. He is a very famous chef from his town and most people like to order food for their ceremonies from him. Sometimes he has to cook many dishes at a time, these times he faces problems due to a shortage of cauldrons. 

Therefore, Allah Rakhi has requested for a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband will be able to buy new cauldrons, spices, utensils and fire woods for cooking food.

Allah Rakhi thanks Kiva and field partner, Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new cauldrons, spices, utensils, and fire woods for providing chef services.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
El Señor David tiene 39 años de edad,  su actividad es la caficultura y también cuenta con una pequeña pulpería donde ofrece productos de la canasta básica familiar como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, jabon, papel, detergente, condimentos, aceite, manteca y otros.
Don David tiene 15 años de dedicarse  a este tipo de actividad tiene una buena clientela ya que su negocio esta ubicado en un lugar muy estratégico de alto comercio.
Don David esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de una planta solar ya que su sueño es tener energía eléctrica en su hogar,  lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y así obtener  mejores ganancias.
Su sueños es mejorar las condiciones de vida de el y su familia, con el apoyo que reciba del préstamo le contribuirá a lograr sus sueños y así Ayudar a sacar adelante a su familia.                                                                   
                                                                                   Trojes, Honduras febrero 2014
texts.en:
David is 39 and works growing coffee, but he also runs a small neighbourhood store that sells basic staples such as rice, beans, sugar, soap, paper, detergent, condiments, oil and butter. He's been doing this job for 15 years, and he has a good clientele because his business is strategically sited in a high-trade area.

David is asking for this loan to buy a solar generator, as his dream is to have electricity at home. This would let him improve his income and thus allow him make a bigger profit.

His dream is to improve living conditions for himself and his family. The loan will contribute to this dream so he can provide for his family.
Trojes, Honduras February 2014

loans.use: to buy a solar generator.

loans.name: Geralyn

texts.en:
Geralyn lives in Misamis Occidental with her two children. She runs a servi-e based business in their local community to earn a living and had this business for eight months. She offers gown rental and make-over services.  Her husband works as a carpenter and it is their main source of income.  

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit   to buy additional gowns and accessories.  In the future,she wants to have a better house than she has now and to be able to give her children the education she did not have. She planned to expand her business to become a beauty parlor in order to cater more services to gain more income for the future needs of the family .

loans.use: to buy additional gowns and accessories

loans.name: Dora Maria

texts.es: Dora es una señora de 52 años de edad, madre de un hijo quien le brinda apoyo económico, ella se dedica a la venta de productos variados como pastes de baño, toallas, bolsos entre otros de manera ambulante, así se gana la vida siendo una mujer soltera. Solicita este primer crédito para realizar el porche de su humilde vivienda, esta obra es muy importante ya que con este anexo podrá gozar de mayor espacio, se le facilitara instalar su negocio en su casa y dejar de exponerse en las calles, lo que podrá lograr solamente con el apoyo de financiamiento.
texts.en:
Dora is a 52-year-old woman and the mother of a son who brings in financial support. She sells various products such as bath scrubbers, towels, bags, and other items as a street vendor. This is how she earns her living as a single woman.

Dora is requesting her first loan so that she can build a porch for her modest home. This project is very important because it will give her more living space that she can enjoy. It would also give her the opportunity to set up her business at home so that she wouldn’t have to travel through the streets. The only way for her to accomplish this goal is with the support of financing.

loans.use: to buy materials and pay for labor in order to build a porch for her home.

loans.name: Elin Samuel

texts.es:
El Señor Elin tiene 29 años de edad, convive con su compañera de hogar es padre de 2 hijos su actividad es la caficultura y también se dedica al cultivo de plátanos.
Don Elin cuenta con más de 17 años de dedicarse  a este tipo de actividad económica, El esta  solicitando el crédito para la compra de una planta solar ya que no cuenta con energía en su casa.
A Don Elin esta planta solar le permitirá cumplir sus sueños de tener luz en su hogar y  mejorar su condición de vida.
Don Elin su sueños es mejorar las condiciones de vida y tener una estabilidad económica en el futuro de el y toda su familia, con el apoyo que reciba del préstamo le contribuirá a lograr sus sueños y así hacer que su familia tenga mejores condiciones de vida.
                                                                       
                                                                                   Trojes, Honduras febrero 2014
texts.en:
Elin is 29 and lives with his life partner. He is the father of 2 children. His job is growing coffee and bananas. He has been doing this work for 17 years.

He is asking for the loan to buy a solar generator as he doesn't have electricity in his house. This generator would let him achieve his dream of having light in his home and improving his living conditions, It is his dream to improve things and have economic stability in the future for him and all his family. The support from the loan will contribute towards achieving his dreams and thus ensuring a better quality of life for his family.
Trojes, Honduras, February 2014

loans.use: to buy a solar generator.

loans.name: Rosa Elsa

texts.es:
Rosa, se ha decidido por otro crédito para comprar maíz, frijol, maicillo y concentrado para cerdos, fortalecerá el negocio incorporando la comercialización de granos básicos, esto es con el fin de tener ingresos extras para continuar mejorando el estilo de vida familiar.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a superar las dificultades económicas que tenía en su momento para adquirir los insumos agrícolas con los cuales pudo llevar a cavo la siembra, tener una cosecha abundante, sus ventas mejoraron y su economía es más estable.
texts.en:
Rosa has decided to take on another loan to buy corn, beans, sorghum, and feed for pigs. She will strengthen her business by incorporating the sale of basic grains, with the goal of having extra income to continue improving her family’s lifestyle. 

The previous loan helped her overcome the economic difficulties she once had in acquiring agricultural supplies which enabled her to sow and have an abundant harvest. Her sales improved and her finances are more stable.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, sorghum, and feed for pigs

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
Tomasa previously accessed an 26,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 26,000 PHP for her to buy additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Tomasa dreams that her business will grow bigger, and hopes to have a peaceful and fulfilled life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week, where she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
