* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en: Kiran is a 30-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan, and is the mother of four children. Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas and oranges in his shop. Presently he is interested in offering more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However due to the lack of money he finds this difficult. Therefore his wife, Kiran, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband purchase a variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at a profitable price. With the profits, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Kiran is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruits for her husband's fruit shop.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia previously accessed a 24,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Julia hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed for her business.

loans.name: Ricarda

texts.en: Ricarda is 50 years old and lives in Sumasap, Pana-on. She has been cultivating her garden for five years and also grows and harvests coconut for a living. She wants to have a greener farm in order to gain an abundant harvest. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC to buy organic fertilizers. All she dreams of is for her children to become successful in the future. She solely provides for her children since she is separated from her husband. In the future, she wants to have better living conditions with the help of her children.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Mariyam

texts.en:
Mariyam is a 42-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. 

Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas and oranges in his shop. Presently, he is interested in offering more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult. Therefore, his wife Mariyam has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of fruits from the field to sell in the market at profitable prices. 

With the profit amount, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Mariyam is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of fruits for her husband's fruit shop.

loans.name: Von's Group

texts.en:
Von is aged 31 years and married. She lives with her husband and two children in a rural area located in the Moung Russey District, Cambodia. 

She is a rice farmer of five hectares of farmland, and she has been in this business for 12 years.  She also works for others for a fee. The current business earns her family about 57,000 KHR per day to feed the family, but she manages to save about 30,000 KHR each day.

This is the third loan for Von with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to plow the field. She hopes this loan will enable her to produce more crops so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to plow the field.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 12,000 day-old chicks, chicken feed, and medications

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 57 years old and blessed with only one child. They live in a rural community, managing a small tailoring shop. She has been operating the business for almost eight years, and usually earns a net income of PHP 2,500.00 a month. 

Due to financial insufficiency, she aims to improve the business and make it more profitable in order to generate a higher income. Having limited capital, she is seeking for a loan of PHP 10,000.00 to buy needed fabrics, thread, hooks and eyes, zippers and other materials needed in the tailoring shop. 

She is hoping that she will prevail in her loan request to be able her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy needed fabrics, thread, hooks and eyes, zippers and other materials needed in the tailoring shop.

location.town: Brgy. Palabotan, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya previously accessed a 9,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ligaya hopes to have more customers, and dreams that her family will always be in good health.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Nighat

texts.en:
Nighat is a 46-year-old active borrower with BRAC Pakistan. She has two children, and her husband is the only family member earning for the household. He is a carpenter by profession, and he has been running his carpentry business for many years.

Nighat's husband wants to buy pieces of wood and other accessories for his furniture business to fulfill the demands of his customers. Due to financial constraints, he is not in a position to buy this merchandise. Therefore, Nighat has requested a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to expand the size of his business and will help him to buy the relevant merchandise. Nighat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy wood and accessories for a furniture business.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Meet Francis, a well established farmer located in the Ndaragwa area of Central Kenya, where he lives with his wife and 5 children. He has been farming for the past 20 years; his primary income sources are from milk, eggs, and crops. He enjoys dairy farming the most, but his biggest challenge is drought, which affects his crops and livestock.

Francis chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they will help him improve his farming activities. During the training, he learned how he can improve his livelihood in farming. This loan will improve the way he cares for his livestock because they will be in an area more conducive to production. This will also improve his income and better his family's living standards.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Arnoldo Joel

texts.es:
Arnoldo de 43 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado de nivel académico,  está casado,   la esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos,  ha procreado 1 hijo en este matrimonio y el niño ya está estudiando, pero también con él viven 3 hijastros.  

Arnoldo  se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 12 años de edad, este trabajo se lo enseño unos tíos;   ya que el papá falleció cuando él tenía 10 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de compartir la juventud con él y que él le enseñara el trabajo pero los tíos se preocuparon por inculcarle siempre por el buen camino y le enseñaron  este oficio para  que en un futuro se pudieran defender. Este trabajo le queda a una distancia de 10 minutos  y él viaja a pie, solo a esto se dedica, su horario es de las 6 de la mañana hasta las doce del mediodía. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para pagar el alquiler de la tierra donde cultiva el maíz,  ya que ha decidido prepararse con tiempo; porque ahorita están alquilando muy cómoda la tierra  esto le ayudara mucho ya que cuando el tiempo se pasa y no se ha preparado ya tienen más valor las propiedades donde las alquilan. 

Los sueños que tiene  es que siempre Dios le preste vida para seguir cultivando la tierra y tener como llevar el sostén de la casa; ya que este fruto esta cosecha que ahorita posee es con el sudor de su frente y es así como quiero seguir para sacar adelante a su hijo y también enseñarles los buenos principios a sus hijastros y que se superen en el estudio ya que es la única herencia que les puedeo dejar.
texts.en:
Arnoldo, 43, studied through the third grade level. He is married and his wife is engaged in the household chores. He has one son from this marriage and the child is in school. He also has three stepchildren living with him.

Arnoldo has earned his living in farming since he was 12 years old. His uncles taught him this work because his father died when he was only 10 years old. He did not have the opportunity to spend his youth with his father and he was taught to work because his uncles were concerned and always tried to point him in the right direction so that he could have a good future. He works ten minutes away from his home and travels on foot. He works from 6 am until noon.

He is requesting a loan to pay rent on the land where he will grow corn because he has decided to prepare the land ahead of time. He is currently doing well with renting land and this will help a lot because if he does not prepare the land in time the properties where he rents will not bring more value.

He dreams that God will give him life to continue farming the land and being the breadwinner for his family. The fruit of his harvest comes by the sweat of his brow and he wants to continue to do so as well as raise his son and teach good principles to his stepchildren so that they do well in school because their education will be the only inheritance he can give to them.

loans.use: to pay rent on his farmland.

loans.name: Upendo Oysterbay Group

texts.en:
Esther, who is in her mid 30s, is single. She has been selling cosmetics since 2011. She works from 8am to 8pm daily and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Esther's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy more good-quality cosmetics to meet her customers' demands. She dreams of making progress in her business.

Esther will share this loan with her loan group, Upendo Oysterbay Group, which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more good-quality cosmetics to meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is a very dedicated daughter who wants to become successful in the future. She has three siblings living with her parents. 

She is studying in a university for a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration. She needs financial assistance to pay the school tuition fees for the second semester. Hopefully in the future, she will finish her courses and find a decent job.

loans.use: to pay her school tuition fees.

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Man is a 46-year-old mother of four children, living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. 

To make a living, Man and her husband have been farming rice and her husband supplements the family’s income by working. The current business earns her about KHR 35,000 per day to meet the family’s needs. 

This is Man's second micro-loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund Cambodia. She completely paid back the past loan. 

Man is now applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income, so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fertilize her coffee plants.

loans.name: Thoern's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Moung Russey district, where rice farming is a common way to make a living, Thoern is a 56-year-old mother of five children. 

Rice farming is the main source of the family’s income, which she and her husband have been doing for 30 years. Her husband supplements the income by working for others, for a fee. She can earn about KHR 17,000 per day to meet the family’s needs. 

This is the sixth micro-loan for Thoern with VisioFund Cambodia and she completely paid back the past loans. Now, she is leading her group to seek a loan. 

As the leader, Thoern is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to have another source of family income, so as to increase her income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 31 years old, from Nyahururu. She is married to David and they are blessed with four children, aged 7, 4, 2 years, and 6 months old.

Susan has been running her green grocer business for the last ten years and, to enable her to buy more stocks of fruit and vegetables to sell to her customers, she has applied for her second loan from VisionFund Kenya, in the amount of KES 27,000.

With her previous loan of KES 20,000, Susan managed to buy stocks in bulk, which she sold to her customers, thus, increasing her monthly income from KES 8,000 to KES 12,000. She intends to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to start a fruit and vegetables wholesale shop.

In the future, Susan hopes to be the main supplier of fruit and vegetables in her area.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fruit and vegetables to sell to customers.

loans.name: Husnoro

texts.ru: Хусноро женщина-предприниматель из района Дангара. Она в настоящий момент разведена и ей 63 года. Хусноро в этой жизни повидала многое, поэтому она верит в свои силы и в поддержку детей. Хусноро родила и воспитала шестерых сыновей и одну дочь. Все ее дети, кроме младшего сына, уже обзаведены семьями. С ней живет только трое ее сыновей, двое невесток и трое ее внуков. Хусноро счастлива, потому что она имеет замечательную семью и свой малый прибыльный бизнес. Вот уже 7 лет как Хусноро занимается торговлей продуктов питания. В бизнесе ей помогают двое ее сыновей. Сейчас она обратилась за кредитом так как хочет увеличить товарооборот. Она на сумму кредита собирается закупить и разнообразить ассортимент продуктов питания. Хусноро надеется, что ее поддержат.
texts.en:
Husnoro is a female entrepreneur from the Dangara region. She is a divorced 63-year-old. Husnoro has seen a lot in her life, and thus believes in her strength and in the support of her children. 

She gave birth to, and raised, six sons and one daughter. All of her children, except her youngest son, have their own families. She lives with three of her sons, two daughters-in-law and three grandchildren. 

Husnoro is happy because she has a wonderful family and her own small profitable business which she started seven years ago. Two of her sons help her with the store. She now wants to take a loan to increase her inventory. She would like to buy a diverse assortment of foodstuffs. Husnoro hopes that she will receive support.

loans.use: to buy food for resale.

loans.name: Melagros

texts.en:
Melagros, a widow, has managed a general store for five years and she earns well to support her needs. She has sustained it with the support of the entire family. Her children were already married and had their own families. 

Melagros took a loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to buy additional grocery goods to sell.  

In the future, Melagros wants to improve the business as well as the general condition of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area located in the Moung Russey district where rice farming is a common way to earn a living, Pov is aged 47 years and married. As a mother, she has struggled to feed her six children by farming rice on two hectares of farmland and working for others for a fee. Having been in the business for 20 years, the current business earns her approximately 30,000 KHR per day.

Pov has been with VisionFund for eight cycles and she completely paid back the loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Pov wants to use her portion to pay for labor fees in plowing the field. She hopes to make more income so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees in plowing the field

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Зухро вдова. У нее один единственный сын в возрасте 19 лет, которому пришлось ехать на заработки в Россию. Зухро живет сейчас одна в районе Дангара. Год назад по совету подруги она начала свою торговую деятельность. Зухро на рынке занимается продажей овощей и зелени. Ей нравится ее бизнес, так как благодаря ему она общается со многими людьми и не чувствует свое одиночество. Сейчас она хочет немного расширить свой бизнес и просит кредит для купли партии овощей и зелени. За счет прибыли она хотела бы улучшить бытовые условия.
texts.en:
Zuhro is divorced with a 19-year-old son who went abroad to Russia for work. She lives alone in the Dangara region. 

She started a business a year ago, on the advice of her friend. Zuhro sells vegetables and greens at the market. She enjoys her business because her interaction with a lot of people. It makes her feel less lonely. She would like to grow her business a bit and requests credit to buy vegetables and greens. With the profits she would like to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy and resell vegetables and greens.

loans.name: Marta

texts.pt:
A Sra Marta de 52 anos de idade, solteira e mae de 5 filhos dos quais 2 estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario os 3 sem idade para frequentar escola. Ela è negociante informal de produtos da 1ª necessidade actividade que esta a exercer a mais de 7 anos, seus produtos vende na porta da sua casa uma vez que ela nao possue um estabelecimento comercial, sustenta 3 netos que vive com ela.
O presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar produtos da 1ª necessidade (feijao verde, refregerante, arroz, caldos, cebola, farrinha de milhoe mais deversos produtos )para revenda, seu desafio é aumentar o volume do seu negocio de modo a garantir uma boa renda para familia.
texts.en:
Marta is 52 years old and single. She has five children, two of whom attend primary and secondary school and three are below school age. She's an informal trader of household staples, a business she has run for over seven years. She sells her merchandise at her front door, since she doesn't have a store. She supports three grandchildren who live with her.
The current loan will be used to purchase products that are household staples (green beans, soft drinks, rice, broths, onions, cornflour and various other items) for re-selling. Her challenge is increasing turnover in her business so that she can ensure a good income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase products that are household staples (green beans, soft drinks, rice, broths, onions, cornflour and various other items) in order to increase turnover in her business.

loans.name: Mganza Grp Group

texts.en:
Bless is a father of one son and one daughter who are in school. He is in his early 40s and, since 2000, he has been engaged in health service. He owns a pharmacy. Bless' business is so important to his community, so restocking all required medicines is the task that Bless plans to meet. He is married and does business from 6am to 2pm daily and is able to make a small, monthly profit. 

This is Bless' first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to buy medicine for his pharmacy. He dreams that, one day, he will be able to expand his pharmacy shop. 

Bless will share this loan with his loan group, Mganza Grp Group, which totals nine members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy medicine for his pharmacy.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.pt:
A Sra Julieta de 50 anos de idade,solteira e mae de 6 filhos dos quais 3 estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario os 3 sem idade para frequentar escola. Ela è negociante informal de produtos da 1ª necessidade e produtos da machamba  actividade que esta a exercer a mais de 15 anos, seus produtos vende na banca construida na porta da sua casa.
Com  emprestimo pretende comprar produtos da 1ª necessidade (feijao verde, refregerante, arroz, caldos, cebola, farrinha de milhoe mais deversos produtos ) para revenda, ampliando deste modod o seu volume do negocio para melhorar a sua renda, que constitui o desafio do momento.
texts.en:
Julieta is 50 years old and single. She has six children, three of whom attend primary and secondary school and three are below school age. She's an informal trader of household staples and farm produce, a business she has run for over 15 years. She sells her merchandise at a stand she built by her front door.
With the loan she intends to purchase products that are household staples (green beans, soft drinks, rice, broths, onions, cornflour and various other items) for re-selling. That way she'll increase turnover in her business in order to improve her income, which is her challenge at the moment.

loans.use: to purchase products that are household staples (green beans, soft drinks, rice, broths, onions, cornflour and various other items) in order to increase turnover in her business.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is 25 years old from Olkalou. He is still single and takes care of his siblings and parents.

He has been running his business of selling motor vehicle spare parts for the last five years and to enable him to buy more stock of spare parts to sell to his customers, he has applied for his second loan of KES 94,500 from VisionFund Kenya.

His monthly income right now is KES 52,000 and his plan is to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to buy more spare parts and to repay his loan.

In the future, Boniface looks forward to being successful in business and life.

loans.use: To buy more stock of motor vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Shephali

texts.en:
Shephali is 32 years old, and her husband is 37 years old. Both of them are illiterate and able to sign their names only. They earn by cultivating different crops in their field. They have two children, and both are receiving secondary education. 

Due to lack of capital, it was not possible for them grow their agribusiness. They are unable to buy different seeds, fertilizers, etc. for cultivation. For this reason, they have taken the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) so that they can buy seeds and fertilizers for cultivation. Now they plan to cultivate chili. 

They hope that the loan that they have taken will help them to grow their agribusiness and that they will have high profits from it. 

Shephali is highly grateful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for chili cultivation.

loans.name: Helena

texts.pt:
A Sra Helena de 66 anos de idade, solteira e mae de 5 filhos dos quais 2 estao  a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e 3 sao independentes. Ela è negociante informal de produtos da 1ª necessidade actividade que esta a exercer a mais de 15 anos, seus produtos vende num estabelecimento comercial em frente de uma escola primaria, faz pequenas refeicoes para os estudantes e professores.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar produtos da 1ª necessidade (refregerante, arroz, caldos bolachas, farrinha de milho e mais deversos produtos ) para aumentar o volume do seu negocio.
texts.en:
Helena is 66 years old and single. She has five children, two of whom attend primary school and three are independent. She's an informal trader of household staples, a business she has run for over 15 years. She sells her merchandise at a store located in front of an elementary school. She also prepares small meals for the students and teachers.
The current loan will be used to purchase products that are household staples (soft drinks, rice, broths, crackers, cornflour and various other items) so that she can increase turnover in her business.

loans.use: to purchase products that are household staples (soft drinks, rice, broths, cornflour and various other items) in order to increase turnover in her business.

loans.name: Sultana

texts.en:
Sultana is a 49-year-old lady, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children. Her husband is a guardian of his family and is responsible for managing the household. One of her sons has been providing services as an auto mechanic for many years, and he contributes his income to fulfill the family's needs.

Sultana's son wants to buy different types of tools, other accessories, and spare parts for the purpose of his business.  However, due to insufficient financial resources, he is unable to buy these items. Therefore, Sultana has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan so that she can financially assist her son to fulfill his business needs and enable him to buy merchandise for his business purposes.

Sultana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of tools and accessories for her son's business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.pt:
Mãe viúva de 5 filhos, todos ainda na sua responsabilidade, tem 48 anos de idade, vive na casa própria à base da agricultura que é a sua única fonte de rendimento. Tem a sua machamba numa das associações de agricultores em Moamba onde produz diversas culturas que vende a postorior no mercado grossista e este é segundo credito com  a Hluvuku, depois de ter parado por um tempo apos ter terminado o primeiro.
Com este empréstimo ela pretende comprar sementes, pesticidas, fertilizantes, etc, para produzir feijão verde. 
Sua maior esperança é poder desenvolver mais a sua actividade, melhorar suas condições de vida e garantir um futuro melhor para seus filhos.
Seus desafios são os riscos que corre no seio da sua actividade de por vezes perder tudo que tiver investido e mesmo assim, nunca desistiu.
texts.en:
Ana is a widowed mother of five children, all of whom are still under her care. She's 48 years old and lives in a house that she owns. Her livelihood is agriculture, which is her only source of income. She has her farm in one of the farmers' associations of Moamba, where she grows various crops which she then sells at the wholesale market. This is her second loan with Hluvuku after she took a break once she finished the first one.
With this loan she intends to purchase seeds, pesticide, fertilizer, etc., in order to grow green beans.
Her greatest hope is to be able to move her business forward, improve her living conditions and ensure a better future for her children.
Her challenges are the risks involved in her business in terms of sometimes losing everything she has invested, and yet, she never gave up.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, pesticide, fertilizer, etc., in order to grow green beans.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Due to financial insufficiency, Rosita aims to improve her small retail store to help her husband in sustaining the necessities of their family. With the help of her husband, she believes that someday they will improve their standard of living. 

To improve the business, Rosita is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy additional stock of vegetables, fish, canned goods, beverages, noodles, laundry soap, soft drinks and seasonings to resell in her store. Being a diligent mother, she believes that she will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of vegetables, fish, canned goods, beverages, noodles, laundry soap, soft drinks and seasonings to sell

location.town: Brgy. Ganao, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Salomi's Group

texts.en:
Salomi is a 38-year old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children. Her husband owns an electronics shop in which he offers televisions and LCD TVs on installments. He sells a number of types of TV and LCD TV brands such as Sony, Samsung, LG, Nobel and Panasonic. He also offers a one-year warranty for those electronic products. 

Salomi’s husband wants to grow his business and offer more electronics to his customers but he does not have enough capital for investment. So Salomi requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which is the field partner of Kiva. Through this loan, her husband will buy more electronic products to sell on installments. Salomi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more more electronic products to sell.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a 24 year old, very hardworking gentleman, who is newly married to Joan. He has been employed in the motorcycle transport business for the last two years with a monthly income of about 15,000 KES. He learnt about VisionFund from some of his colleagues who are funded by the organisation.

Jackson has acquired his second loan of 87,880 KES which will help him in purchasing his own motorbike. He is likely to earn more due to the increased flexibility and already established customer base. He plans to use the earnings to repay his loan as well as boost his savings account. He hopes to buy another motorcycle from his accumulated savings. 

He is an industrious gentleman who is determined to achieve his goal and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is 35 years old, from Nyahururu. She is married to Joseph and they are blessed with two children, aged 12 and 5 years old. She is a shopkeeper, a business she has been running for the last three years. In order to buy bulk stock of soft drinks, cooking fat, and sugar, she has applied for her first loan of 20,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya.

Her monthly income right now is 9,000 KES and her intention is to use profits anticipated from her expanded business to pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya and to educate her children. In the future, she hopes to open the biggest supermarket in her area.

loans.use: To buy bulk stock of soft drinks, cooking fat, and sugar, for resale to her customers

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 27 years old and is from Nyahururu. He is married to Monicah, and they are blessed with two children ages 3 and 2 years.

He is a butcher, a business he has been running for the last two years. To enable him to buy goats for slaughter and to sell the meat to his customers, he has applied for a first loan of 20,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya.

His monthly income currently is 9,000 KES and his intention is to use profits anticipated from his expanded business to educate his children and to pay his loan back to VisionFund Kenya.

In the future, he hopes to engage in dairy farming.

loans.use: to buy goats so he can sell the meat to his customers at the butchery.

loans.name: Diolinda

texts.pt:
Tem 56 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, mãe muito batalhadora de 7 filhos dos quais 6 maiores de idade, 5 já com suas casas e 2 ainda na sua responsabilidade, bem como 5 netos que cuida deles com ajuda de seu esposo. Ela vive de negocio com larga experiencia na venda de loiça plástica que compra na Africa do sul e esta a repetir pela quarta vez o crédito com a Hluvuku.
Com o empréstimo pretende comprar loiça plástico como:  bacias, tigelas, cadeiras, jarras, etc, para ampliar o seu negocio.
Seu maior desejo é poder adquirir bens para mobilar a sua casa.
Tem como desafio a falta de capital suficiente para aumentar sua mercadoria, porque diz ter muitos clientes que não consegue satisfazer seus pedidos.
texts.en:
Diolinda is 56 years old and married. She's a very hardworking mother of seven children, six of whom are adults. Five of them already have their own homes and two are still under her care. She also takes care of five grandchildren with the help of her husband. She earns a living through her business and has a great deal of experience selling plastic kitchen ware which she buys in South Africa. This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku.
With the loan she intends to purchase plastic kitchen ware such as basins, bowls, chairs, pitchers, etc., so she can expand her business.
Her biggest wish is to be able to buy goods in order to furnish her home.
Her challenge is not having enough capital to stock up on merchandise, since she reports that she has several customers and can't meet their orders.

loans.use: to purchase plastic kitchen ware such as basins, bowls, chairs, pitchers, etc., so she can expand her business.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 41 years old, married, and together with his spouse they have been blessed with four children. He runs a retail shop and has been in the business for nine years now. Right now his monthly income is KES 60,000. He also has a mobile money transfer business.

Charles will be using this loan to purchase more stock of goods for sale. These include sugar, cooking fat, maize flour and rice. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business and also to repay the loan.

This is his fifth loan term from VisionFund Kenya and he has repaid his previous loans successfully. In the future, Charles hopes to be successful in his business.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, cooking fat and rice to sell.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 39-year-old woman residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. She maintained her household activities properly. She has been running a beauty salon for the last six years. She is a well-trained beautician. Due to her efficient and good work, her number of clients increases day by day. Therefore, she requires some beauty salon-related items such as facial creams, combs,  and furniture items such as dressing chairs and mirrors. 

For this reason, Razia contacted Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan. BRAC staff visited her enterprise and issued a loan. Razia is very thankful to Brac Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy facial creams, combs, and furniture items such as dressing chairs and mirrors for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Channary

texts.en: Channary is 19 years old. She is a student who lives in Kampong Cham Province. Now, she has moved to Phnom Penh to study. Channary would like to apply for a loan of 1,785 USD to pay for her tuition fee. This loan helps her to get a higher education and releases her parents’ burden. In the future, she hopes that she can be a staff member in the banking sector and get a higher salary to support her family.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition fee

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 25-year-old single young man from Jabalia city. He lives with his mother and brothers in a small house. His mother is an employee in a local firm where she gets a low income. Abdallah is a student in a local university where he studies health management and is in his last semester. He would like to finish his studies so that he can find a job in the future and improve his family's living conditions. 

Abdallah took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Abdallah will be able to do his homework and prepare for his seminar. 

Abdallah appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Son Eng

texts.en:
Son Eng is aged 58 years old and married. She is a mother of seven children, one of whom is still in school. To make a living, she and her husband have been growing cassava and working for others for a fee for 39 years. The current business earns her about US$12 per day to support the family’s needs. 
This is her second loan with VisionFund. She successfully paid back the past loan which has helped her better support her family. Now she is seeking a loan to buy seeds for her cassava. She will also use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield in order to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy seeds for her cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district, Sopheap is a 35-year-old widowed mother of two children. The main sources of the family’s income are from her rice farming and her working as a paid worker, which she has been doing for 17 years and 10 years, respectively. With her current business, she can earn about 30,000 KHR per day to spend on daily expenses. 

This is the second loan for Sopheap with VisionFund. Sopheap successfully paid back the loan with VisionFund. Now she is seeking a loan to buy a plot of farmland. She hopes to extend her farmland.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Saran

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Ou Reang Ov district, Saran is 41 years old and married. She has two children. She is a rice farmer and she supplements her income by selling grocery items. Saran has been in this business for almost 23 years. 

This is the first microloan for Saran with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to buy gasoline for plowing her rice field. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy gasoline for plowing her rice field

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Raúl Antonio

texts.es:
Raúl de 23 años de edad,  es una persona que llego a un nivel académico de bachillerato vocacional en contabilidad y luego comenzó a trabajar en una tienda de esta forma comenzó y adquirió experiencia en ventas y se fue independizando de sus padres;  ya que ellos no podían darle el estudio por falta de recursos económicos, con el paso del tiempo se acompaño, es padre  de dos hijos de los que el niño tiene 4 años de edad y su otro hijo esta a solo 3 meses de su nacimiento. Su esposa se dedica a los oficios de la casa y también se dedica a la sastrería y al comercio ya que es la administradora de su propia tienda. Son una familia muy unida que se apoyan mutuamente para lograr alcanzar los objetivos que se proponen.

 
 Raúl es empleado en una ferretería actividad que aprendió de la experiencia que adquirió en la tienda donde laboro 3 años y actualmente continua trabajando motivado por el salario y la estabilidad laboral que le permite llevar el sustento diario a su familia, él trabaja de lunes a sábado en horarios de 6:00am a 5:00pm, y para llegar a su lugar de trabajo tiene que viajar 6 km en transporte publico y cuando sale tarde de su trabajo le toca caminar para llegar a su hogar. 

El dinero sera utilizado para la compra de una motocicleta, la cual le servirá para trasladarse desde su casa a su trabajo y le permitirá llegar mas rápido cuando vaya de retorno para su casa así podrá disfrutar mas tiempo de su familia.

Las proyecciones que tiene para un futuro son las de comprar un vehículo, el cual se servirá para trasportar mas productos para la tienda y los fines de semana para salir a recrear a su familia y manifiesta que hará todo lo que este a su alcance para dar lo mejor a sus hijos en educación salud y vivienda.
texts.en:
Raúl is 23 years old.  He studied at a vocational high school and focused on accounting.  He then began working in a store where he acquired sales experience and was able to become independent from his parents.  His parents could not pay for him to continue studying because of a lack of economic resources.  As time passed, he entered into a relationship and is now the father of two children; one son is 4 years old and the other was born only 3 months ago.  His wife is dedicated to the household chores and also makes a living in a tailor's shop and in business; she is the boss of her own small shop.  Together, they are a very united family.  They mutually support each other in order to reach their dreams and goals.

Raúl works at a hardware store.  He learned this type of trade previously during his three years of work experience at another shop.  He presently continues working and is motivated by his salary and the stable work; these things allow him to provide his family with their daily sustenance.  He works Monday to Saturday from 6:00am to 5:00pm.  He has to travel 6 km by public transportation in order to get to work.  If he leaves work late, he has to walk in order to get home.

The money from this loan will be used to buy a motorcycle.  Raúl will use the motorcycle to travel to and from work, allowing him to arrive in less time and therefore be able to enjoy more time with his family.

His goal for the future is to buy a vehicle, which will allow him to transport more products to the store.  He will also be able to use the vehicle on the weekends to go on small trips with his family.  He says that he will do everything in his power to give his children the best education, health, and home possible.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Sadiqan

texts.en:
Sadiqan is a 38-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with her family. Her husband has been running a small general store at the corner of his house for many years. He also assists his younger brother by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health expenses.

Sadiqan wants to grow the business of her husband so he can generate additional income to support the family. This is the reason she has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner's BRAC Pakistan. Now, he can easily buy more stock of rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits. She is an honest and regular client of BRAC Pakistan, and she is in her second loan cycle with good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in the earnings and dreams of expanding the business further in the future. She is very thankful to Kiva field partners BRAC.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa is 26 years old, married, and blessed with two infant children. While she takes care of her baby, she finds time to manage her small retail store. 

She aims to make her business profitable in order to help her husband in sustaining their necessities. She plans to increase her product offerings but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy additional stock of fruits, vegetables, soft drinks, sugar, salt, snack foods, and seasonings to resell in her store. 

Melissa is hoping that someday she will improve more of her business with this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of fruits, vegetables, soft drinks, sugar, salt, snack foods, and seasonings to sell

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is 31 years old and a mother of two children. She lives with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession. He has sold fresh fruits from his shop in a nearby town for many years. He offers seasonal and fresh fruits to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this vegetable shop. 

Now, the needs of his family suddenly increased, and he does not have another source of income to cope with these needs. He has decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize fruit sales.

Therefore, Rabia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy additional seasonal fruits. She thanks Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh seasonal fruits to sell.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a 50-year-old widow. She is blessed with five children aged 25, 23, 21, 19 and 16 years old. She operates a shoe shop in Narok, Kenya. She has been running this business for 10 years and earns a monthly income of 30,000 KES.

She has borrowed a third loan of 60,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya which she intends to use to purchase more shoes for the business. The anticipated profits will be used to pay for school fees for her school-going children.

Naomi's dream is to improve her living standards and to own her residential plot.

loans.use: to purchase shoes for resale

loans.name: Reyna Suyapa

texts.es: Reyna, tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Hace 10 años inicio con su propia actividad de negocio donde vende ropa como camisas, pantalones, faldas, blusas, ropa interior etc. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante y entrega a domicilio. Ella ha invertido varios préstamos a su negocio para mantenerlo activo. El préstamo actual es el sexto ciclo y es por 15,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar más ropa como camisas, pantalones, blusas, faldas, y ropa interior para vender y aumentar sus ingresos. Su plan es crecer en clientes y como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Reyna is a 36-year-old single mother with two children. She lives in the town of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara.

Ten years ago, she started her own business where she sells clothes such as shirts, trousers, skirts, blouses, undergarments, and other items. She conducts her sales as a street vendor and by making home deliveries. Reyna has invested several loans into her business in order to keep it active.

Her current loan is her sixth transaction and is in the amount of 15,000 HNL. She will use the money to buy more clothes such as shirts, trousers, blouses, skirts, and undergarments that she can sell in order to boost her earnings. Her plan is to grow her clientele and her small business.

loans.use: to buy shirts, trousers, blouses, skirts, and undergarments.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is a 38-year-old married woman with five children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She has been in the agriculture business for many years. She sells Irish potatoes along the highway to earn money to educate her children.

She is faced with the difficulty of paying for the high cost of education. She dreams of being able to send her children to higher institutions of learning. 

Allen‘s small business cannot support the education fees all at once. She is therefore requesting a loan to help pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a farmer living in the Ndaragwa area of central Kenya with his wife and three children. All of the children are school-aged.

He has practiced farming for the past seven years with his primary income from milk, eggs, and crops. He loves dairy farming the most, but his biggest challenge is seasons of drought.

James chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because of their good loan terms. During the training, he learned that microfinance institutions help boost the lives of farmers.

With this loan, there will be increased milk production which will lead to an increase in income. His family's living standards will improve.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 61 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad de clima verde con paisajes impresionantes, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo en la Región de Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposo se dedica a la destilación de aguardiente desde hace 10 años, una bebida tradicional de la sierra norte del Perú para días festivos, también es utilizado como remedios curativos, Carmen ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de repuesto de su trapiche y remodelación de su destilador y de esta manera tener una mayor destilación para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carmen is 61 years old and lives with her husband in the District of Callayuc. This community has a climate that promotes the stunning green vistas. The people engage in agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. This area is located in Cutervo Province, which is part of the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

Carmen and her husband have been distilling aguardiente for 10 years. This beverage is traditional to the northern mountains of Peru on festival days, but it is also used as a curative remedy. Carmen is requesting a loan of 4,000 PEN so that she can purchase spare parts for her press and pay for renovations to her distillery. This will enable her to distill more product that she can offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her press and to renovate her distillery.

loans.name: Teofilo Edilberto

texts.es:
Teofilo de 36 años de edad, es  una persona de buenos principios morales,  él trabaja de la agricultura y la albañilería y hace 1 año participo en un curso en panadería del cual aprendió hacer diferentes tipos de pan, y en la actualidad se dedica a la agricultura y albañilería, también una vez por semana hace pan, y lo sale a distribuir por los caseríos de su cantón con ayuda de una motocicleta de su propiedad. El señor Teofilo vive con su esposa y sus 5 hijos de  los cuales se encuentran estudiando educación básica en la escuela de su comunidad. El señor teofilo se creció con sus padres quienes se dedicaban a la agricultura y ganadería y fueron ellos los que le inculcaron buenos principios morales y espirituales.                                                                                  

Él trabaja la agricultura y ganadería también trabaja su propia panadería una vez por semana la cual sale a distribuir  en su propia motocicleta por los diferentes caseríos de su comunidad y en realizar esta actividad lleva un año de experiencia, esta actividad es realizada con ayuda de su esposa y sus hijos; ya que el día que tienen destinado para la elaboración de pan son los días sábados y los otros días restantes de la semana se dedica a la agricultura El señor Teofilo decidió  trabajar en de la panadería, motivado por las ganancias y por la poca competencia que existe en el lugar donde esta ubicado su negocio. 


El dinero sera utilizado para la compra de materiales para trabajar en la panadería, ya que por encontrarse lejos de las comerciales donde compra los insumos para hacer pan comprar una estimada cantidad de productos para mantener en existencia y de esta manera podrá trabajar  todos los pedidos que le soliciten sus clientes brindando un mejor servicio a sus clientes ya que con ayuda del préstamo comenzara a trabajar 4 días a la semana.


Las proyecciones que él tiene son las de extender su negocio, tener un local mas grande y comprar un vehículo para poder distribuir el producto en los alrededores de su municipio. De esta manera, mejoran sus ingresos económicos y podrá emplear a personas para trabajar en la panadería.
texts.en:
Teofilo is 36 years old and is a person of good moral principles. He works in farming and construction. A year ago he participated in a course in baking from which he learned how to make different kinds of bread. Right now he makes a living through farming and construction. Also, once a week, he makes bread. He takes it out and distributes it among the small villages of his division with the help of a motorcycle he owns. Teofilo lives with his wife and five children, who are studying basic education in the community school. Teofilo grew up with his parents, who made a living through farming and livestock. It was them that instilled good moral and spiritual principles in him. 

Teofilo works in farming and raising livestock and also does his own baking once per week, which he distributes on his own motorcycle throughout the different small villages of his community. He has a year of experience doing this work. It is done with the help of his wife and children, seeing as the day that he has dedicated to making bread is Saturday and the other remaining days of the week, he farms. Teofilo decided to work in baking motivated by the profits and by the little competition that exists in the place where his business is located.

The loan will be used to buy materials to work in the bakery, seeing as he finds himself far from the businesses where he buys supplies to make bread. He buys an estimated quantity of products to keep in stock and in this way he will be able to accommodate all of the requests that his customers make of him. This offers better service to his customers because with the help of the loan, he will begin to work four days per week. 

The plans that he has are to extend his business, have a bigger establishment and buy a vehicle to be able to distribute the product in the outskirts of his town. In this way, he improves his economic income and will be able to employ people to be able to work in the bakery.

loans.use: to buy materials to work in the bakery.

loans.name: El Buen Samaritano Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “EL BUEN SAMARITANO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ana Maria ella es casada y tiene 42 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de verduras y frutas, la socia vende manzanas,naranjas,uvas,platanos y mandarinas, la socia también vende zanahorias, tomates y pepinos, la socia tiene un puesto de mercado donde vende las frutas y verduras, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las frutas y verduras. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar naranjas, plátanos, uvas, cebollas, zanahorias y pepinos.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the "El Buen Samaritano" communal bank.  They are in the Urubamba district in Urubamba province in the department of Cusco.

Member Ana Maria is married and is 42 years old.  She has a business selling fruits and vegetables.  She sells apples, oranges, grapes, bananas, and mandarin oranges, as well as carrots, tomatoes, and cucumbers.  She has a stall in the market where she sells her fruits and vegetables. She works from 8am until 5pm.  Ana Maria has 7 years of experience with this business, and it is doing very well.  

Ana Maria dreams of having a shop where she could sell her fruits and vegetables.  She is requesting a loan to buy oranges, bananas, grapes, onions, carrots, and cucumbers.  

The group members that are in the corner photos had their picture taken after the group meeting, because they had requested permission due to work reasons.  

The other members of this group work in a variety of businesses including: fruit sales, vegetable sales, a grocery store, and food sales.  

Ana Maria thanks those who are making it possible for her to pursue her dreams through these means, and she promises to comply with the payment terms of the loan.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Marbis

texts.es:
Don Marbis tiene 40 años de edad, convive con su compañera de hogar es padre de 2 hijos Su actividad principal es la caficultura y la agricultura.
Don Marbis cuenta con más de 10 años de dedicarse a esta  actividad y el conoce muy bien su activada ya que tiene bastante experiencia en el rubro que desempeña.
Don Marbis está solicitando  el préstamo para la compra de una planta solar y así tener energía en su hogar.
Don Marbis ha soñado con tener energía o luz por las noches en su casa ya que con esto mejoraría sus condiciones de vida además de darle acceso a su familia a el uso de la energía eléctrica y el uso de aparatos electrónicos. Para que sus hijos sean mejores personas y se preparen en la vida,
                                                                                Trojes, Honduras febrero 2014
texts.en:
Marbis is 40 years old. He lives with his partner and is the father of two children. His main source of income is agriculture, particularly coffee cultivation. Marbis has more than 10 years of experience in this business, and knows the business well since he has so much experience in the role that he has. 

Marbis is seeking a loan to purchase a solar panel so that he can have power in his home. He has dreamed of having power and light in his home at night so that he can improve his living conditions and so that his family can have access to electricity and electric appliances. This will allow his children to become better people and better prepared for life.

Trojes, Honduras, February 2014

loans.use: to purchase a solar panel.

loans.name: Davis

texts.en:
Davis is 20 years old and is from Nyahururu. He is not yet married and he supports his parents.

He has been running his welding business for the last six years. To enable him to buy some welding materials like steel rods and welding gas, he has applied for his first loan of KES 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

His monthly income right now is KES 8,000 and his intention is to use profits anticipated from his expanded business to buy another motorcycle and to pay his loan back to VisionFund Kenya.

In the future, he hopes to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: To buy welding materials like steel rods and welding gas

loans.name: Diana Julieth

texts.es:
El motivo de esta carta es para contarles sobre Diana Julieth, que logro terminar satisfactoriamente el primer semestre en cual aprendió muchas cosas sobre el funcionamiento de la salud y como ponerlo en práctica para poder ayudar a las personas que lo requieran, logro culminar este ciclo y  desea continuar adquiriendo más conocimientos, el entrenamiento para poder poner en práctica y llegar a ser una profesional dedicada, apasionada por la carrera así como lo ha venido haciendo. 
Ella desea continuar con los estudios así como lo hizo hasta el final de este semestre, por eso acude a kiva para solicitar la ayuda y poder iniciar el segundo semestre para poder terminar esta carrera que le ha dejado grandes enseñanzas.
texts.en:
The purpose of this letter is to tell you about Diana Julieth, who has finished her first semester. She has learned many things about healthcare and how to apply it practically so that she can help people who need it. She has been able to finish this part of her education and she hopes to continue to acquire more knowledge and training so that she can become a dedicated professional who is passionate about her career. 

She hopes to continue her studies like she has been doing up to the end of the semester. She has come to Kiva to request a loan so that she can begin her second semester to finish her courses, which have taught her a lot so far.

loans.use: to pay school fees for a semester.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 33 years old and is from Olkalou. He is married to Hannah and they are blessed with three children, aged 10, 7 and 3.

He has been running his business of machinery rental (e.g., power saw) for the last five years. To enable him to buy another power saw for more income, he has applied for his third loan of KES 67,500 from VisionFund Kenya.

His monthly income right now is KES 35,000 and his intention is to use profits anticipated from his expanded business to buy another power saw, educate his children and to pay his loan back to VisionFund Kenya.

In the future, he hopes to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: to buy a power saw

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 46, married and blessed with four children attending school. She owns and manages a small bakery within the town proper. Due to high-cost commodities and school fees, she needs to increase her income to support the education of her children. She plans to offer more recipes to her customers but she has insufficient capital.Therefore, she is seeking a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy flour, yeast, milk, cheese, sugar and other ingredients needed in the bakery. She is hoping that she will improve the business and increase her income to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, milk, cheese, sugar and other ingredients needed in the bakery

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 27 years old and is from Nyahururu. He is married to Miriam and they are blessed with two children, aged four and one.

He has been running his business of motorcycle transport for the last four years. To enable him to buy stocks of fruits and vegetables for his spouse's business, he has applied for a third loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

Currently his monthly income is KES 10,000 and he intends to use profits realized from the expanded business to educate his children and to repay his loan.

In the future, John hopes to buy a car and engage in the taxi industry.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fruits and vegetables for his spouse's business

loans.name: Beyata

texts.en: Beyata is a thirty-two-year-old married woman with five children, four of whom go to school. They live in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the agriculture business for fifteen years, works six days a week and four hours a day, and is located in a rural area. Beyata started the business to improve her life, and  intends to use the loan to buy pesticides. Beyata hopes to become a great farmer. Climatic changes are the challenges she faces.

loans.use: To buy  pesticides

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 35 years old and from Nyahururu. She is married to Wilson, and they are blessed with two children, ages 11 and 6.

She is a farmer and has been running her business for the last 10 years. She has applied for her second loan of 30,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to buy maize planting seeds and fertilizer. 

Right now her monthly income is 10,000 KES. She intends to use profits realized from her expanded business to educate her children and to pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya. In the future, she hopes to specialize in dairy farming.

loans.use: To buy maize planting seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a freezer, chairs, heated display cabinet, a coffeemaker, shelves, and bulk supplies.

loans.name: Lipi

texts.en:
Lipi is a 32-year-old married woman with one son. Her husband is 35 years old. Lipi and her husband have studied up to class X (grade 10). Her son is receiving an education and is in grade 6. Her husband is a farmer, and she is housewife. 

Her husband farms different crops and vegetables and then sells them to the local market. But unfortunately, the income is not enough to meet their family’s basic needs. 

Lipi wants to find another way to make money. They have struggled a lot, but now Lipi does not want her child to suffer from poverty. Lipi is a very ambitious lady, so she decided to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a cow so that she can earn money by selling milk and milk products in the market. 

She hopes that her business will flourish and their economic status will also rise. She dreams that she will buy more dairy cows with the profit from her milk business.

She is thankful to the lenders of BJS and Kiva for giving her the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for selling milk and milk products.

loans.name: Santos Amparo

texts.es:
Santos es una persona de 61 año de edad,  muy trabajador y responsable con excelentes principios, es muy conocido en su comunidad. Vive con su familia formada por su esposa que se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos de su hogar,  además vive con sus dos  hijas y dos nietos. Él se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de granos básicos como lo son: maíz y frijoles;  él se creció con su mamá y sus abuelos y su nivel educativo es de 5° grado, el motivo por el cual ya no continuo sus estudios fue porque su mamá no tenía dinero para enviarlo a estudiar,  a medida que trascurrió el tiempo el señor Santos  adquirió experiencia y muchos conocimientos sobre la agricultura y es la actividad, que en la actualidad se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos.

El señor Santos se dedica a la agricultura actividad que realiza desde que era muy pequeño pues la aprendió de su  abuelo, quien le inculco buenos principios y valores y es lo que lo ha llevado a ser una persona muy conocida y respetada en la comunidad, tiene 47 años de experiencia en la agricultura que se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos ya que vende casi el 60% de sus cosechas y la demás queda para el consumo de su familia, el lugar de su trabajo le queda a 4km de su casa y  realiza esta actividad desde las  de 7:00 am a 1:00 pm de lunes a sábado. 

El dinero será utilizado para preparar y dar el proceso de recolección  de sus cosechas en la cual tendrá que pagar trasporte para trasladar la cosecha del campo a su casa y para pagar el alquiler de una máquina que le destusara y desgranara el maíz; de esta forma se le facilitara dar el proceso de preparación y almacenamiento de los granos básicos, ya que si no fuera por la ayuda de estas maquinaria agrícola, el proceso tardaría aproximadamente un mes, en el cual tendría que trabajar todos los días y esto le garantizara que podrá dedicar más tiempo a su familia.

Las metas que él tiene a futuro son las de ampliar sus cultivos y diversificar sus cultivos, en cuanto a sus hijas y nietos apoyar en todo lo que sea necesario para su preparación y formación académica ya que manifiesta que uno de sus nietos quiere prepararse y estudiar para doctor y todo esto lo va lograr con la buena inversión de sus ganancias el buen manejo de un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Santos is 61 years old. He is very hardworking and responsible with excellent principles and is very well-known in his community. He lives with his family, made up of his wife, who dedicates herself to the domestic tasks of their house, his two daughters and two grandchildren. He works in farming, especially in the cultivating of staple grains such as corn and beans. Santos grew up with his mother and grandparents. He reached an education level of 5th grade, the reason for which he did not continue his studies being because his mother did not have the money to send him to study. As time passed, Santos acquired experience and lots of knowledge about farming and it is this work which he now has made into his principle source of income.

Santos makes a living through farming, an activity that he has done since he was very young. He learned it from his grandfather, who instilled good principles and values in him and who has brought him to be a very well-known and respected person in the community. Santos has 47 years of experience in farming, which he has made into his principle source of income. He now sells almost 60% of his harvests and what remains is kept for his family's consumption. The place where he works is 4 km from his house and he works from 7:00 am to 1:00 pm, from Monday to Saturday. 

The loan will be used to to prepare and complete the process of collection of his harvest, in which Santos will have to pay for transportation to transfer the harvest from the field to his house and pay to rent a machine that shucks the corn. In this way, the process of preparation and storage of staple grains will be made easier. If it were not for the help of this farming machinery, the process would be delayed approximately a month, in which he would have to work every day. This guarantees Santos will be able to dedicate more time to his family.

The goals that Santos has for the future are to increase and diversify his crops. Regarding his daughters and grandchildren, he hopes to support them in all that may be necessary for their education and training, seeing as one of his grandchildren wants to prepare himself and study to be a doctor. Santos is going to achieve this with the good investment of his profits and the good management of the new loan.

loans.use: to prepare and complete the process of collection of his harvest, in which he will have to pay for transportation to transfer the harvest from the field to his house and pay to rent a machine that shucks the corn.

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina is a 46-year-old married woman. She is the mother of two children, and her children are receiving education. Her husband is 51 years old, and he is involved with a small business. 

Rina always tries to give financial support to her husband and family. For that reason, she started her saree (a traditional dress of India) business. She sells sarees door to door. Due to lack of capital, she could not buy varieties of sarees and hence, the sales were also not up to the mark. Thus, she thought to expand her business by buying varieties of sarees so that she can expand her business and fulfill her customers’ demand. 

She has applied for a loan of INR 8,000 from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy sarees. She hopes that her business will flourish and that she will be able to open her own saree shop with the profit from her business.   

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase sarees (a traditional dress of India) to sell in her rural area.

loans.name: Miriam Haydee

texts.es:
Miriam de 45 años de edad,  ella se creció con sus padres quienes se dedicaban a la agricultura y ganadería y ella ayudaba a sus padres en los quehaceres del hogar y por las tardes asistía a clases. 

Ella trabaja como profesora del centro escolar de la comunidad desde hace 12 años, esta casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, con quien son padres de 4 hijos de los cuales dos de ellos de encuentran es estados unidos y sus dos hijas se encuentran estudiando educación básica en la escuela de la comunidad.

 Manifiesta que le gusta mucho su trabajo y que disfruta invertir parte de su tiempo con los niños y niñas de esa comunidad. El centro educativo le queda a unos 300 metros de su casa, por lo cual no se le dificulta viajar.


El dinero sera utilizada para consolidar deudas y comprar algunos muebles y electrodomésticos de su hogar, de esta manera tendrá una mejor comodidad en su casa y podrá disfrutar de su tiempo libre con su familia. 


Las proyecciones que  tiene a un futuro son las de tener su casa bien equipada y hacer una nueva solicitud de crédito para instalar un ciber y una librería; ya que en su comunidad no cuenta con estos servicios que son muy necesarios en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Miriam is 45 years old. She was raised by parents who worked in agriculture and ranching and she helped her parents with chores around the house and attended class in the afternoons. She has worked as a teacher at a school in her community for the past 12 years. She is married and her husband works in agriculture and ranching. They are the parents of 4 children, two of whom are in the United States. The other two are studying education at the community school.

She tells us that she really enjoys her work and enjoys investing her time with young children in the community. The school is located 300 meters from her home, so it is not difficult to get there. 

She will use the loan to consolidate her debt and purchase some furniture and appliances for her home. This way, she will be more comfortable in her home and will be able to spend her free time with her family.

The goals that she has for her future include having a well-equipped home and requesting another loan to open a cybercafe and bookstore, since her community does not have these necessary services.

loans.use: to consolidate her debt and purchase some furniture and appliances for her home.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: El joven José tiene 26 años y es Soltero,  estudia la carrera  de licenciatura en Nutrición en una de las universidades reconocidas  de  la Ciudad de La Paz,  trabaja para pagar sus estudios El joven José trabaja como empleado asalariado en una institución publica, es de ahí que tiene un ingreso extra,  este es su primer crédito con la institución y  el joven José va a usar este préstamo para  la compra de computadora ya que esto le ayudara a realizar sus trabajos finales,  José enfrenta retos en su estudios que son Su trabajo no le permite dedicarse completamente a sus  estudio, pero el joven tiene ganas de continuar y seguir adelante, su deseo cuando termine sus estudios es Quiere ejercer su profesión, mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia y cojn el tiempo poder tener una especialidad en su área.
texts.en:
Jose is 26 years old, single, and is studying for a degree in Nutrition at one of the universities in La Paz. He works so that he can pay for his studies. He works as a salaried employee at a public institution, so he has extra income.

This is his first loan with the institution and he is going to use the loan to purchase a computer, which will help him to complete his schoolwork. 

Jose faces challenges in his education, like the fact that his job does not permit him to dedicate himself completely to his education. However, he has a great desire to succeed and move forward. His goal when he completes his studies is to get a job in his field, improve his quality of life, improve his family's quality of life, and eventually choose an area of specialty.

loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es: La señora Dionicia tiene 49 años, casada con 1 hijo que tienen la edad de 12 años ella se dedica a la actividad de limpieza y barrido de las calles, ella trabajo en una  institución pública, este préstamo es el primero  que tiene con la institución, La señora Dionicia va a usar este préstamo para culminar la instalación de agua a su domicilio ya que esta solo con pozo y es mucho trabajo trasladar el agua así que hará una conexión para baños, ducha y cocina  y así de esta manera brindara mayor comodidad a su familia ya que por muchas razones la zona no cuenta con servicios básicos pero esto no impedirá que la señora Dionicia tenga agua potable en su domicilio. Se siente muy feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Señora Dionicia is 49 years old. She is married and has one son who is 12 years old. Her work is cleaning and sweeping the streets. She works for a public institution. This loan is her first one with this institution. Señora Dionicia is going to use this loan to finish installing water in her home, since she only has a well, and it is a lot of work to carry the water. This way she will have a connection for the bathrooms, shower, and kitchen, and thus she will offer better comfort to her family, since for many reasons her zone does not have basic services. But this will not prevent Señora Dionicia from having potable water in her home. She feels very happy about this opportunity that they are offering her to improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to finish installing water in her home.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: La Señora Justina sigue con la misma actividad de la confección de ropa como chalecos, cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de tela por rollo,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de una máquina de coser ya que está incrementando su producción ya que entrega a distintas ferias de la ciudad de La paz  y así seguir mejorando su negocio y por ende sus ingresos económicos se siente agradecida con los prestamistas de kiva ya que con el apoyo que le brindan mejoro su negocio.
texts.en:
Justina continues with the same business activity of making clothes like vests.  She says that the previous loan went very well for her because she used it to buy fabric by the roll.

On this occasion she is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine.  She is increasing her production because she delivers to different fairs in the city of La Paz.  This way she will continue improving her business in order to improve her earnings.

She is grateful to the Kiva lenders because her business improved with the help they provided for her.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Laela

texts.en:
Laela lives north of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. Laela manages a small shop selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credit.  Laela is married and lives with four persons in the family home. As seen in the picture, Laela is with her sister.

Laela joined Ruma one month ago because she finds it interesting to sell mobile phone airtime credits.  With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Laela sees improvements in her shop.  For the last month, she earns an average of $7 - 8  per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales. She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends.  Her goal for her business is to expand and have more new business in the future

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Alberth Osneider

texts.es:
Alberth es un hombre trabajador de 29 años de edad, dedicado desde hace 4 años a trabajar en su propio taller de confección, se encuentra ubicado en un espacio de su casa y allí trabaja con varios miembros de su familia, convirtiéndose el oficio en la única fuente de ingresos a nivel familiar. 
Actualmente solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, botones, cierres) y realizar el mantenimiento de las máquinas, lo que le permitirá prestar un servicio de mayor calidad y mantener una buena relación con sus clientes, garantizando una satisfacción al entregar un producto bien terminado.
