Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. Arwa is the leader of the group. She works hard inside the house and hopes to help her husband in completing the building of their house. Arwa doesn't have a job to provide her husband with the money to do this, so she applied for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase building materials such as cement, bricks, windows and doors.

Arwa looks forward to completing the building of the house and aims to renovate it so it can be rented to others. She hopes to provide her family with a standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase building materials

loans.name: Iris Marisol

texts.es:
Iris de 19 años de edad,tiene dos hijos, ella es bachiller, estudio en la ciudad, esta acompañada, su compañero de vida trabaja en carpinteria,la cliente se dedica a los  oficios domesticos; pero su compañero de vida trabaja en carpinteria con veinte de hacer este trabajo, ademas trabaja con ganado bovino, su lugar de trabajo esta a dos kilometros de su casa y viaja en bus, en el trabajo con ganado le ayuda Iris.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar materia prima para carpinteria, le ayudará mucho en su negocio ya que podrá contar con el material para darles un buen servicio a sus clientes. Sus sueños son poder tener mas amplio el negocio y en cuanto a su familia que sigan creciendo fuertes y sanos y poder darles un buen futuro.
texts.en:
19-year-old Iris received a secondary education in the city. She is in relationship and has two children.  Her partner has been a joiner for twenty years, doing jobs in his customers' homes. He also works in cattle rearing, taking the bus to reach his place of work which is 2 kilometres from his home. Iris helps him with the cattle rearing.

He needs the loan to buy raw materials for joinery.  This will help him tremendously in his business as he will have the materials he needs to provide good service for his customers. His dreams are to expand his business, to see his family continue to grow into strong and healthy individuals and to provide a good future for them.

loans.use: to buy joinery materials

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   BENKADI  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  26 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités à tout moment. Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution et compte bien le rembourser.
Mme  HAWA  (2ème sur la photo de la  gauche vers  la droite) compte acheter avec son prêt 3 cartons de savons. Elle vend quotidiennement au marché, à la maison et est très sollicitée surtout le jour de foire. Elle s’approvisionne à KOLONDIEBA. Elle vend au comptant et parfois à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 18 000FCFA.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi group are married women who are on average 26 years old with two children. They all live in polygamous families in Kolondieba, one of the prefectures in the third administrative region of Mali.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in order to manage their businesses successfully at all times. This is their first loan from the institution and they plan to repay it correctly.
Mrs. Hawa (who is second from the left in the photo) plans to buy three boxes of soap with her loan. She sells her wares daily at the market and at home and is much in demand especially on market days. She buys her stock at Kolondieba. She makes her sales for cash and sometimes for credit to a mixed clientele.
She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 18 000FCFA.
This profit will enable her to repay her loan and assist her husband in their daily expenditures.

loans.use: to buy soap.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is thirty-nine years old. The financial condition of her family is very poor. She wants to improve her family's living standards. Her whole family depends upon a single person's income: her husband, who drives a rickshaw.

Zainab's husband is assembling a new auto-rickshaw. He has almost made a whole rickshaw but the body structure is still missing. Zainab is taking a loan for her husband so he can complete the remaining body structure of his auto-rickshaw. In this way, she will encourage her husband to drive his new rickshaw and generate income for her family. Zainab hopes that her husband will have a stable profession and drive his auto-rickshaw for a long time.

loans.use: To buy the body structure of an auto-rickshaw

loans.name: Jose Dagoberto

texts.es: José tiene 24 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida, madre y hermanos. José es un hombre emprendedor dado que junto a su esposa han emprendido un negocio de tamales de pollo y de frijoles los cuales comercializan tanto en su hogar de residencia como de forma ambulante. Tienen dos años de dedicarse al negocio y gracias a los buenos y deliciosos tamales que comercializan han sabido ganarse la confianza de muchos clientes. Con el deseo de aumentar sus ingresos ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra materiales para la elaboración de tamales, tortillas y platos típicos. Con el monto solicitado comprará maíz, condimentos, pollo, verduras, sal, cal, etc.
texts.en: 24-year-old José lives in his own home with his wife, mother and brothers and sisters. He is an enterprising man as, along with his wife, he has set up a chicken and bean tamales business.  They sell the tamales from their home or in the streets. They have been running their business for two years and, thanks to the good and delicious tamales they sell, they have gained the trust of a large number of customers. Since they hope to boost their income, the have taken the decision to apply to FUSAI for this loan which they will use to buy ingredients for making tamales, tortillas and traditional local dishes. They will use the sum requested to buy corn, seasonings, chicken, vegetables, salt, lime, etc.

loans.use: to buy corn, seasonings, chicken, vegetables, salt, lime, etc.

loans.name: Benkoro Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   BENKORO sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  23 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités à tout moment. Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution et compte bien le rembourser.
Mme  KADI  (1 ère sur la photo de la  droite vers  la gauche) compte acheter avec son prêt  20 pagnes. Elle vend quotidiennement au marché, à la maison et est très sollicitée surtout le jour de foire.Elle s’approvisionne à KOLONDIEBA. Elle vend au comptant et parfois à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000FCFA.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of Benkoro Group are women who average 23 years of age and five children. They all live in polygamous families in Kolondieba, one of the prefectures in the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their activities throughout the year. They are seeking their first loan from the MFI, and definitely intend to repay it.

Mrs. Kadi is the woman on the right in the photograph. She intends to use her loan to buy 20 "pagnes" (colorful African cloth). She sells daily at the market and at her home, and is very much in demand, especially during fair days.

She gets her supplies in Kolondieba and sells for cash, and often on credit, to a mixed-gender clientele. She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 20'000, which will enable her to repay the loan and also help her husband cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy 20 "pagnes" (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Ashford

texts.en:
Ashford lives in the Chuka area of Eastern Kenya with his wife and two children, and has been farming for ten years; his main sources of income are eggs, milk, tea, and crops. He said that in farming he loves taking care of his animals and the general farm work. His biggest challenges are poor market conditions and diseases.

Ashford chose Juhudi Kilimo because of quality financial assistance in terms of training, faster loan processing, and lower interest rates. During the training, he learnt about group cohesion and that MFI's (micro-finance institutions) help small income earners in terms of financial assistance. Through this loan, his farm output will increase, thus leading to ian ncrease in income. This will lead to an improvement in their living standards.

loans.use: purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Saramaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    SARAMAYA est constitué de  4 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 22 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 3eme prêt. Les 2 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  céréales à l’image de AÏCHATA qui est la 1ère femme debout  dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 1000 kg de maïs et 500 kg de mil avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Saramaya group is made up of four married women who on average are 22 years old with two children. They live in nuclear families in the Heremakono quarter of the town of Bougouni.
They met through neighbourhood, friendship and business contacts. To reinforce their financial capacity in order to do better business, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution with which they are on their third loan. The two previous loans were repaid correctly. This group of women works in the cereal trade as is the case for Aichata who is the first woman standing in the photo looking from left to right. With her loan she plans to buy  1000 kg of corn and 500kg of millet from the wholesalers in Bougouni. She sells her produce retail at the market and from home for cash or for credit to a mixed clientele.
She plans to make an average monthly profit of 45.000FCFA which she will use to reinvest in her business and repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Misbah

texts.en:
Misbah belongs to a poor family, living with her spouse and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her son is a blacksmith; he manufactures iron accessories for doors and windows to be used in houses. He has been providing door to door services to weld broken accessories.

A few days ago his welding plant went out of order due to overheating and it needs to be replaced with a new one. He wants to buy a new welding plant but he does not have money due to a lot of household expenses. 

Therefore, Misbah has requested a loan from BRAC who is an active field partner of Kiva, so that her son will be able to buy a welding plant and additional iron accessories for manufacturing.  

Misbah thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a welding plant and iron accessories for manufacturing.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca de 21 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos uno de 4 años y otro de 1 año y medio, Blanca; etudió hasta septimo grado de eduación básica, esta acompañada, su pareja trabaja como empleado en una comercial de granos basicos, sus hijos dependen de ambos, el negocio que tiene es de vender ropa, tiene dos años de dedicarse a este trabajo, actividad que la aprendio por iniciativa propia, cuando despues de una maternidad perdio el empleo que tenía.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar ropa al mayoreo, esto mejorara un poco su negocio, porque tendrá más mercadería y ganará un poco más porque el costo de compra al mayorista es menor que lo que actualmente paga comprando de minorista, considera, que de esta manera dará mejor condicion de vida a sus hijos y podrá aportar un poco más en los gastos familiares. Sus sueños son poder tener salud para seguir trabajando y que sus hijos crezcan sanos y fuertes, asi, poder darles un mejor futuro, esto lo logrará con los créditos otrogados por Credicampo.
texts.en:
Blanca, 21 years old, has two children, one who is 4 and another who is a year and a half. Blanca studied up until seventh grade. She is married. Her spouse works as an employee for a basic grains company. Their children depend on both of them. The business she owns is selling clothing. She has two years experience dedicating herself to this work, an activity she learned by her own initiative after she lost the job she had following motherhood.

The loan she is requesting from Credicampo is to buy clothing at wholesale. This will improve her business a little because she will have more merchandise and will earn a little more because the cost to buy at wholesale is less than what she currently pays buying at retail. She considers that this way she will give better living conditions to her children and will be able to handle the family expenses a little more. Her dreams are to be able to have health to keep working and that her children grow healthy and strong so she can give them a better future. She will achieve this with the loans granted by Credicampo.

loans.use: to buy clothing at wholesale.

loans.name: Lilian Del Rosario

texts.es:
Lilian de 26 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene dos hijos de 2 y 4 años de edad. Lilian estudio hasta séptimo grado ya que sus padres no alcanzaron a darle mas estudio por la pobreza en que vivían, solo se dedico a trabajar. Lilian se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 10 años, en el horario de 6 de la mañana a 12 del mediodía, trabajo que lo aprendió de su mamá, Lilian viaja en bus todos los días. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para ampliar el negocio y comprar más frutas y verduras para poder obtener mejores ganancias y poder mejorar la demanda alimenticia y así tener una mejor calidad de vida. Lilian sueña en construir una vivienda digna, darles estudios a sus hijos y lograr que se gradúen y eso lo lograra por medio de las ganancias que vaya obteniendo en su negocio por medio de su crédito.
texts.en:
Lilian, 26 years old, is married and has two children who are 2 and 4 years old. Lilian finished seventh grade since her parents could not afford more education due to the poverty in which they lived. She is dedicated only to working. Lilian has been dedicated to selling fruits and vegetables for ten years, from 6 in the morning until Noon. She does what her mother taught her. Lilian travels by bus every day.

The loan she is requesting from Credicampo is to expand the business and buy more fruits and vegetables to be able to obtain better income and be able to improve the nutritious demand and thus have a better quality of life. Lilian dreams of building a dignified home, of giving her children an education and seeing them graduate, and she will achieve this through the income she is obtaining from her business through this loan.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Miguel Evaristo

texts.es:
Miguel de 20 años de edad, soltero, estudio hasta septimo grado vive con sus padres y hermanos, Miguel se dedica a la crianza de animales, desde hace 4 años, trabajo que lo aprendio de su padre, trabaja como jornalero en el horario de 7 de la mañana a 4 de la tarde. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para la compra de 4 vacas y con la ganancia mejorar su calidad de vida y a futuro tener la oportunidad de continuar sus estudios, Miguel sueña con mejorar su vivienda y asi poder vivir en mejores condiciones con su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel, 20 years old, is single. He finished seventh grade. He lives with his parents and brothers. Miguel has been dedicated to raising animals for four years, work he learned from his father. He works as a laborer from 7AM until 4PM.

The loan that he is requesting from Credicampo is to buy four cows and, with the gain, he will improve his quality of life and, in the future, have the opportunity to continue his education. Miguel dreams of improving his house and thus be able to live in better conditions with his family.

loans.use: to buy four cows.

loans.name: Claudia Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora Claudia siempre ha ahnelado mejorar su vienda, con ayuda de su esposa ha podido cumplir muchas metas, con sus tres hijos todos en edades escolares se les hace complicado recaudar el dinero de una sola vez, ella es comerciante, vende frutas en el mercado ysu esposo labora como guarda de seguridad, el credito lo solicita para la compra de Materiales como: Bloques, Perlines, Zinc. con esto realizara un anexo en la vivienda, Claudia Agradece el apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic le estan brindando al otorgarle este credito.
texts.en: Claudia always has longed to improve her life. With the help of her husband, she has been able to achieve many goals. With her three children, all school age, she has found it difficult to raise money at one time. She is a trader, selling fruit in the market. Her husband works as a security guard. The loan she is requesting is to buy materials like blocks, beams, zinc. With this, she will build an annex on her house. Claudia is thankful for the support Kiva and Afodenic is providing her by granting this loan.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es: José de 63 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 4 hijos los cuales dependen de él, José no pudo estudiar debido a la situacion economica de su familia, José trabaja con su compañera de vida en la agricultiura sembrando maiz, maicillo, frijol y hortalizas,  desde hace 20 años, trabajo que aprendio de sus padres. Jose utilizará el préstamo para comprar una vaca y dos bueyes. El préstamo le servira para la recolección de la cosecha con los bueyes que compre, ya no incurrira en el pago del alguiler de estos.  José sueña con mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos, ya que esta ahorrando para ampliar su vivienda.
texts.en: José, 63 years old, is married. He has four children who depend on him. José couldn't go to school due to his family's economic situation. José has worked with his spouse in agriculture planting maize, sorghum, beans and vegetables for twenty years, work he learned from his parents. José will use the loan to buy a cow and two oxen. The loan will serve to collect the harvest with the oxen that he buys and he will not incur the cost of renting them. José dreams to improve his children's quality of life since he is saving to expand their house.

loans.use: to buy a cow and two oxen.

loans.name: José Guadalupe

texts.es:
José tiene 39 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene 4 hijos de 5, 12, 14 y 15 años, los cuales 3 están estudiando. José solo estudio segundo grado, ya que sus padres no tenían una solvencia económica para darle mas estudio, debido a la pobreza en que vivían. José y su compañera de vida venden productos por catalogo y están por dedicarse a cuidar una granja de 200 pollos, desde hace 20 años. 

José también se dedica a la agricultura siembra Maíz, frijol y hortalizas trabajo que aprendió de su padre, cuenta José que se animo a trabajar la tierra cuando descubrió que había rentabilidad, trabaja como vigilante en verano. El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar 4 bovinos para repastos, compra de insumos agrícolas. Para mejorar las ganancias y así poder darles una mejor vida a su familia. José, sueña que sus hijos se gradúen como profesionales, construir una mejor vivienda para ello piensa trabajar muy duro, para ayudarlos.
texts.en:
José is 39 years old. He is married and has four children who are 5, 12, 14 and 15 years old and of whom three are in school. José finished only second grade since his parents did not have the economic means to provide more education due to the poverty in which they lived. José and his spouse sell catalog products and have dedicated themselves to managing a farm with 200 chickens for twenty years.

José is also dedicated to farming, planting maize, beans and vegetables, work he learned from his father. José says that he was encouraged to work the land when he discovered that it was profitable. He works as a watchman in summer. The loan that he is requesting from Credicampo is to buy four heads of cattle for pasture and to buy agricultural inputs to improve his income and be able to give a better life to his family.  José dreams of his children graduating as professionals and building a better house. For this he works very hard to help them.

loans.use: to buy four heads of cattle and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Donozio

texts.en:
Donozio lives in Hoima Uganda. He is married with one child. He buys and sells produce that is supplemented by farming. His dream is to build a permanent house and improve his family's standard of living with the proceeds from his business.

Donozio is faced with the challenge of poor roads, which make transportation of the products to his customers difficult. He is accessing credit to buy beans, maize and nuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans, maize and nuts to sell.

loans.name: Mt. Livingstone Group

texts.en:
Modesta, who is in her late 30s, is married and has two children who are in school. She has been managing a hardware business for six years. She opens her shop at 7 a.m. and works until 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is Modesta's tenth loan request. She paid back all of her previous loans successfully and used them to buy hardware stock and open a branch. She used the business profits to buy a plot of land and pay her children's school fees and household expenses. 

Modesta will use this new loan to buy hardware stock. She dreams of opening another big hardware store. Modesta will share this loan with her group "Mt. Livingstone," which totals 13 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy hardware stock.

loans.name: Maria Celia

texts.es: María tiene 60 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus hijos quienes ya son mayores de edad y le ayudan con los gastos del hogar. María se dedica a la venta de fruta fresca pelada de forma ambulante desde hace más de 26 años. Todos los días recorre las principales zonas de su localidad para ofrecer la rica fruta a sus clientes. María desea invertir en su negocio en la compra de más fruta y otros productos que le permitan aumentar los ingresos y al mismo tiempo pueda mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. María solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de frutas, pescado y carne de tal forma que pueda cubrir una mayor cuota de mercado y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: María is 60 years old and lives in her own house along with her children who are already adults and help her with expenses. María has been dedicated to selling fresh, peeled fruit on foot for more than 26 years. Every day, she walks through the main areas of her town to offer the delicious fruit to her customers. María wishes to invest in her business in the purchase of more fruit and other products that allow her to expand her income and, at the same time, be able to improve her living conditions and those of her family. María requests this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of fruit, fish and meat in such a way that she can cover a larger market share and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fruit, fish, and meat for her business.

loans.name: Mc Arthur

texts.en:
Mc Arthur is 27 years old and single. He dreams of becoming successful and financially stable to have a bright future. 

To generate income, he cultivates their farm land by planting various vegetables for sale. He plans to expand his vegetable plantation to ensure a high production. Due to financial constraint, he is seeking for a loan of PHP 20,000.00 to buy fertilizers and herbicides needed in vegetable production. He is hoping that his loan will be a great help for him to improve his farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides needed in vegetable production

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 36 years old, married, and has six children. He owns cattle in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He started with capital saved from his boda boda (motorcycle) transport business. He experiences hardships due to competition for customers for his milk and lack of coolers to preserve his milk.

Christopher requested a loan, which he will use to buy more cows to produce more milk. He hopes to buy a motorcycle for his family.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   TIESSIRI est constitué de  5 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO CENTRE de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 6ème prêt. Les 5 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait de la  restauration à l’image de DJENEBA qui est la 1ere femme assise  dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 100 kg de riz, 40 kg de poissons frais avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Tiessiri group is made up of five married women who are on average 41 years old with four children. They live in nuclear families in the Heremakono Centre of the town of Bougouni.
They met through neighbourhood, friendship and business contacts. To improve their financial capacity in order to do business better, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution and this is their sixth loan. The five previous loans were correctly repaid. This group of women works in the catering trade. This is the case of Djeneba who is the first woman sitting in the photo looking from left to right. With her loan she plans to buy 100kg of rice and 40 kg of fresh fish from the wholesalers in Bougouni. She sells her produce at the market and from home, retail for cash to a mixed clientele.
She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 35.000FCFA which she will use to reinvest in her business and to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for catering.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 24 years old single man from Jabalia city.  He opened a grocery store nine months ago.  It is a good business and the demand is high because it is the only one in his area.  Ahmad would like to improve his business and expand it. 

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN.  This loan will help him to buy more products for his grocery store like rice and sugar to sell.  By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to increase his sales and income.  Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more products for his grocery store; like rice and sugar to sell

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is a responsible father who is raising his family in a rural community.  He aims to improve their poor status of living and give his family a better life. Aside from farming, he also engages in raising hogs to have an additional source of income.  

He wants to strengthen this business in order to generate a higher income.  He planned to acquire more pigs to raise but he has limited capital.  For this reason, he is asking for a loan of PHP 24,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise.  He believes this loan will make it possible to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid lives in Hoima Uganda.  He is 30 years old and married with two children.  He makes and packs juice, water and bakes bread.  He earns additional income from boda boda (motorcycle) transport.

He started the business so as to improve his family's earnings.  He hopes to develop his business, despite the challenge of high license fees.  He is acquiring credit to buy materials and chemicals for juice and water packaging.

loans.use: to buy materials and chemicals for juice and water packaging.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy corn to grind and supply to the school

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 42 year old married woman living with her spouse and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  Her husband owns a shop in which he sells bed sheets, pillows, foam mattress, blanket etc.  Recently he spent a huge part of his income to pay utility bills which reduced his purchasing power to buy new blankets.  Now the customer demand has increased for the bed sheets and curtains because the summer season is going to start. 

This is the reason Zubaida has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan because BRAC empowers the poor without asking about assets. Her husband will buy blankets, bed sheets and curtains to sell from his shop.  Her dream is to provide all facilities and comfort to her children.  Zubaida is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy blankets, curtains, pillows and bed sheets for reselling.

loans.name: Kasasa Businge Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a Ugandan man who is married, honest and hardworking, and who lives in Kagadi. He is 36 years old and has 5 children aged between 13 and 1, and all the older ones attend school. 

He has been farming and selling produce to generate more income to support and educate his children. He hopes to grow his business and acquire more assets despite price fluctuations and inadequate capital. Emmanuel is requesting a loan to buy maize, ground nuts and beans for resale.

He is a member of Kasasa Businge Kagadi where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge assets as security.

loans.use: to buy maize, ground nuts and beans for resale

loans.name: Nurhayati

texts.en:
Nurhayati lives in North of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. Nurhayati manages a small shop selling snacks, groceries and mobile phone airtime credit. NUrhayati is married and lives with six person in family home. 

Nurhayati joined Ruma one month ago because she was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credits. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Nurhayati sees improvements in her shop. For the last month, she has earned an average of $1 to $2 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  

She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends. Her goal for her business is to expand in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Riziki Group

texts.en:
Kidawa, who is a single woman, has got two school-aged children. She is in her early 30s and has been running a food stall (mama lishe) for three years now. Kidawa works from 6am to midnight and is able to earn a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to replenish her food store items such as rice, sugar, baking flour, maize flour and cooking oil. By stocking more items, Kidawa will be able to see greater returns. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Riziki" which totals nine members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying.

She dreams that one day she will be able to be a successful mother.

loans.use: to replenish her food store items such as rice, sugar, baking flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Titin

texts.en:
Titin lives in North of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. Titin manages a small shop selling snacks, drinks and mobile phone airtime credit. Titin is married and lives with six persons in the family home. 

Titin joined Ruma one month ago because she was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credits. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Titin has seen improvements in her shop. For the last month, she has earned an average of $3 to $4 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales. She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends. Her goal for her business is to expand more in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Naswan

texts.en:
Naswan lives in North of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. Naswan manages a small shop selling snacks and mobile phone airtime credit.  Naswan is married and lives with four persons in the family home.
 
Naswan joined Ruma one month ago because he was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credits.  With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Naswan has seen improvements in his shop.  For the last month, he has earned an average of $10 to $11 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  

He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends.  His goal for his business is to expand more in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is 54 years old, married, and has children, one of whom helps with her daily tasks. Her husband is a security guard. Rehana used her previous five loans to establish her general store.

Rehana is requesting her sixth loan from BRAC Pakistan, which she will use to buy stocks of flour, rice, detergents, biscuits, and chocolates.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her general store.

loans.name: Feriz

texts.en:
Feriz is 21 and married, and lives with his wife and 3-year-old son in an Ashkali minority community. They are very poor and live in bad conditions. To earn a living he provides woodcutting services to others in his community in order to provide heat during the cold weather. He is the main source of income for his family.

Through his work he helps his family and gives them everything they need. The home that they live in is very old and is in need of renovation in order for them to live comfortably. The loan that Feriz is requesting will be used to do flooring and change doors and windows. This loan will help to improve his family conditions. 

Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, he is very thankful to the lenders for this opportunity to improve his home in order to provide a better future for his family. Feriz plans on getting a better job as well so that he can provide a stable and secure income. His goal is to generate more income in the future and secure a better life and education for his child. 

He appreciates all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To renovate his house with flooring, doors and windows

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en:
Asmaa is 47 years old, married, and has five children. She is from Qalqilia.  Asmaa operates her own store selling women clothes, which she has been doing for 10 years. She earns a good income. 

Asmaa requested a loan from FATEN, which she will use her  to buy the summer collection for her clothing store. With the loan, Asmaa will be able to increase her sales and her income.

loans.use: to purchase the summer collection for her clothing store.

loans.name: Evan

texts.en:
Evan is 65 years old and married. Together with his spouse, he has been blessed with six children. He supports six members of his family, and his wife also provides additional income through farming. He sells shoes and has been in this business for four years now. 

He will be using this loan to buy more stock of shoes for resale. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children as well as improve his business. This is his second loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and he paid his previous loan successfully. 

In the future, Evan hopes to be successful and be able to provide the basic needs for his family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of shoes for resale

loans.name: Iftkar Group

texts.en:
Iftkar is a group that consists of four women members living in Aden, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 220,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB.

Iftkar is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of five children; she is living with them in their own house. Her oldest child is 19 years old, and the youngest one is 11 years old. She studied until elementary school, but she couldn't complete her studies because she got married when she was very young. 

Iftkar is an employee in a private sector, and her husband is employed as a soldier in the public sector and also works in a bakery. Their salaries are enough to cover the family expenses, but not enough to renovate their old house; therefore, Iftkar applied for a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB in order to help her husband renovate the house and purchase building materials for it.

Iftkar looks forward to expanding her house to become more suitable for living. Also, she hopes to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To purchase building materials for a renovation of her house

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick lives in the Chuka area of Eastern Kenya with his wife and two children, both of whom are of school-going age. He has been doing farming for the past eight years, with his primary income sources being milk, tea, crops, transportation services and a retail business. He states that he loves tending to his animals and general farm work, but his biggest challenges are poor market conditions and diseases.

Fredrick chose Juhudi Kilimo because they offer financial institutions, training, and faster loan processing at low interest rates. This loan will enable him to expand his farming and generate more income. This will help cater for his children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Mutiso

texts.en:
Mutiso has been running his motorcycle-repair services business in Oloitoktok town for the last 14 years. He is 45 years old and married; together with his spouse, he has been blessed with four children of whom two are in secondary school and two in primary school. 

He will be using this loan to repair his tools as well as add more tools so that he can provide more services to his customers. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. This is his second loan term from VisionFund Kenya after he paid his previous loan successfully. 

In the future, he hopes to own a bigger business.

loans.use: To repair his machines and add other tools.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 35-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children and equally responsible for all of them.
 
She belongs to an ultra poor family and so she cannot afford the educational expenses for all of her children. One of her sons goes with his father to help him in his business. Her husband owns a blacksmith shop in which he provides welding services for iron accessories. He also provides door to door services to his customers. Due to an increase in the price of iron, he is unable to buy sufficient welding material such as welding rods, soldering rods etc. to carry on his business.

To fulfill the demand of his customers and to run his enterprise, he requires some capital to buy iron accessories. Therefore Shaheen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband so he will be able to buy the material needed to continue with his business. 

Shaheen is very glad and thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy iron accessories for her husband's welding shop.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has an agrovet business in Oloitoktok town. He has been running it for two years now, and it has been profitable. He is 41 years old and married; together with his spouse, he has have been blessed with two children.

He will be using this loan to purchase fertilizer, seeds, pesticides and animal feeds for selling to farmers in the area. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. This is his second loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and he has paid his previous loan successfully. 

In the future, John hopes to expand his business and open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, seeds, pesticides and animals feeds.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson has a farming business in Oloitoktok town and has been in this business for 5 years. He is 32 years old, married and together with his spouse has been blessed with five children. 

He will be using this loan to buy farm inputs such as agrochemicals and fertilizer. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. This is his third loan from VisionFund Kenya and he repaid his previous loans successfully. 

In future Jackson hopes to be successful and to be able to provides the basic needs for his family.

loans.use: To buy agrochemicals and fertilizer.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 57 years old, married and she and her husband have been blessed with three kids aged 16,14 and 10 years. She is a farmer and she has been in business for 5 years and right now her monthly income from the business is KES 50,000.

She is borrowing KES 100,000 which she intends to use to expand her agricultural farming activities by buying seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to be used in this new planting season. She plans to plough back the profit into the business. This is her first loan and her dream is to prosper in life.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry thanks Kiva lenders for his previous loan. He was able to increase his profits after buying more stock and also to attract a wider customer base, including people making crafts in the city. 

He is now requesting another loan to buy more bark-cloth which he will refine and then sell at a profit.

His hopes for the future are to educate all of his children so that they can have a better future, and to be the leading supplier of bark-cloth in Kyotera town. The challenges he faces are high transport costs and lack of enough capital. He is an honest and hardworking man whose wish is to see interest reduced further.

loans.use: To buy bark-cloth in raw form so that he can refine it for resale

loans.name: Confiance Group

texts.fr:
CONFIANCE est un groupe constitué de  6 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO CENTRE de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 1er prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait de  la restauration à l’image de NAMINATA qui est la 2ème femme assise  dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche . Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 50 kg de riz, 10 kg de poissons frais et beaucoup de condiments  avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
Confiance Group is made up of six married women who average 31 years of age and 3 children. They all live in nuclear families in Heremakono Centre, a neighborhood in the city of Bougouni.

They got to know each other through bonds of community, friendship, and business. To strengthen their financial capability and do better business, they joined Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their first loan.

These women run food-serving businesses, just like Naminata, the second woman from the right in the photograph. She intends to use her loan to buy 50 kg of rice, 10 kg of fresh fish, and lots of condiments from wholesalers in Bougouni.

She sells retail at the market and at her home, for cash and on credit, to a mixed-gender clientele. She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 15'000, to be in part invested in her business, and in part used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy 50 kg of rice, 10 kg of fresh fish, and condiments

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 35 years old, married and she and her husband have been blessed with four kids aged 13, 10, 7 and four years. She is a farmer and she has been in business for 8 years and right now her monthly income from the business is KES 18,000. 

She is borrowing KES 80,000 which she intends to use to buy farm inputs like seeds, fertilizers and some tools like hoes. She plans to educate her kids with the anticipated profit from the business. This is her fourth loan and her hope is to be a successful farmer.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs like seeds, fertilizers and tools to use on the farm

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en: Yousef is 22 years old. He lives with his family which consists of 7 members in an area in Jordan called Baqaa. He is a diploma student majoring in Accounting, and he is in his first year which is the beginning of his study journey. He also works in the evenings in a cancer treatment center in Jordan. Yousef is planning to work in his study field after graduation to support his family financially. He doesn't currently have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. Because of that, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is a 31-year-old married woman. Her financial condition is not good, and she has to think many times to start any task. Her husband has just started to drive a moto-rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw built around motorbike). This rickshaw is being driven over local roads and for short distances. He has been driving it over rough roads, which has caused it to deteriorate quickly. Now the rickshaw needs to be replaced because it rattles during driving. This is the reason he wants to buy a new moto-rickshaw.
Shakeela has requested a loan for her husband, so he can buy a new motor bike and body to convert into a moto-rickshaw so he can drive it smoothly. 
Shakeela thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike and body for converting into a moto-rickshaw.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles used his previous loan to buy motor spare parts, and his business is doing well now.

He has applied for another loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him to buy motor spare parts to use in his garage. He is optimistic that his business will do well after the loan.

Charles hopes to expand his business in the near future and own a leading garage.

loans.use: To buy motor spare parts

loans.name: Ararat

texts.en:
Ararat is 43 years old, and he lives in the village Chapni in Syunik region. Ararat is not married, and he lives with his retired mother. For seven years he worked at the local school as a teacher, then he worked at the municipality, but now the only occupation that he is engaged in is farming and agriculture, in which his mother greatly helps him. 

He has a rather big farm: 10 cows, 17 chickens and 17 beehives. He has a large plot of land on which he cultivates potatoes cabbages, onions, beans, and also some fruits such as apples and pears. He also has several nut trees. He sells all his farm goods at the local wholesale markets of Kapan city. He says he likes farming very much; it takes all his time, and there is no time left to think and feel pity that he did not manage to get married and have children, which makes his mother upset very much.

Ararat asks for a loan for the purchase of five calves, which will make his farm richer, and he can also start the sale of meat from his farm.

loans.use: to purchase five calves and start the sale of meat from his farm

loans.name: Nayab's Group

texts.en:
Nayab is a 29-year-old lady residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband has been providing the services of furniture polishing for many years; he is a guardian of the family and responsible to manage the household.

Nayab's husband wants to buy polishing materials and oil for his furniture polishing business, but due to some financial constraints he is unable to buy this merchandise. Therefore, Nayab has applied for a Kiva group loan with another member. With the help of this loan amount, she will help her husband to buy the merchandise for his business purposes, so that he can earn more profitable income to manage his household and business activities. 

Nayab is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy some important accessories such as polishing materials and oil for a furniture polishing business.

loans.name: Manuela De La Paz

texts.es:
Manuela de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, esta acompañada y tiene un hijo de 4 años que esta estudiando en kínder, su compañero de vida trabaja como empleado. Manuela se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, desde hace 15 años en el horario de 6 de la mañana a 12 del mediodía, trabajo que lo aprendió de su mamá. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para ampliar y mejorar su negocio para poder obtener mejores ganancias y poder satisfacer la demanda alimenticia hacia los clientes y así tener una mejor calidad de vida.

 Manuela sueña en tener siempre la sostenibilidad de su negocio, piensa ahorrar mucho para darle una mejor vida a su familia, darle estudio a su hijo y poder mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Manuela, 32 years old, studied up to third grade. She has a common-law spouse and a 4-year-old son who is in preschool. Her life partner works as an employee. Manuela has made her living selling fruits and vegetables for 15 years from 6:00 in the morning to 12:00 noon. She learned this trade from her mother.

The loan that she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to expand and improve her business in order to be able to earn more money and satisfy her clients’ demand, and therefore have a better quality of life. 

Manuela dreams of about always maintaining the sustainability of her business. She wants to save a lot to give her family a better life, send her son to school, and improve her house.

loans.use: to expand and improve her fruit and vegetable business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel is 45 years old and married, and has one dependent child at this moment. For seven years, she has made a living selling tomatoes as a way to have a better income to contribute to her household expenses. She has a lot of experience in the business and the help of two employees.

She is requesting a loan to buy two boxes of tomatoes to sell to customers. She will count on ID-Ghana to increase her stock with this loan and create a more pleasant image of her business for her customers. Her vision is to have a more profitable business that will allow her to generate personal wealth to cater to her family.

loans.use: To buy two boxes of tomatoes to sell to customers.

loans.name: Silva

texts.en:
Silva has a specialty of being a nurse, since she graduated Kapan Medical College. For several years, she worked at the polyclinics as a nurse, but she became a widow, and the care of three children (two daughters and a son) was her duty. She decided to establish her business in order to provide for her children properly, with the hope that all the hardships were just temporary, and when her children grew up, they would also become employed and their financial problems would become less. 

Since 1995 she has been running her clothes trading business in the Kapan city wholesale market in Syunik region. She rents a stall where she sells a great assortment of men's, women's and children's clothes, slippers and underwear. Her stall merchandise she brings from Yerevan wholesale market in a rented car once in a month. In all, she is satisfied with her business income, which helps her to sustain her family's needs. Her two daughters are already married, and her son works now at the military unit and also helps his mother in her business. 

Silva asks for a loan since she wants to buy spring season clothes for her stall, since they are already in great demand after a long and cold winter, which made people tired of wearing thick and heavy clothes.

loans.use: to buy spring season clothes for her stall

loans.name: Eslam

texts.en: Eslam is 25 years old. He lives in Irbid, Jordan, with his parents and four siblings. Eslam is a university student majoring in Business Administration. He is in his third year. He is planning to continue his studies until he gets his master's degree. He is currently applying for this loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees and to get the books and stationery tools he needs.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Kristine is of 29 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Vanadzor city in Lori region. Her husband is a constructor. Kristine graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute as an elementary school teacher in the Pedagogical Methodology Department. She works at the school as a teacher of Armenian Language and Literature, which she has been doing for seven years. She is always ready to help her pupils to overcome any difficulties in the teaching process. She also has several pupils whom she prepares, through the private courses at her house, for the entrance examinations.  

Kristine requested a loan for 230,000 Armenian drams, which she will use to buy a computer, which will greatly help her to learn about any innovation in teaching methodology.

loans.use: to purchase a computer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bitter ball, pepper, etc.

loans.name: Suha

texts.en:
Suha was born in 1973. She is married and is a mother of two. Since she has a sense of responsibility towards her family, she decided to support her husband with the household expenses. 

Suha has been selling handmade socks for one year. She is now planning to expand her business by buying a sewing machine in order to make her work easier and to be more productive. But, she doesn't have enough money to do so. Because of that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to make socks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her workshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Pilika Pilika Group

texts.en:
Catherine is in her 40s, single, and has two children. She operates a shop selling clothes, which she has been doing for five years. She earns a good monthly profit. Catherine's shop is open from 7:30 AM to 6:00 PM daily. 

Catherine is requesting her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy new clothing to sell. She used her previous loans, which have been repaid, to replenish her shop with up-to-date clothes. She earned a profit, which she used to pay part of her household expenses. Since she is single, most of her extra income pays for her family welfare. She hopes that one day she will be able to enroll her children in an international school. 

Catherine will share this loan with her group, Pilika Pilika , which consists of four members. The members of the group hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Oumou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis 2012.IL est composé de membres qui ont comme activité le petit commerce et elles dans le même quartier.

Fatou qui se trouve à l'extrême droite de la photo,est notre emprunteuse vedette,elle est âgée de 48 ans,elle est mariée et mére d'un garçon.

Son activité est le commerce de boutique,elle achéte de la marchandise composée de sucrerie,du thé,du sucre,du lait,du café.

Avec son prêt,elle compte acheter du thé pour une valeur de 10 000f,du sucre pour 35 000f et du lait pour 20000f.

Son objectif est de renforcer son fonds de roulement et son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was established in 2012. It is made up of members whose main business is retail, and who live in the same neighborhood.

Fatou, the featured borrower, is the woman on the far right in the photograph. She's 48 years old, married, and the mother of one boy.

She runs a shop where she sells products such as sugar, tea, milk, and coffee. With her loan, she intends to buy XOF 10'000 worth of tea, XOF 35'000 worth of sugar, and XOF 20'000 worth of milk.

Her goal is to strengthen her working capital and her savings.

loans.use: to buy tea, sugar, and milk

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: Doña Felipa es una clienta con 45 años de edad, casada y con tres hijos. Vive con su esposo y una hija. Humilde y muy trabajadora. Tiene trayectoria en la Fundación y siempre se ha caracterizado por su puntualidad y responsabilidad. Ella siempre se ha dedica al comercio ambulante de oro, perfumes finos y cortinas. Hace aproximadamente un año perdió a una hija, por lo que ella sufrió de mucha depresión y dejó su actividad principàl. Ahora cuenta con dos fotocopiadoras heredadas por su hija fallecida y ella quiere brindar los servicios de fotocopiado y venta de artículos escolares, debido a que vive cerca de la escuela de su comunidad. Sus clientes son vecinos, familiares y docentes. Ella se organiza cada día para ver a sus hijos y nieta que le quedó a ella, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo en las decisiones a tomar y de una hija para ver el negocio cuando ella tenga que salir. Ha tenido dificultades emocionales pero gracias a la ayuda sicológica los ha podido superar y por eso quiere reiniciar la actividad para mantenerse ocupada y poder ayudar en los estudios de una hija y nieta, asi ir mejorando las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Felipa is 45 years old, married and has 3 children. She lives with her husband and a daughter. She has a history with the Fundación and has always been punctual and responsible. She sold gold, perfumes and curtains in the street. About a year ago she lost a daughter and she suffered a bout of depression and quit her commercial activity.

Now she has two photocopy machines she inherited from the daughter who passed away. She wants to provide photocopy services and sell school supplies as she lives close to the local school. Her clients are neighbors, friends and teachers.

She arranges to see her remaining children and grandchild every day. She has her husband's help in making decisions and her daughter will watch the shop when she has to go out. She has had emotional difficulties but thanks to some psychological help she has been able to move forward and restart this activity to keep herself busy. She can also help a daughter and granddaughter thus improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy bookstore supplies.

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en:
Astghik lives in Yerevan town with her mother and grandmother. Her mother is employed in the private sector, and her grandmother is provided with a retirement pension. 

Astghik herself studies at university. The family hardly manages to cover their basic costs, and it is very difficult for them to cover Astghik's educational costs. 

So Asghik applied for this loan to be able to pay her university tuition and continue her studies there.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Jawaher

texts.en:
Jawaher was born in 1985. She is married and is a mother of seven. Jawaher noticed the financial crisis her husband has been facing. So, three years ago, she decided to be the second provider for her family by selling cosmetics and perfumes at her house. 

Now, she is applying for a youth loan to add selling clothes and housewares to her business, to raise her profit.

loans.use: to buy clothes and housewares for her business.

loans.name: Jemma

texts.en:
Jemma lives in Yerevan town. She is a mother of three daughters. 

Jemma's little daughter Anna is 19 years old and studies at European Academy in Armenia, specializing in touring. 

This requested loan is for covering Anna's university tuition. 

The loan will be a huge support for this whole family, and they will wait the lenders support.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis 2012.IL est composé de femmes qui habitent le même quartier et qui ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Amy qui se trouve à l'extrême droite de la photo et levant le bras,est notre emprunteuse vedette,elle est âgée de 24 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 04 enfants dont 02 garçons.

Son activité est la vente de légumes,elle la pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Avec son prêt,elle compte acheter des légumes pour une valeur de 50000f et les revendre.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne et de participer aux charges familliales.
texts.en:
This group was established in 2012. It is made up of members whose main business is retail, and who live in the same neighborhood.

Amy, the featured borrower, is the woman on the far right in the photograph. She's 24 years old, married, and the mother of four children, two of them boys.

Her business, which she has been running for several years, consists in selling vegetables. With her loan, she intends to buy XOF 50'000 worth of vegetables to resell.

Her goal is to increase her savings and take part in covering the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a single man, age 30; he lives in an urban area and has one kid who attends school. He deals in the transportation business, where he owns a cab; he transports people to different places. He started this business to earn income to cater to his family's needs. 

He works 6 days a week and 12 hours per day. He started this business in order to earn a living; he dropped out of school at an early age after the death of his parents. 

He has acquired this loan to buy spare parts for his motor vehicle. His clients are traders from Rakai and Tanzania.

His future hope is to educate his kid, and to buy a mini-bus for the business in order to increase his income. 

The challenge he faces is lack of enough capital.  He is honest, but wishes the institution could further reduce the interest rates.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten was born in 1968. She is married and has three sons and daughters. Her husband is an engineer. 

Faten has been supporting her husband financially for three years, selling clothes and accessories to her neighbors from her house. She started this business to help her husband in covering their children's needs. 

Now she is applying for a loan to expand her business by buying a new collection of clothes and accessories to attract more customers and raise her profit.

loans.use: To purchase a new collection of clothes and accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal bags for her business,

loans.name: Kefaya

texts.en:
Kefaya was born in 1969. She is married and has five sons and daughters. Her husband sells furniture. 

Kefaya has been selling blankets for three years, to be a second provider for her family. She started this business with a small amount of blankets to cover her children's needs. 

Now she is applying for a loan to add bed sheets to her business in order to attract more customers and raise her profit.

loans.use: To buy bed sheets for her business

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 36-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of six daughters. Her whole family is involved in the same business, which is purifying water and then filling cans to sell. In this way all of the family members are making an effort to generate income to run a set up of their house. 

Abida and her daughters fill cans with purified water and her husband deals with the vendors. Abida wants to grow the business and wants to do larger business transactions. This is the reason she applied for a Kiva loan, so she can buy more water cans to fill with purified water to sell to the retailers.

loans.use: To buy water cans for filling with purified water and then selling them to retailers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, pepper, bitter ball, charcoal, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, and pepper for her business,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for renovations, a display window, and new stock.

loans.name: Martín Darío

texts.es:
Martín es un hombre humilde, carismático y trabajador de 41 años de edad que día a día lucha para sacar adelante a su esposa y su hijo adolescente.
Desde hace 4 meses comenzó a trabajar de manera independiente, distribuyendo cereales y otros productos en las diferentes tiendas y supermercados del sector, el producto lo transporta en un vehículo propio y trabaja solo todos los días de la semana; con los ingresos que genera su labor, logra solventar los gastos básicos del hogar y brindar educación a su hijo.
El crédito solicitado será invertido en la compra de surtido al por mayor de cereales y en el arreglo del carro, con esto podrá darle continuidad a su labor y aumentar así las ventas, además podrá entregar los pedidos de manera oportuna.
Martín sueña con acreditar y fortalecer más su negocio, logrando reconocimiento para darle permanencia en el tiempo y así garantizar una estabilidad económica favorable a su familia y brindar una buena educación universitaria a su hijo.
texts.en:
Martín is a humble, charismatic and hard-working 41 year old man who strives daily to get his wife and adolescent son ahead.

Four months ago he started to distribute cereals and other products independently to various stores and supermarkets in the area. He transports the product in his own vehicle and only works during the week. With the income he generates he can pay the household expenses and provide education for his child.

The loan Martín is requesting will be invested in the purchase of a variety of cereals, wholesale and to fix his vehicle. Then he can continue with his labor, fill his orders in a timely manner and increase his sales.

Martín dreams of consolidating and strengthening his business making himself known, so as to be sustainable over time. Thus he could guarantee financial stability for his family and provide a university education for his child.

loans.use: to buy cereals wholesale and fix his vehicle.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina was born in 1987. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband works in construction. Lina has been selling children's clothes for 2 years in order to be a second provider for her family. She started this business with a small amount of clothes, wanting to cover her children's needs. Now she is applying for a youth loan to buy a new collection of clothes in order to attract more customers and raise her profit.

loans.use: To buy a new collection of clothes.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh was born in 1980. She is a married woman living in a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour. Her husband is a vocational worker. Fatmeh has been supporting her husband financially for 2 years, selling clothes at her house. She started this business to help her husband with improving their living conditions. Now she is applying for a loan to expand her business by buying a new collection of children's clothes to attract more customers and raise her profit.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of clothes with a children's clothing collection.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a conservative woman and  asked that her daughter appear in the picture, instead of her. 

Khadija was born in 1968. She lives with her husband in a sector in Jordan called Zarqa. Since childhood, she has enjoyed embroidering  clothes and dresses. She discussed the idea of turning her hobby into a business with one of her neighbors. She started her embroidery business 8 years ago to help her husband to improve their living conditions. 

She is applying for a loan to buy fabrics and beads in order to be able to meet customer requests and to raise her productivity.

loans.use: to buy thread and sewing tools.

loans.name: Nayfeh

texts.en: Nayfeh was born in 1976. She is a married woman living in a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour. Her husband works in construction. Nayfeh has been selling clothes for 1 year, so as to be a good financial support for her husband. She started this business with a small amount of clothes. Now she is applying for a loan to add a new collection of clothes and cosmetics to her business, in order to attract more customers and raise her profit.

loans.use: To add a new collection of clothes and cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Nova

texts.en:
Nova lives north of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. She manages a small shop selling drinks and mobile phone airtime credit. Nova is married and lives with three persons in the family home. 

Nova joined Ruma one month ago because she was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credits. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Nova sees improvements in her shop. For the last month, she has earned an average of $12 - $13 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  

She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends. Her goal for her business is to expand and have more new business in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Shanti

texts.en:
Shanti is a 37-year-old married woman, and her husband is 42 years old. Her husband is a farmer. Shanti is blessed with two children. Both of them are going to school. Shanti lives in Maynaguri of Jalpaiguri District. Both Shanti and her husband have completed their education up to class X (grade 10).

Her husband’s income is too low to run a family and to take care of their two children. Like every mother, Shanti also dreams to give her best to her children. So, she plans to help her husband. Keeping this in mind, she decided to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) and to help her husband. 

She plans to take loan from BJS so that she can start her garlic cultivation by buying seeds and fertilizers, and then sell the harvest in the local market. 

Shanti is really thankful and grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivation of garlic.

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en:
Ishrat is a 38-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She requests a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband who is an excellent shoe maker. He has manufactured shoes for many years and has a lot of professional experience. He uses both machinery and hand-stitching to make his products. He is able to earn income for his family. He has a huge contract to make shoes but does not have the money to buy raw materials to fulfill the contract.

Sofia requests a loan for her husband so that he can buy raw materials such as Rexene, threads, glue, soles, etc.

Ishrat is very thankful to Kiva and their field partner BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy shoe making supplies.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 27-year-old woman living with her three children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been driving an auto rickshaw and pays a daily fare because this rickshaw does not belong to him. He belongs to an ultra poor family and has been caring for his children. Now his children are growing older and their needs are growing as well. He was worried for many days about how to abstain from paying the daily fare, so he decided to buy his own rickshaw. 

Farzana has been accumulating savings for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband, but at the time of purchasing, their amount of money was short. Therefore, Farzana requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of her savings. She hopes that now her husband will not have any need to pay daily fares, which will become the cause of an increase in income.

She hopes that now her husband will be able to earn more income, because now he will not pay a daily fare to anyone. She is very happy after taking this loan; she thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, onions, oil and other items for her business.

loans.name: Motasem

texts.en:
Motasem is a 23-year-old single man from Jabalia city. He started his own business of raising cows seven years ago. It is a very profitable business. He would like to improve his business but he does not have enough money. 

He took a 595 USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy feeds for the cows. By taking this loan, Motasem will be able to improve his business. He appears in the photo on his farm.

loans.use: to buy feeds for the cows.

loans.name: Sonia's Group

texts.en:
Sonia is a 29-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of one son. Her husband is a merchant of glass in the local market, and he has been running this business for many years.

He needs to buy glass pieces and other tools and accessories for his business and for reselling. But due to insufficient financial resources he is not in a suitable position to buy these accessories to fulfill the needs of his glass business. Therefore, Sonia has applied for a Kiva group loan with another member from BRAC Pakistan. This loan amount will help her husband to buy pieces of glass and other relevant accessories for his business.

Sonia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial support.

loans.use: To buy some important accessories for her Glass Shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more raw materials for making antiques.

loans.name: Shahira

texts.en: Shahira was born in 1959. She is a widow living with her only son in a sector of Jordan called Zarqa. Shahira is the only provider for her son. She started her tailoring business ten years ago after gaining experience from her neighbors to cover her son's needs. Now she is applying for a loan to purchase a new collection of fabrics to respond to her customers’ needs.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics for her business

loans.name: Rabson

texts.en:
Rabson lives in Kisii area of South Nyanza, Kenya with his wife and four children. He has been farming for twelve years. His primary sources of income are crops, milk and eggs. In farming, he enjoys milking very much but his biggest challenge is climate change.

Rabson opted for Juhudi Kilimo because they offer low interest rates on their loans and this would favor him a lot. During the training, he learnt how he can improve his farming activities. Through this loan, Rabson and his family's living standards will improve.

loans.use: purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Protima

texts.en:
Protima is a 24-year-old woman and the mother of one son; her son is below school-going age. Her husband is 38 years old. Protima and her husband have completed their education up to grade 10. 

Her husband is a farmer, and she is housewife. Due to lack of money, they have not been able to cultivate more crops; thus, it was becoming very difficult for them to lead a normal lifestyle by meeting all the basic needs. 

For that reason, she decided to increase her farming business by cultivating various types of crops. First, she wants to start chili cultivation, so she has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy chili seeds and fertilizers. After the harvest, she will sell the chilies in the market. 

She knows chili is a vegetable in great demand, and every household needs this for daily cooking. She hopes she will succeed in this business and will be able to give a better education to her son, along with a good normal life with the help of the business profit.

She is thankful and grateful to BJS as well as Kiva.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for chili cultivation.

loans.name: Riffat's Group

texts.en:
Riffat is taking a loan to buy stocks of threads, fancy cloth, sequins and pearls of various colors for embroidery work at home. She has been embroidering for many years. 

She is aged forty-three and the responsible mother of five children, who she cherishes. She knows her duties and responsibility to her children very well. Her husband works in a small firm for a very low daily wage and comes home very late at night. Her dream is to construct her house according to the number of children that she has. She is saving for this purpose.

Riffat is very happy and relaxed after taking this loan because it will increase her family's monthly income and savings.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for embroidery.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a forty-one-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. Two years ago she started a business selling ready-made shirts as her husband’s income was not sufficient to cover their household expenses. She has become famous in her locality and earns a good income for the family. 

To meet the increasing demands of her customers, she needs to purchase a variety of ladies' shirts in different colors and designs from the wholesale market. For this, she applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will help her increase sales and profits. She is in her fourth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ladies' shirts in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Johnatan Fernando

texts.es:
Había una vez un joven llamado Johnatan Fernando él cual se crió en el campo junto con los padres, siempre desempeño labores que para entonces eran muy pesadas, ya que las ejercía siendo apenas un niño, pero como muchos sabemos la vida del campo es muy dura para quienes la viven a diario, y que para poder tener un plato de comida hay que trabajar muy duro. Con el paso del tiempo dejo la escuela ya que los trabajos en la finca le impedían poder estudiar con tranquilidad y decidió ayudar a los padres hasta que se convirtió en un joven con muy buenos  principios y valores, permitiéndole así viajar a la capital  y conseguir un empleo, luego decidió terminar los estudios, se graduó como bachiller académico y así poco a poco fue terminando lo que en un tiempo le toco aplazar.
