La vida de Johnatan Fernado nunca fue muy fácil, más bien le toco esforzarse demasiado para poder obtener lo que quería, pero siempre con los proyectos en mente, después de un tiempo decidió hacer un técnico en mantenimiento y ensamble de computadores en un instituto y por eso quiere el subsidio que kiva  le ofrece para así poder seguir ayudando a los padres y a la vez culminar el estudio.  
Hasta el momento le va muy bien y es así como planea cumplir las metas desde luego quiere especializarse, tener la propia casa, una familia y sacarle un gran provecho a la carrera.
texts.en:
There was once a young man named Johnatan Fernando who was raised in the countryside by his parents. He always did his chores which were for that time very heavy.  He did them from a very early age. But as most know, life in the countryside is very hard for those who live it daily; to be able to have a plate of food one has to work very hard.

With the passage of time, he left school, since workers on the farm find it difficult to study with tranquility, and he decided to help his parents. He became a young man with very good principals and values, allowing him to travel to the capital and pursue employment. Eventually, he decided to complete his studies and he graduated with a high school diploma, thus, little by little, completing what at one time he had postponed.

Johnatan Fernando's life was never very easy; he had to put forth considerable effort to be able to obtain what he wanted. But as always, with his goals in mind, eventually, he decided to become a technician in the maintenance and the assembly of computers in an institute. For that reason, he is now requesting the subsidy offered by Kiva so that he can culminate his studies and begin to help his parents.

Up to the present, things have gone well and now Johnatan Fernando plans to complete his goals. He wishes to become a specialist and have his own house and a family, and achieve a grand career advancement.

loans.use: to pay a semester's matriculation fee at Campo Alto.

loans.name: Rehena

texts.en:
Rehena is a rural housewife of Maynaguri in Jalpaiguri district. She has one daughter and her husband in her family. Her daughter is now receiving primary education. Due to lack of money, she and her husband are illiterate and only can sign their names.

Her husband is running a fish business and sells different types of fish in the local market. Unfortunately, his income is not sufficient to run the family expenses. It is necessary to sell a variety of fish in the market to generate more income. But due to lack of capital, he could not buy different varieties of fish from the wholesale market. 

Rehena heard about BJS (Kiva’s partner), which gives loans to empower rural women. She applied for a loan to purchase more varieties of fish from the wholesale market. She hopes that now she can improve her business, as well as the financial stability, and that she can expand her existing fish business.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for standing by her side for her wellbeing.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of fish to expand their fish business.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia, aged twenty-three, is a married woman. She deals in the business of animal sales with the support of her husband.She buys baby goats and calves at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at a higher price. She makes enough in her business to contribute to the family income. She has gradually improved her business by taking loans from Kashf foundation. Currently she is requesting a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more animals. With this loan, she will expand her business and level of income.

loans.use: to purchase baby goats and calves

loans.name: Khachik

texts.en:
Khachik is from Qanaqeravan village, of the Kotayq region. He lives there with his wife and three children. Khachik's wife is a hairdresser and his elder daughter studies at the university. Khachik himself is an army officer. The whole family works hard to have appropriate living conditions. 

The reason that Khachik applied for this loan is his daughter Narine's university tuition. He will be very grateful to lenders if they support him in covering Narine's university tuition, giving her an opportunity to continue her studies there.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's university tuition.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina has successfully built her business of tailoring with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. Previously with the help of Kiva loan, she purchased raw material needed for her business.  To help her continue operations of her business, currently she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy spools of threads with packs of needles, buttons and laces to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.  She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads with packs of needles, buttons and laces.

loans.name: Davlatmo

texts.ru: Давлатмо из района Дангары имеет среднее специальное образование. Ей 47 лет. Она работает медсестрой в больнице. Одновременно Давлатмо занимается и торговлей, так как она разведена и обеспечение семьи находится на ее плечах. У Давлатмо двое детей. Дочери 25 лет, а сыну всего 5 лет. Ее дочь занимается выпечкой и продажей пирожков. Сама Давлатмо в свободное от работы времени продает продукты питания и хозяйственные товары в своей маленькой лавке. Она занимается этой деятельностью около два года. Сейчас она нуждается в кредите, чтобы приобрести ассортимент продуктов питания. Этот кредит ей важен.
texts.en: Davlatmo is from the Dangara district and has a secondary specialized education. She is 47 years old and works as a nurse at the hospital. She also runs a shop because she is divorced and supporting the family falls on her shoulders. Davlatmo has two children. Her daughter is 25 and her son is only five years old. Her daughter makes and sells baked goods. When she isn't at work, Davlatmo sells food and household products in her small shop. She has had the store for about two years and needs a loan to purchase an assortment of food products. This loan is important to her.

loans.use: to buy food products for her shop

loans.name: Reina Cristina

texts.es: Reina tiene 53 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 9 años (gemelos). Reina se dedica a la venta de ropa como: faldas, vestidos, ropa interior, etc. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante en las principales zonas de su localidad. Reina desea mejorar las condiciones del piso de su vivienda por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, grava y para pagar la mano de obra que le realizará el trabajo de encementar el piso de la vivienda y así dar a su familia condiciones más favorables.
texts.en: Reina is 53 years old; she lives in her own house with her life partner and their two children of nine years of age (twins). Reina sells clothing like: skirts, dresses, and under garments, etc. She carries out her sales as a street vendor in the main areas of her town. Reina wishes to improve the conditions of the floors in her house, which is why she made the decision to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in buying cement, sand, and gravel and to pay the workforce who will carry out the task of covering the floors of the house with cement and thus give her family more favourable conditions.

loans.use: to buy: cement, sand, gravel and to pay the workforce to cover the floors of the house with cement.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel, manifiesta que utilizo el capital anterior para tener a su disposición la materia prima para elaborar la comida y mejoro la variada de bebidas que ofrece a sus clientes, se mantiene trabajando y cumpliendo con sus diferentes compromisos.
Para esta oportunidad el crédito que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, carnes, especias, frijol, verduras, aceite, gas propano, bebidas, mariscos, etc., para reforzar el negocio y seguir atendiendo de la mejor manera a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Manuel states that he used the previous loan to have raw materials available to make the food.  He also improved the variety of drinks that he offers his customers.  He continues working and fulfilling his different obligations.

He is now requesting a loan to buy rice, meat, spices, beans, vegetables, cooking oil, propane gas, drinks, and seafood, etc.  He will do this in order to strengthen the business and to continue taking care of his customers in the best way.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, spices, beans, vegetables, cooking oil, propane gas, drinks, and seafood, etc.

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit is an enthusiastic student form Yerevan town. She is currently taking her Master's degree at European Academy in Armenia and she is in her first year of study. Lilit is a very responsible and hard-working person who does her best to accomplish her goals. 

This is Lilit's second Kiva loan. She took the first one to pay her prior year's university tuition. 

To be able to continue her studies this year, Lilit needs another loan. She asks lenders to support her education, ensuring stable and responsible monthly payments.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition.

loans.name: Elkin De Jesús

texts.es:
Elkin es un campesino de 46 años de edad que se gana la vida trabajando como empleado en una ladrillera y, de manera independiente se dedica a la cría y engorde de cerdos, actualmente tiene una cerda de cría y 10 lechones en proceso de engorde; el oficio lo aprendió de su familia y con los ingresos que genera, solventa sus gastos personales y ayuda al sostenimiento de un hermano.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de concentrado para alimentar a sus animales y engordarlos de manera adecuada para su futura venta, así mejorará los ingresos familiares.
Elkin manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es hacer crecer su negocio y ampliar su producción para que sea escalonada y le garantice ingresos constantes durante todo el año y mejorar  su calidad.
texts.en:
Elkin, age 46, is a rural resident. He earns his living by working as an employee at a brick factory. Elkin also raises and fattens pigs as an independent business. He currently has one breeding sow and 10 piglets that are in the process of being fattened. Elkin learned this trade from his family and the income he generates is used to pay for his personal expenses, but he also helps to support a brother.

The loan he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of concentrated feed for the diet of his animals. This will fatten them so that they will be adequate for future sale. This will improve his family’s income.

Elkin says that his greatest wish is to grow his business and increase his production in stages, which will guarantee steady income throughout the year and improve the quality of his output.

loans.use: to buy concentrated pig feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil and coal for her business.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat is a 32-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo). She has two years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the  years. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Hugo Mauricio

texts.es: hugo de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, sus cosechas las comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; el necesita invertir por eso le solicita un credito que le permita comprar semillas, insecticida, herbicida, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde realiza las siembras. Hugo tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Hugo is 45 years old and lives in his own home along with his life companion and their children. He grows corn and beans. Hugo has worked in agriculture for several years and has gained a great deal of experience, which has allowed him to achieve better harvests. The products he harvests are sold in the surrounding areas of his community. He has many customers who prefer to do business with him because of the quality and good prices of his products, but above all else, he provides good service.

Hugo needs to make an investment, so he is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, insecticides, herbicides, and other supplies. He will also pay for improvements to the land where he plants his crops. Hugo has good payment references among his acquaintances. He is very responsible and is confident that he can repay the debt within the established time period. At the same time, he believes he can achieve financial stability for his household.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, herbicides, and other supplies, and to pay for improvements to his land.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 53 years old, married and she has been blessed with four kids. She sells clothes and she has been in business for 12 years. Right now her monthly income is ksh 27,000. 

She is borrowing a loan of Kenya shillings 72,000 which she intends to use to add more stock of clothes to her business. This is her third loan after she successfully repaid her previous loans.

loans.use: to add inventory to her business.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is a 32-year-old single mother. She has been blessed with one child; she also supports her sister. Tabitha runs a grocery store and has been in this business for seven years. She earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES. 

She is borrowing a loan of 100,000 KES, which she intends to use to add more inventory of cereals to the grocery store. She plans to repay the loan with the anticipated profit from the business.

The is her first loan. Her hope and dream is to open another shop.

loans.use: To add more inventory of cereals

loans.name: Ludys María

texts.es:
Ludys, a sus 68 años de edad, aún tiene energías para luchar día a día por el bienestar de su familia; desde hace aproximadamente 10 años se dedica a trabajar en el campo de la confección y, de manera adicional tiene una tienda de abarrotes ubicada en un local propio, así logra complementar los ingresos con los que apoya a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y además ha sacado adelante a sus 8 hijos.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de una nevera y surtido al por mayor (mecato, galletería, café, granos y otros), esto le permitirá ofrecer mayor variedad de artículos para satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de los compradores, lo que aumentará el nivel de ventas e ingresos.
Ludys manifiesta que su edad no es impedimento para soñar y seguir luchando para cumplir sus metas, entre ellas la de darle continuidad y permanencia en el tiempo a su negocio, lograr atraer nuevos clientes y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Ludys, who is 69 years old, still has energy to work every day for the well-being of her family. For approximately 10 years, she has worked as a seamstress, and in addition, she has a grocery store located in its own space. Thus she manages to supplement the income with which she helps her husband with the economic needs of the household, and in addition, she has raised their 8 children.

The loan that she is applying for will be invested in the purchase of a refrigerator and wholesale stock (snacks, baked goods, coffee, grains, and other items). This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products to satisfy the tastes and needs of the buyers, which will increase her level of sales and income.

Ludys states that her age is no hindrance to dreaming and continuing to work to achieve her goals; among them are giving continuity and permanence in time to her business, managing to attract new customers, and improving the living conditions of her family group.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and wholesale stock (snacks, baked products, coffee, grains, and other items) for her store

loans.name: Akhter

texts.en: Akhter is a 47-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is Akhter’s husband. He is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses. Now his rickshaw requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Akhter has applied for a loan of 60,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation services to his passengers. Akhter is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and spare parts.

loans.name: Gazala

texts.en:
Gazala is a 34-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo) at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing goods from the market and by dealing with customers at the shop. Over time, they have become popular in their community for providing good-quality products, and they make enough to meet the expenses of their four children.

Currently, Gazala has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is a 54-year-old married woman and the mother of three. She is a hard-working mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  

She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested for a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors with the packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. 

In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors with the packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Josue Noe

texts.es:
Josué, desde hace cinco años atiende una tapicería, en la que restaura muebles, vehículos y motos, su horario es de 8:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m., una de sus ventajas es que la calidad de sus trabajos es reconocida y tiene una cartera de clientes ya establecida, dicha actividad se la enseñó su padre y con las ganancias cubre los gastos personales y apoya en los gastos de su casa. Josué es soltero y vive con sus padres.
Invertirá en la compra de espuma, telas, pegamento, grapas, clavos entre otros materiales necesarios para continuar trabajando y tener a sus clientes satisfechos, con los nuevos ingresos podrá mejorar su estilo de vida y tendrá puntualidad en sus pagos.
Su sueño es expandir su negocio para ser totalmente independiente y apoyar a sus padres.
texts.en:
For the past five years, Josué has operated an upholstery shop where he does restoration of furniture, vehicles, and motorcycles. His work schedule is from 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. One advantage that he has is that the quality of his work is recognized, so he already has a group of established customers. Josué said that he learned the trade from his father. The income he generates is used to pay for his personal expenses and it allows him to contribute toward the household expenses. Josué is single and lives with his parents.

He will invest in the purchase of foam, fabrics, glue, staples, nails, and other needed materials so that he can continue his work and keep his customers satisfied. With the new income he expects to generate, Josué can improve his lifestyle and submit his payments on time.

His dream is to expand his business so that he can become totally independent and support his parents.

loans.use: to buy foam, fabrics, glue, staples, nails, and other needed materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a mechanic's shop

loans.name: Susana Elizabeth

texts.es: Susana tiene 25 años de edad es soltera. Es una joven egresada  de la carrera de derecho y a la vez trabaja como asistente administrativa. Ella estudio la especialidad de derecho por su implicancia social y por los fines administrativos. Ella inicio a estudiar él postgrado maestría en derecho. El crédito lo invertirá en el pago de las pensiones universitarias postgrado. Su mayor deseo es sustentar las necesidades de su familia. Ella agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo que le permitirá alcanzar uno de sus objetivos más importantes de su carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Susana is 25 years old and is single. She is a young Law graduate and at the same time works as an administrative assistant. She specialized in Law for its social implications and for administrative ends. She then started to study a postgraduate master's degree in Law. 

She will invest the loan in the payment of her postgraduate university fees. Her biggest desire is to support the needs of her family. She thanks Kiva lenders for the loan which will allow her to achieve one of the most important objectives of her professional career.

loans.use: to pay postgraduate university fees

loans.name: Pula Alejandra

texts.es:
Esta es la historia de Paula Alejandra. Nació el 16 de, tiene 20 años, se encuentra realizando las prácticas luego de haber estudiado un tecnólogo este fue uno de los logros a corto plazo el cual ya está cumpliendo. 
La especialidad es como asesora comercial, a ella le encanta todo lo que tenga que ver con ventas por eso ahora ella desea seguir los estudios en la entidad CAMPO ALTO donde encontró la especialidad que deseaba MERCADEO Y VENTA, quiere estudiar esto para poder seguir con la carrera de la mejor manera.
Paula tiene como una nueva meta a corto plazo terminar las prácticas y seguir estudiando para convertirse en una excelente asesora, manejando muy bien el tema de mercadeo y ventas, se considera buena para esto pero quiere aprender cada día más sobre esta carrera, y así poder desempeñarse mejor en el trabajo y demostrar todos los conocimientos. 
El próximo logro seria terminar esta nueva carrera, ejercerla y si le es posible seguir especializándose en esta área ya que sin pensarlo fue la que más le motivo a seguir adelante con los estudios, se siente muy bien de poder realizarse en esta entidad ya que ha recibido buenas referencias de ella, desea aprovechar todos los conocimientos que la planta docente le pueda brindar para así forjarse en esta carrera. 
Sabe muy bien que adquiriendo todo este conocimiento, podrá salir adelante y seguir cumpliendo los logros y metas con la facilidad que le brindan estas entidades para poder realizarse como persona y brindarle lo mejor a los padres y a ella misma.
Esta es la historia de Paula quien desea tener un excelente futuro junto a la  familia con ayuda de los estudios y del  trabajo esforzándose cada día más para aprender de todo lo que le permita la vida y así salir  adelante. 
Paula se ve interesada en el convenio con kiva, ya que el valor de las cuotas que tiene que cancelar le disminuyen un poco en el valor y se puede economizar un poco de dinero, ya que no siempre la situación económica e la más estable y por eso a veces no le alcanza el dinero lo su suficiente, con el convenio ella puede pagar un valor de las cuotas un poco más económico para poder terminar esta otra meta que se propuso y adquirir mas conocimiento.
texts.en:
This is Paula Alendra’s story.  She was born on the 16th, and she is 20 years old.  She is now doing her practices after having studied technology.  This was one of the short term goals that she is now fulfilling.

Her specialty is being a commercial adviser.  She really likes everything that has to do with sales.  Therefore, she now wishes to continue her studies with Campo Alto.  That is where she found the specialty of Sales and Marketing that she wants.  She wants to study this in order to be able to continue with the career in the best way.

Paula’s new short term goal is to finish the practices and to continue studying.  She will do this in order to become an excellent adviser who manages sales and marketing very well.  She feels that she is good at this, but she wants to learn more every day about this career.  That way she will be able to better do the work and demonstrate her knowledge to all.

Her next achievement will be to complete this new career and to exercise it.  If it is possible, she would like to continue specializing in this area.  Without thinking about it, it was the thing that motivated her most to get ahead with her education.  She feels very good being able to fulfill herself at this entity, which has received good references.  She wishes to take advantage of all of the knowledge that the faculty is able to provide so that she can shape herself in this career.

She knows very well that by getting this knowledge she will be able to get ahead.  She will be able accomplish much and fulfill her goals.  She will do this because of the way that these entities facilitate being able to fulfill yourself as a person.  She will provide herself and her parents with the best.

This is Paula’s story.  She wants to have an excellent future with her family.  With the help of her studies, and by working hard every day to learn everything that life allows, she will get ahead.

Paula is interested in the agreement with Kiva.  The value of the payments she needs to make decreases a little, and she is able to save a little money.  However, her financial situation is not always the most stable.  At times she does not have enough money.  With the Kiva loan she will be able to make the payments more economically.  She will do this in order to be able to meet this other goal and to acquire more knowledge.

loans.use: to pay tuition for a semester.

loans.name: Ghulam  Zarina

texts.en: Ghulam Zarina is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good-quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase another cow. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She also sells animals to generate extra income.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, red oil, vegetable oil, etc.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 54 years old and he is from Nyahururu. He is married  to Grace and they are blessed with six children aged 25, 23, 20, 18, 14 and 12 years old.

He has been running his posho mill business for the last 20 years, and to enable him buy more stocks of maize for grinding and two heifers, he has applied for his third loan of 100,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya.

His monthly income right now is 20,000 KES and his intention is to use profits anticipated from his expanded business to educate those of his children who are still schooling and to pay his loan back to VisionFund Kenya.

In the future, he hopes to be a successful dairy farmer.

loans.use: to buy maize for grinding and two heifers.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, se encuentra con poco producto que ofrecer a sus clientes en la tienda, por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la comprara de pastas, jabón, boquitas, gaseosas, jugos, dulces, pan, aceite, arroz, huevos, etc., y cumplir con lo que sus clientes buscan en su negocio.
El crédito anterior le ayudo en su momento para  mejorar la variedad de mercadería de su negocio, sus clientes aumentaron, la rentabilidad a mejorado un poco y con ello se le ha facilitado cancelar sus deudas así como también ofrecer un estilo de vida más digno a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan doesn't have much produce left to sell to customers in his shop, so is asking for a new loan to invest in buying items such as pasta, soap, snacks, soft drinks, juice, sweets, bread, oil, rice and eggs. This will enable him to stock what his customers ask for in his business.

His previous loan helped him at the time to widen the variety of goods in his business. His customers increased and his profitability improved somewhat. Through this, he was able to pay off his loan and also provide his family with a more dignified way of life.

loans.use: to buy items such as pasta, soap, snacks, soft drinks, juice, sweets, bread, oil, rice and eggs.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia has successfully built her general store business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. Previously, with the help of a Kiva loan, she purchased different items needed for her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked, currently, she has requested a loan for 60000 PKR, which she will use to buy rice, sugar, grains and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she will be able to meet increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains and flour.

loans.name: Sardaran

texts.en: Sardaran is a 40-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has one cow and many buffaloes, which she uses to sell milk to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. Sardaran has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her seventh loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. She is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Maheya

texts.en:
Maheya is a 28-year-old housewife who lives with her husband, Kabul, who is 34 years old. They have three children. The children are now studying in different classes in a nearby village school of Maynaguri. Maheya and her husband are both illiterate and only can sign their names. 

Maheya’s husband is a farmer by profession and cultivates different types of vegetables on their own land. Now she wishes to cultivate eggplants to generate more income. Having their own land and experience in the agricultural field is the reason for choosing this business. 

Maheya is confident that she will be able to grow her business by farming eggplants because there is a great demand for eggplants in her locality. 

They don’t have a concrete house now, so in the future she wants to build a concrete house with the profit she earns from her business. She dreams her children will lead a very successful life with a good education. She is a lady with great enthusiasm and never wants to stop fighting.

 Her earnest thanks go to Kiva and BJS for getting the loan in her crucial time.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers to cultivate eggplants on her own land.

loans.name: Esmeralda Yaneth

texts.es:
Esmeralda, ha contribuido al mejoramiento de las circunstancias familiares y cumplido con los pagos puntuales de sus cuotas y ha sido a gracias a los nuevos ingresos que obtiene de su negocio, pues con el préstamo anterior conto con los insumos necesarios para fortalecer el negocio.
El capital que requiere lo invertirá en la compra de maíz, leña, concentrado, pollos y vacunas, así continuara elaborando la venta de tortillas y tendrá pollos en mejores condiciones que le faciliten su comercialización
texts.en:
Esmeralda has contributed to the improvement of her family circumstances and has complied punctually with her loan repayments. This has been thanks to new profits she has obtained from her business, as from the previous loan she had the necessary supplies to strengthen the business.

The capital that she requires will be invested in the purchase of corn, firewood, chicken feed, chickens and vaccines, so that she can continue developing the sale of tortillas and will have chickens in better condition which will facilitate commercialization.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, chicken feed, chickens and vaccines

loans.name: Gloria Veronica

texts.es: La señora Gloria tiene 29 años, tiene dos hijos de las edades de 5 años y un bebe de 2 meses, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa interior lencería, ella tiene su puesto de venta en una de las ferias más concurridas de la ciudad de La Paz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la señora Gloria,  va a usar este préstamo para compra de ropa al por mayor  y así surtir su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su mercadería, la señora Gloria enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando  mercadería y así de esta manera genera más ingresos económicos, se siente feliz ya agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan para crecer en su actividad, mejorara sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en: Gloria is 29 years old. She has two children: a 5 year old and a two month old baby. She works selling underwear and lingerie. She has a market stall in one of the most well attended markets (ferias) of the city of La Paz. This loan is her first loan cycle within the institution. Gloria is going to use this loan to buy underwear at wholesale prices, and in this way stock up her business. Her reason for requesting this loan is to increase her merchandise. Gloria faces challenges in her business, such as competition. She is going to use the benefits to keep on buying merchandise and in this way she will generate more financial income. She feels happy and grateful for the chance they give her to grow her business, improve her earnings and therefore the quality of her life and her family's.

loans.use: To buy underwear at wholesale prices

loans.name: Yuliana

texts.en:
Yuliana lives north of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. She manages a small shop selling mobile phone airtime credit. Yuliana is married and lives with three persons in the family home. 

Yuliana joined Ruma one month ago because she was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credit. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Yuliana sees improvements in her shop. For the last month, she has earned an average of $2 - $3 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  

She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends. Her goal for her business is to expand and have more new business in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina is a 35 year-old married woman. She is been running a beauty parlor for the past two years. She offers many services to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through her best services she has becomes very famous in her street. In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying an additional variety of cosmetic products for the parlor.  But because of having low cash in hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She is hopeful to increase her customers over time.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 48 years old, from Nyandarua, and is married. They have three children who are aged between 22 and 15 years old.

Margaret has a farming business that she has been running for the past seven years, and has applied for her fourth loan. She intends to use the money to buy a cow that will help her produce milk for sale.

She hopes to expand her business in the near future and pay school fees.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles, a tailor in Nairobi town, used his previous loan to pay school fees for his child who is in high school. 

He will be using this loan to purchase more materials for use in his tailoring business. This will enable him to serve more customers and also meet their demands. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more fabric materials as well as repay the loan.

This is his eighth loan term from VisionFund Kenya and he has been repaying his previous loans successfully. In future, Charles hopes to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase fabric materials for tailoring

loans.name: Alia

texts.en: Alia, age 30, is a married woman.  She deals in animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her sixth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en: Shakeela is a 33-year-old married woman and the mother of three. She is doing tailoring to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of the household with the educational needs of children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons and laces in different colors. In this way, she will be able to meet with the increasing demand. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons and laces in different colors.

loans.name: Sin Fronteras Group

texts.es: Milena pertenece al grupo “Sin Fronteras”, es casada madre de tres hijos ya mayores, Milena se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza 5 horas diarias, lo que más le gusta de este negocio es estar en contacto con la gente y se siente orgullosa de ello, sus principales clientes son sus amigas y familiares, agradece a EDAPROSPO por el préstamo adquirido  por que así puede comprar más productos  para poder surtir su pequeño stand que tiene en su casa, ya que su meta es llegar a tener un bazar, se siente orgullosa de poder  contar con inversionistas como KIVA  por que en la actualidad hay pocas personas que brindan ayuda sin  recibir nada a cambio. “Gracias KIVA por el apoyo que nos brindan y poder seguir trabajando.”
texts.en:
Milena belongs to the group "Sin Fronteras" [Without Boarders]. She is married and mother of three grown children. Milena works in the business of selling beauty products for five hours, daily. Being in contact with people is what she likes most about this business and she is proud of that. Her primary customers are her friends and family. 

She is grateful for EDAPROSPO for the loan because now she can buy more products to stock the small stand in her house. Her goal is to have a store. 

She feels proud to be able to count on lenders like Kiva because there are few people who offer help without receiving anything in return. 

"Thank you, Kiva, for the help that you give us to keep working."

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit lives in the village of Getahovit in the Tavush region. With her husband, Anahit runs a farm and is also engaged in agricultural activities. They have a daughter who is still school-aged. Anahit has no higher education and she has always been busy with farming. On her farm, she has five cows, four calves, a pig and three piglets. The care of the farm cattle is Anahit’s duty, but land cultivation she has trusted to her husband. On their plot of land they have a fruit garden and they gather a great assortment of greens from it, and also potatoes.  Half of their farm products are for sale and the half for their family use.
Anahit asks for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams since she wants to add to her pigs. She wants to buy two pigs of a new sort, and also some animal fodder.

loans.use: to buy two pigs of a new sort, and also some animal fodder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pepper, salt, onions, palm oil, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en: Naheed is a 55-year-old married woman. She has a business selling cloth in her locality. She buys cloth of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells it to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her third loan cycle and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. This will help her to purchase bundles of cloth in different colors and designs. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila was born in 1964. She is a self-dependent single lady living with her parents in Irbid, Jordan. As Jamila is the only daughter for her family, she decided to support them financially by running her tailoring business 12 years ago after she gained experience from working in a sewing workshop in the past.  She decided to work independently to raise her profit. She is now applying for a loan to buy another sewing machine that makes different styles in order to add variety to her business and raise her profit.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine that makes different styles

loans.name: Dismas

texts.en:
Dismas is a farmer living and working in the Kisii area of South Nyanza, Kenya.  He has been farming for four years, with his primary income source being eggs and a retail business.  His biggest challenge in farming is diseases affecting both crops and livestock.
He chose Juhudi Kilimo because of the better services they offer as compared to other mfis, and the interest rate on their loans is lower.  Through this loan, he will purchase a dairy cow which will add to his monthly output and thus lead to more income. This will lead to an upgrade in their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nazeli

texts.en: Nazeli is a student from Spitak town. She lives with her parents and school age sister. Nazeli's mother is a teacher and her father is an army officer. They both work hard to sustain their children's living and provide them with normal living conditions. Nazeli has applied for this loan to be able to pay for her university tuition. She will be very grateful if lenders support her with her educational costs and give her an opportunity to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Dolores Armida

texts.es:
Dolores, se dispone hacer los preparativos para la surtir su negocio con los productos que están teniendo mayor demanda, ella solicita un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en la compra de pescado, piñas, tomates, pepino, repollos, papas, güisquiles, chiles, le ayudara a brindar productos frescos a sus clientes.
El efecto que tuvo el crédito anterior fue muy positivo porque surtió mas el negocio, sus nuevas ventas le permiten tener ingresos con los que sale adelante con su familia, actualmente ya ha comprado otro puesto en el mercado municipal.
texts.en: Dolores has made arrangements for her business to have products which are under greater demand. She has applied for a new loan to invest in the purchase of fish, pineapples, tomatoes, cucumber, cabbage, potatoes, squash, and chiles to help provide fresh produce to her customers. The effect of her previous loan was positive because it brought in more business. Her new sales allow her to to have the income to move forward with her family. Now, she has already purchased another stand in the municipal market.

loans.use: to purchase fish, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.es: La señora Jeannette de 29 años de edad, vive con su conyugue, tiene un grado de instrucción de nivel bachiller y  con su pareja tuvo 1 hijo que es dependiente de sus ingresos.  Vive al este de la ciudad, es una persona muy responsable y tiene muchas ganas de superarse, por ello trabaja arduamente todos los días.  Su principal actividad es el servicio, su cargo es de obrera en el área de lavado de una empresa reconocida en la cuidad,  con una antigüedad de 6 años de experiencia en el rubro, su esposo también trabaja y su cargo es de ayudante de producción, como sus sueldos son muy bajos se dedican al servicio de transporte, actualmente solicita un crédito para el pago del anticrético de su vivienda ya que ahora viven en alquiler, así ahorraría o invertiría ese dinero en algo productivo y ya no gastaría en ese pago mensual porque apenas le alcanza para sobrevivir todo el mes.
texts.en: The married woman Jeannette is 29 years old and lives with her husband. She has a high school degree. She has one son with her husband who is dependent on her income. She lives in the eastern part of town. She is a very responsible person who is eager to excel and work hard everyday. Her main activity is a laundry service with a renowned company in the city. She has 6 years of experience working. Her husband also works. He is an assistant in a factory. Their salaries are very low so they began a transportation service. She is seeking a loan for an anticrético agreement for her home [a contract to rent property whereby the renter pays the landlord a fixed sum at the start of the rental period in lieu of paying monthly rent; at the end of the rental period, the tenant receives the sum back, in full, from the landlord, thus resulting in rent-free living]. She currently pays rent and wants to save or invest the money into something productive instead and not spend it on a monthly rent payment because they have just enough to survive each month.

loans.use: to pay for an "anticrético" agreement for her home

loans.name: Tripti

texts.en:
Tripti is a rural woman of 47 years, married and blessed with only one son.  She is married to Hansaraj, 50 years old.  Tripti attended school up to grade five, but her husband is illiterate. As Tripti could not continue her education, she is determined to educate her son properly and make him a professional.  She tries her best to provide all sorts of help to her son who is a college student.  They live in Netajipara in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Tripti's husband runs a small grocery shop in their house. He has had a retailing business for almost seven years.  His income from his business is usually spent on their daily expenses and especially on food expenses.  Tripti, though a housewife, helps her husband in his work after completing her household jobs. But due to having inadequate capital to run the shop, they cannot earn much profit from this shop to give them a decent lifestyle.

Tripti heard about BJS and has taken a loan from them. She wants to purchase grocery items such as rice, oil, flour, bread, biscuits etc. to help her husband to expand his business for the betterment of her family.

She hopes that her business will continue to improve and be more profitable to fulfill her dream of enhancing her business in the future to get a better and secure life.

She is grateful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase food products and grocery items to sell

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 22-year-old engaged man living with his parents in Sana'a, Yemen. He is a university graduate.  

He has a medical center and earns a good profit from it. He started up his business five years ago. In the beginning, he started in a small clinic in his area. Year by year, Mohammed accumulated a good amount of money and opened a medical center.  Due to a humble capacity in the center, he hasn't been able to accept all the patients who come to the medical center; therefore, he applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase medicines, drugs, and medical requirements for the center.

Mohammed looks forward to expanding his center and opening other branches in the capital. He wishes to open a savings account in AMB and build a nice house for himself.

loans.use: To purchase medicines, drugs, and medical requirements for the center

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор жизнерадостная женщина в возрасте 47 лет. Она живет в городе Дангара с 23-летним сыном, невесткой и внуком. В течение 9 лет Гулбахор занимается торговлей. У нее маленький продуктовый магазин, где она продает продукты питания, в частности, печенье, вафли, макароны, растительное масло, чай, сахар, сок и газированные напитки, рис, горох и т.д. Клиенты всегда остаются довольными ее обслуживанием, так как она предлагает им свежие и качественные товары. Сейчас Гулбахор просит кредит, чтобы закупить новый ассортимент продуктов. Она надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Gulbahor is a cheerful woman, age 47. She lives in Dangara with her 23-year-old son, daughter-in-law and grandson. For the last nine years Gulbahor has operated a retail business. She has a small grocery store where she sells food products such as cookies, wafers, pasta, vegetable oil, tea, sugar, juice, carbonated beverages, rice, peas, and so forth. Customers are always happy with her service and her fresh, high-quality products. Gulbahor is requesting a loan to purchase a new range of products. She hopes for support.

loans.use: to buy food products and expand her business

loans.name: Facunda

texts.es: La señora Facunda tiene 53 años, casada con dos hijos de las edades de 23 y  19 años, ella se dedica a la venta de variedad de ropa, ella vende sus productos en su puesto de venta  que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Villa Fátima, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la señora Facunda,  va a usar este préstamo para compra de ropa al por mayor  según la temporada y así surtir su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su mercadería, la señora Facunda enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando  mercadería y así de esta manera genera más ingresos económicos, se siente feliz ya agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan para crecer en su actividad, mejorara sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Facunda is 53 years old.  She is married and has two children ages 23 and 19.  She works selling a variety of clothing, which she sells in a store located in the Villa Fátima zone.  This is her first loan with the institution.  Facunda will use the loan to purchase clothing for the season in bulk, with which she will stock her business.  Her reason for requesting this loan is to increase her inventory.  Facunda faces challenges in her business that include competition, and she will use her earnings to continue purchasing merchandise so that she can generate greater earnings.  She is happy and grateful for the opportunity she has been given to grow in her business, improve her income and her quality of life.

loans.use: purchase clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es: La señora Pamela tiene 30 años tiene un hijo que tiene la edad de 9 años, ella  se dedica a la venda y distribución de productos naturales, tiene su tienda en la zona central de la ciudad de La Paz este préstamo es su  primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la  señora Pamela va a usar este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción para refacción de su departamento  y asi brindar comodidad a su familia, la señora Pamela enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la cliente debe presentar siempre buena actitud para la venta de estos productos ya que no es la única que distribuye esta línea de productos y siempre debe de estar predispuesta a superarse constantemente. va a utilizar los beneficios ahorrar más e invertir en su negocio el cual es de mucha productividad para la cliente,  el deseo de la señora Pamela es expandir a nivel nacional los productos que ofrece y así lograr consolidarse en la distribución y comercio de los productos de esta línea.
texts.en: Pamela is 30 years of age and has a 9 year old son. She makes her living from the sale and distribution of natural products, and has her shop in central La Paz. This loan is her first loan cycle with the institution. Pamela will use this loan in order to purchase construction materials for the refurbishment of her apartment, thereby offering comfort to her family. Pamela faces challenges in her business, where she always needs to show a good attitude in the sale of these products as she is not the only one to distribute this line of products, and she always needs to be willing to constantly improve herself. She will use the proceeds to save more and invest in her business which is very productive for her. Pamela's wish is to expand the products she offers to a national level and thereby consolidate herself in the distribution and trade of this line of products.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for the refurbishment of her apartment

loans.name: Ararat

texts.en:
Ararat lives in Kapan city in the Syunik region of Armenia. He graduated from Kapan Mountain Mining Industry College's faculty of Geology. For 10 years he worked at the Kapan mountain mine as a senior specialist, then he worked at a private workshop as a chief of the department of commerce, but at this moment the only occupation that he is engaged in and greatly interested in is bee keeping. He has 50 bee families. As he says, bees feel the care, love, and even fear that man may feel towards them, and they treat you as you treat them. Bee keeping demands a lot of time and patience. As he describes, it is the most beautiful thing when you see how the honey, amber in color, flows in the pot and at the same time you catch in the air the scent of the flowers’ bouquet, from the nectar of which bees made their magic honey. Ararat started bee keeping 20 years ago and still he runs it with greater enthusiasm and love.
Ararat is married and he has 2 daughters, who are already married and live separately with their families. Ararat is asking for a loan of 250.000 Armenian drams since he wants to buy wax paper, frames and cord for his bees. He prepares everything beforehand since at the end of spring it will be time for honey winnowing.

loans.use: to buy wax paper, frames and cord for his bees. He prepares everything beforehand since at the end of spring it will be time for honey winnowing

loans.name: Nadys Soleyda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Nadys, opta por un  nuevo crédito para tener la materia prima para elaborar las pupusas, comprara frijoles, chicharrón, vinagre, harina, quesillo, bebidas, condimentos, etc., foto fue tomada dentro de su casa.
El préstamo anterior le dio como resultado positivo una mejor imagen de su negocio, conto con los materiales necesarios para elaborar la venta y obtuvo mayores ganancias; ha mejorado su vivienda con la compra de electrodomésticos.
texts.en:
Nadys is requesting a new loan in order to have the ingredients she needs to make her pupusas. She will buy beans, pork rinds, vinegar, flour, cheese, drinks, spices, etc. This photo was taken inside her house.

The positive result from her previous loan is that her business' image has improved. She was able to get what she needed in order to make sales and make a higher profit. She also improved her home by purchasing appliances.

loans.use: to buy beans, pork rinds, vinegar, flour, cheese, drinks, spices, etc.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 43 years old, married and has been blessed with 4 children with her spouse. She has a maize mill business and also does farming. She has been in this business for 4 years and it has been profitable.

Margaret has applied for a loan which she intends to use to buy more stock of maize for milling and thereby have enough stock of maize flour for selling. Margaret will also buy fertilizer for planting. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to supply maize to schools, repay her loan and save more.

This is her 1st loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable and expand her maize milling business.

loans.use: to buy maize for making making maize flour.

loans.name: Siran

texts.en:
Siran and her family have been involved in cattle breeding for 16 years. Siran is from the Verishen village where she lives with her husband and mother-in-law. 

Her children are married and live separately with their families. Siran and her husband are hardworking farmers and over these 16 years of tireless work, they were able to have a sustainable farming business.

The only income earning activity that the family is involved in is cattle breeding, Siran would like to expand the livestock.  She has applied for this loan of USD 3,000 to be able to purchase three more calves and forage for the livestock. This will be a big support for Siran's farm and she hopes for lenders’ support.

loans.use: to pay for three calves and forage for the livestock

loans.name: Dianna

texts.en:
Dianna is a mother of three children, and lives with them in Qaraberd village. Her husband is a migrant worker in a neighboring country. For sustaining her children’s' living, Dianna herself has been running a farm. She works hard to provide them with appropriate living conditions. 
Dianna's elder daughter Anjela is a student and specializes in pedagogy. For Diana education of her children is the most important thing in life so she does her best to save money. Current financial difficulties have led Dianna to apply for this loan. She is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to be able to cover her daughter Anjela's university tuition. This loan is important for them and they hope to have your support.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter Anjela's university tuition

loans.name: Elci Paola

texts.es:
Elci Paola vive en Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas ciudad de la región costa, con un clima agradable. Ciudad comercial y conocida porque habita la etnia Tsachila. Elci Paola tiene 32 años, se encuentra casada con Darwin con quien tiene dos hijitos, ellos están estudiando en una escuelita cercana a su domicilio. Elci Paola trabaja en las tardes vendiendo cosméticos, ella recorre y visita a su clientela fija, cuenta ya con dos años de experiencia, la conocen mucho en el sector. 
Su esposo Darwin trabaja en empresa eléctrica de lector de medidores, lleva trabajando varios años. Con sus ingresos y con los ingresos de Elci han podido construir su casa, la misma que tiene un local y desean aprovecharlo ya que es esquinero, por ello acudieron a Fundación Alternativa ya que necesita para comprar vitrinas y mercadería ya que cuenta con muy poca para poner el negocio de la venta de cosméticos ahora ya estable porque viene en camino otro bebé y se le complicaría un poco recorrer con su mercadería, para ello necesita poner el negocio en el local de su domicilio y así poco a poco poder surtirlo de otra mercadería de bazar.
Gracias al crédito otorgado por la Fundación y a KIVA podrá comprar  lo que necesita, se siente muy feliz ya que podrá crecer en su negocio y con ello mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Elci Paola lives in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, a city on the coast with an agreeable climate.  It is a commercial city that is well known because the Tsachila ethnic group lives there.  Elci Paola is 32 years old.  She is married to Darwin, with whom she has two children who attend school close to their home.  Elci Paola works in the afternoons selling cosmetics.  She travels to visit her regular customers.  She has two years of experience and she is very well known in the region.  Her husband, Darwin, works for an electric company reading meters.  He has worked there for many years.  With his earnings and Elci's earnings, they were able to build their home, where she also has her store that they hope to take advantage of because it is on a corner.

She approached Fundación Alternativa because she was in need of purchasing display cases and merchandise because she has too few to open the cosmetics store in her home.  She wants to be more stable because she has a baby on the way and it will be difficult to travel with her merchandise, which is why she needs to run the business from the store in her home.  Little by little, she will stock it with other assorted merchandise.  

Thanks to the loan from Fundación Alternativa and Kiva, she will be able to purchase what she needs.  She is happy because she will be able to grow in her business and with that improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: purchase display cases and merchandise.

loans.name: Tulobala

texts.en:
Tulobala is a 30-year-old married woman.  She lives with her husband and three daughters in a small town in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.  Both Tulobala and her husband are illiterate and just know how to sign their names.  Due to poverty, they could not receive an education. One of their daughters is a student in grade three.

Tulobala is a housewife and her husband is a cycle-van puller. A cycle- van is one kind of transport that carries people from one place to another, especially in remote places. But their income from the business is very scant.  From the beginning, they have faced many problems in running the family.   Her husband pulls the van and carries goods and vegetables to the market.  He is the only earning member in the family. But their cycle van has been damaged due to an accident.  So, now it is very difficult for him to run his business and the family. He needs to purchase a new cycle-van immediately.

Thus, Tulobala has applied for a loan from BJS to help her husband by purchasing a new cycle-van.  Now, they hope that their condition will be improved and they will overcome the financial crisis they are facing now.

Tulobala aspires to buy an auto rickshaw with the profit earned from this business and her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle-van

loans.name: Fidaije

texts.en:
Fidaije makes and sells handicraft items to earn her living. She operates a small store at her home in Kosovo, in the southern part of Kosovo where she lives with her husband and three children. Fidaije genuinely enjoys her work.  Customers visit her store every day. She has run this business for several years and it is going very well, thanks to the committed effort she puts into her work.  Fidaije’s husband works on construction but with a very low salary.

They live in a house which is in need of renovation, but she hasn't had a chance to do so. She has requested a loan from KosInvest in order to renovate her house. She hopes this loan will improve the living conditions for her family. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders for improving the family's conditions and standard of living! Her goal is to earn a higher income and to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To renovate her house

loans.name: Deo

texts.en: Deo is a repeat borrower who is 42 years old and married with 5 children. He deals in cattle rearing and banana planting, which he still does on a small scale. Due to limited resources like capital and land he has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to improve on his farming. He has a challenge of getting little milk from his commercial farming and the low market purchase for matoke (bananas), so he decided to come to UGAFODE for a loan to purchase veterinary drugs and manure. He thinks this will improve his productivity and sales in the long run.

loans.use: to buy veterinary drugs and organic manure

loans.name: Kanchan

texts.en:
Kanchan is a 26-year-old married woman with two children. Her husband is 30 years old. Kanchan has studied up to grade eight and her husband has received an education up to grade nine. Both children are receiving an education. 

Her husband is engaged in centering work and she is a housewife. Unfortunately, the income is not enough, so Kanchan wanted to find another way to make money. They have struggled a lot, but now Kanchan does not want her children to suffer from poverty. Kanchan is a very ambitious lady, so she decided to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a cow so that she can earn money by selling milk and milk products in the market. She took a loan of INR 14,000 from BJS and hopes that their business will flourish and their economic status will rise. This will help her to give a bright future to her children. 

They are thankful to BJS and Kiva for giving them the support to start their new dairy business.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to sell milk & milk products.
